items.title: Senior Accountant
items.content:
Senior Accountant at Peerfit

Remote
  • Accounting/Finance
  • United States

Interested in working for a team of people completely redefining how fitness and health care work together? At Peerfit, were flipping wellness reimbursements on their head by connecting insurers and employers wellness dollars to popular fitness studios offering CrossFit, yoga, barre, boot camp, cycling, and more. If working with a team of innovative and driven people who are modernizing how people engage with wellness excites you, look no further than Peerfit.

POSITION SUMMARY:

As a Senior Accountant, you will be responsible for performing duties that assist the Controller in day-to-day core accounting functions taking ownership of key areas. Core areas include general ledger accounting, account reconciliations and financial statement preparation all in compliance with GAAP; state reporting, filing and compliance for multi-states including sales tax; budgeting/forecast model maintenance and financial analysis; audit and tax return preparation for year-end, payroll backup including compliance oversight and reporting; accounts payable and accounts receivable processing including expense report approvals, unclaimed property reporting and 1099 processing; record organization and retention. The Senior Accountant works closely with other finance team staff as well as other Peerfit team members.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for month-end close duties. These duties include but not limited to: bank reconciliations, credit card reconciliations, payroll liability reconciliations, prepaid journal entries and reconciliations, bill.com reconciliations, preparation of financial statements, and other month end close research and reconciliations that may be needed. Understand the journal entries being made and why and review these respective sections for overall reasonableness.
  • Responsible for monthly revenue cycle invoicing and reporting. Ensure that clients are invoiced properly, revenue is recognized appropriately and in the proper period, monthly reports are reconciled to Looker, and any other duties that ensure proper revenue recognition.
  • Responsible for assisting Controller with budget process. These duties include but are not limited to: preparing and maintaining budget templates, gathering data through working with others, analyzing data to ensure reasonable, reconciling department roll-ups and loading approved budgets into accounting software.
  • Responsible for maintaining the equity accounting reporting. This includes and not limited to maintaining the awarded options reconciliation and vesting schedules as well as any other reconciliation and reports to provide proper equity accounting.
  • Responsible for expense report approvals and ensuring each expense has appropriate detail support which includes meeting IRS requirements, internal approvals, GL coding, and correct posting dates for accurate recording and integration into accounting software.
  • Responsible for understanding the payroll process and become the backup for such function in the case the payroll processor has scheduled PTO or emergencies. Ensure payroll entries and corresponding benefits are recorded accurately and timely. Reconcile payroll liability accounts and perform monthly accruals as necessary. Stay abreast of payroll compliance issues and concerns and alert management of any issues.
  • Responsible for ensuring bill.com payments are being processed timely and accurately. Review outstanding bills. Reconcile sync error report and reach out to appropriate team on how to resolve. Monitor expiring/expiring checks and work with appropriate team to resolve and document filing unclaimed property reports as necessary.
  • Responsible for daily bank activity review, matching of activity within QuickBooks, and journal entries as needed.
  • Responsible for preparing state compliance filings for payroll taxes, state taxes, sales tax and unclaimed property.
  • Responsible for year-end audit and tax preparation work, ensuring all financial information reconciles by account and state. Work closely with audit firm and Controller on providing timely and accurate information. Ensure records are maintained in an efficient manner to provide tax firm with organized and accurate financial information.
  • Responsible for year end 1099 reporting and documentation.
  • Responsible for ensuring accounting compliance and controls in accordance with GAAP, security/ privacy and HIPAA.
  • Organize permanent records in logical folders/ subfolders on Google Drive, ensuring all required documentation is saved timely with appropriate naming convention.
  • Provide positive support and training to junior accountant and administrative personnel that may or may not have accounting backgrounds.
  • Other duties as assigned.

EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelors in Accounting degree required
  • Minimum 5-year experience in a corporate accounting role required
  • Sales Tax Experience – Strongly preferred
  • CPA strongly preferred

WHO WE NEED: (Intangibles)

  • Passionate about health and fitness
  • Desires to have a role in the growth of a startup
  • Stays motivated and knows how to be persistent
  • Is self-directed
  • Can work remotely and make decisions autonomously at a high level
  • Flexibility to handle changing responsibilities

WHAT YOU GET:

  • The opportunity to help expand the impact of Peerfit across the United Statesand, someday, the world!
  • The chance to work in a relaxed, yet goal-driven start-up culture with a passion for fitness
  • Peerfit credits to attend fitness classes.
  • Chance to work remotely with flexible scheduling
  • Health Insurance & other benefits

Peerfit is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Apply for job

items.content:
Account Executive at TierPoint

Remote

Job Locations: US-IL-Chicago | US-Remote

ID: 2019-1048

Category: Sales

Department: 910 – Sales: West and Strategic

Type: Regular Full-Time

Overview

We have career opportunities in our Sales Group for an Account Executive. In this position you will build Sales relationships by prospecting for new clients, and nurturing existing customer relationships. You will coordinate between Clients and various internal teams to ensure a productive and smooth Client experience. The Account Executive role requires a motivated hunter, who has outstanding sales and relational skills. The Account Executive reports to the Regional Vice President, Sales.

Responsibilities

  • Provides quality internal and external customer service surrounding the Company values.
  • Direct responsibility for the identification, contact, qualification and development of viable new accounts.
  • Manage the prospecting plan development and execution for new accounts at a very high level.
  • Manage the communication and internal coordination of TierPoint sales support.
  • Accurate and timely forecasting.
  • Manage the on-going need to understand inter-related technologies that exist and keep current on new options as the business technologies expand and change
  • Responsible for the development, execution, and delivery of quality solution focused client presentations at a “C” level.
  • Find, train and develop indirect sales channels.
  • Manage the prospecting plan development and execution for new accounts at a very high level.
  • Responsible for the development, execution, and delivery of quality solution focused client presentations at a C level.
  • Within existing TierPoint accounts, direct responsibility for the identification, contact, qualification and development of viable new opportunities for services that aren’t being used today.
  • Manage assigned customer relationships to ensure a high level of customer satisfaction, a strong inclination toward contract renewal, and the enhancement of the TierPoint relationship with that customer through the sale of additional services.
  • Manage the communication and internal coordination of TierPoint sales support infrastructure: sales support, operations, and executive team to insure customer satisfaction.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Qualifications / Requirements

  • College Degree preferred but will consider applicants with equivalent work-related experience with a minimum educational requirement of a H.S. Diploma or GED equivalent.
  • Must possess extraordinary drive to pursue opportunities both within the target client as well as to marshal the necessary resources within TierPoint to ensure strong solution creation and implementation of the strategy once accepted.
  • Candidates must possess exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Many of the sales activities are limited to these forms of communication and proficiency at a high level is mandatory.
  • Exceptional presentation skills are mandatory. The ability to present to a large audience of C level decision makers persuasively and with ease is mandatory.
  • Proven talent for making effective cold calls to target companies highly preferred
  • Proven expertise to develop relationships from a cold call or networking activity highly preferred.
  • Proven ability to listen, extrapolate information and leverage resources to effectively provide solutions to customer needs.
  • Ability to effectively learn technical products, services and solutions and readily apply new knowledge required
  • Minimum of 5 years of successful sales experience within a large technical account environment: previous proven expertise in managed services, data center services, Cloud-IaaS, consulting and hardware/software solutions.
  • A Driven, Positive, Upbeat Attitude. Ability to work collaboratively with multiple departments across the organization.
  • Familiarity and commitment to daily activity tracking in corporate CRM tool.
  • Any background with advanced sales training systems is advantageous.
  • We’re looking for a competitive contributor who envisions themselves elevating their career with TierPoint.
  • Candidate must possess a valid driver’s license.
  • Adequate professional experience and knowledge to perform Job Responsibilities.
  • Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to prioritize and organize effectively.
  • Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Ability to work both independently and with others.
  • Ability to operate in a fast moving, team-oriented, collaborative environment with tight deadlines.
  • Proficiency in using MS Office Suite and Windows-based computer applications.

TierPoint, LLC is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, disability, pregnancy, protected medical condition, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status covered by applicable local, state or federal law. If you’d like to view a copy of the company’s affirmative action plan or policy statement, please email zachary.mallin@tierpoint.com. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Zachary Mallin at 914-610-7834 or zachary.mallin@tierpoint.com. This telephone line and email address is reserved solely for job seekers with disabilities requesting accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Please do not call about the status of your job application if you do not require accessibility assistance or an accommodation. Messages left for other purposes, such as following up on an application or non-disability related technical issues, will not receive a response. items.title: Account Executive, Mid-Market
items.content:
Account Executive, Mid-Market at LogicMonitor

Remote

Sales, Remote-based

About Us:

LogicMonitor is the leading SaaS based performance monitoring platform for enterprise IT.

We are a company of fun-loving, hard-working achievers. We love going to work and think you should too. We hold our company culture near and dear — we are customer-obsessed, work as one team, and strive to be better every day. These are our core values. So it’s no surprise that we work hard and genuinely have fun working with each other to achieve great things together.

This position can be remote-based, offering you the flexibility to work out of your home office full-time. You’ll have easy access to and support from your manager and frequent video meetings to keep you plugged into your team. When you join LogicMonitor, you will be working alongside some of the brightest minds in one of the fastest growing global software firms. We are looking for you to bring your expertise, drive, and passion. This is your chance to join us on our journey as we expand our global presence and achieve record-breaking success.

What You’ll Do:

The Account Executive at LogicMonitor is a hunter role, who is to schedule meeting with target accounts and build a compelling business case for LogicMonitor. We’re looking for goal oriented candidates who understand how to attack a territory and get meetings with decision makers.

Through our sales process, our Account Executive will successfully discover and present the value of LogicMonitor to prospects, manage the entire sales cycle, and successfully win new business for the Company. The Account Executive acts as the primary contact for prospects managing the entire sales experience for each prospect within their territory. The Account Executive is responsible for self-identifying and outreaching to Target Accounts within their territory, and working with their team’s Inside Sales Reps to strategize and execute on additional outbound messaging for pipeline creation. The Account Executive will call on Sales Engineer resources for technical expertise so that the prospect fully experiences the product and understands the technical aspects of the LogicMonitor platform.

The Account Executive will coordinate professional service scoping calls and customer success hand-over calls with the customer. The Account Executive will also work closely with Marketing counterparts, and the broader LogicMonitor team. Finally, the Account Executive must accurately forecast their sales opportunities back to the LogicMonitor Management Team.

Here’s a closer look at your duties in this key role:

  • Identify and prospect into target account
  • Perform Account Executive duties on trial calls as scheduled. Includes understanding the prospects business pain points and product needs
  • Present LogicMonitor value to prospects through conversations, demos, presentations
  • Implement LogicMonitor sales methodology / sales process to move prospects through the sales cycle
  • Assist prospects progress through sales cycle by engaging necessary levels, “multi-threading” and team selling (using SE, management, executive resources as necessary)
  • Trial optimization (proactively adding dashboards, creating sample reports, etc. for all trial prospects)
  • Learn how LogicMonitor solves customer problems, and be able to tailor the solution to various specific scenarios.
  • Identify all technical issues of assigned accounts to assure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the sales process.

What You’ll Need:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent
  • 3+ years of selling success, preferably selling into IT and/or Enterprise SaaS software
  • Proficiency in oral and written communication skills
  • Strategic and solution sales capabilities that support selling value to business professionals
  • Very strong technical aptitude
Apply for job

items.title: Introductory Accounting Tutor
items.content:
Introductory Accounting Tutor at Pearson

Remote | Part-time

Remote, Work From Home in United States

Introductory Accounting Tutor — Remote, Work From Home

Description

Smarthinking, a Pearson service unit, is hiring an experienced, educated individual to serve as a part-time online tutor in Introductory Accounting: Smarthinking provides online tutoring to support colleges, universities, high schools, and individuals. Online tutors work to ensure the tutoring team is delivering a high quality service for students at various academic levels as they master accounting thought.

  • Introductory Accounting covers the fundamental parts of Financial Accounting and Managerial Accounting
  • Financial Accounting covers topics including The Accounting Cycle, Journal & Adjusting Entries, T-Accounts, Ledgers, Worksheets, Financial statements, Payroll Basics, Inventory, Depreciation and Long Term Assets, Long term Liabilities, Statement of cash flow, Partnerships and Capital Stock Transactions
  • Managerial Accounting covers topics including Financial ratios, Job and Process costing, Cost Volume Profit (CVP) Analysis, Budgeting,Differential Analysis, and Variance Analysis
  • Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
  • At Pearson and within Smarthinking, we work to facilitate a culture of professional reflection and consistent quality among our teams of tutors. A tutor can work from any location with computer and reliable high-speed Internet access.

Qualifications

To qualify for this position, individuals must have:

  • Advanced coursework or graduate degree in business or accounting.
  • College-level teaching or tutoring experience in one or more of these accounting subjects, preference given for individuals with CPA, CMA, CIA or advanced teaching experience.
  • Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills.
  • Strong typing and computer skills.
  • An enthusiasm for online education and a passion for helping students master accounting concepts.
  • This is a remote position that will require tutors to work out of a location with reliable access to a computer and the Internet.
  • Candidates must reside in the United States and, if hired, be able to provide documentation regarding eligibility to work in the United States.
  • Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Primary Location: United States

Job: Learning Delivery

Organization: North America

Employee Status: Regular Employee

Job Type: Standard

Shift: Day Job

Schedule: Part-time Regular

Req ID: 1907412

Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

items.content:
IT Manager at Cloudbeds

Remote | International
  • San Diego, CA
  • Full Time
  • IT Operations
  • Experienced

Cloudbeds is a travel industry startup that works to make the world a more welcome place. We make advanced cloud-based hospitality software for hotels, hostels, vacation rentals and groups that manages reservations and guests, distributes room availability, sells inventory, and collects payments. Our hundreds of team members are distributed across over 30 countries and, altogether, we speak 20+ languages. How do we do it? On a #remotefirst platform that allows every member of our team to work from wherever they are around the globe. We’re looking for people who want to disrupt the travel industry and love to travel as much as we do.

Cloudbeds is searching for an experienced IT Manager who can implement, maintain and expand a company BYOD policy for a growing and expanding remote workforce with employees and contractors in over 30 countries. In addition to BYOD, the company also has some company-owned devices on-premise and remote that need to be maintained. The ideal candidate will have experience and skills in rolling out new hardware and software policies, developing endpoint security policies and following best practices in endpoint security, performing network maintenance, and implementing IT growth plans and managing IT infrastructure across a mixed environment of various devices including personal computers and mobile. You must be highly skilled and capable in the areas of endpoint security, accountability, crisis management, and issue prioritization.

Location: This role can be based anywhere! (However, having the ability to sync with multiple Time Zones (Europe, North America is important. Eastern Time Zone is preferable).

What You Will Do:

  • Support IT-related operations and security initiatives
  • Administer third-party services for Engineering, Support, and Sales Teams
  • IT tasks related to Onboarding/Offboarding employees and contractors
  • Employee / contractor access control management for our own SaaS application
  • Support driving technical initiatives across the company such as BYOD and access management
  • Support internal hardware processes and allocation
  • Helping to implement the IT policy and best practice guidelines for the organization
  • Design IT training programs and workshops for staff
  • Helping operations and security teams to conduct regular system audits of internal process and systems
  • Evaluate and manage vendor relationships to solve technical challenges
  • Experience managing and administering GSuite users and documents via the Google Admin Console
  • Manage and report on allocation of IT budget
  • Identifying opportunities for team training and skills advancement
  • Support implementation of security policies and regular assessment of such policies
  • Manage equipment and software inventory, purchasing, and licensing
  • Implement IT training and certification programs for staff

You’ll Succeed With:

  • Several years (5+) of Industry Experience
  • Experience supporting IT operations in a remote and global company
  • Hands-on experience with computer hardware, software, and network systems
  • Experience supporting various operating systems, including Windows, OSX, macOS, Linux, and Mobile (iOS, Android)
  • Experience implementing security and privacy standards and best practices
  • Experience in managing an IT budget
  • Passionate about working with remote people across an organization
  • Desire to work within a fast-changing business environment
  • Strong problem solving and verbal / written communication skills
  • Degree in a related field (Information Technology, Computer Science) a plus
  • Multi-Lingual (Spanish, Portuguese) a definite plus

Our company culture supports flexible working schedules with an unlimited PTO policy and the opportunity to travel and work remotely with great people. We are also dedicated to your personal and professional development at Cloudbeds. You will have access to over 10,000 courses within LinkedIn Learning when you join our team for your individual growth! If you think you have the skills and passion, we’ll give you the support and opportunity to thrive in your career. If you would like to be considered for the role, we would love to hear from you!

Company Awards to Check Out!

  • Inc. Best Places to Work (2017 & 2018)
  • Inc. 500 Fastest Growing Companies (2018)
  • Connect MIP Award (Technology)
  • Best Places to Work | Inc Magazine (2017 & 2018)
  • Best Places to Work | HotelTechReport (2018 & 2019)
  • Start-Ups to Watch in 2018 | Forbes
Apply for job

items.content:
Admissions Representative at Pedago, LLC

Remote | Entry-level | Part-time
  • Marketing
  • USA
  • Part time
  • $30.00/hour

Send a cover and resume and brief 1-2 minute video submission. Please link to the video in your cover letter. For your video submission, pretend you’re speaking to a prospective Smartly student and answer the following question: Can you explain the benefits of the Smartly MBA over traditional elite programs? Accuracy of information is less important than your presentation skills and comfort communicating on video chat. Applications without a video submission will not be considered.

Your Role
We’re seeking an Admissions Representative to assist in student outreach and placement for Smartly’s business degree programs. Primary responsibilities include conducting student interviews with professionals from a variety of industries, backgrounds and cultures and making recommendations for placement. This candidate should excel in interpersonal roles and possess superior presentation skills. The ideal candidate will be a detail-oriented, polished, and upbeat communicator who is comfortable speaking with senior-level executives and entrepreneurs while representing the Smartly brand.

This is a part-time position, and can be based anywhere in the US. We ask that you apply only if you have at least 10 hours/week to contribute towards this work, as well as a functioning laptop. The rate for this role is $30/hr.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Schedule and participate in phone or video candidate interviews
  • Provide candidates with information on program offerings, financial options, and academic prerequisites

Required Qualifications

  • Authorization to work in the US
  • Bachelor’s degree required
  • Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
  • Able to cultivate relationships and build rapport with high-achieving academic and professional applicants
  • Ability to work nights and mornings EST

Preferred Qualifications

  • MBA or other graduate level degree
  • Comfort and experience with multicultural client base or work environment
  • Experience working in high performance standard, driven, and team-oriented environment
  • Self starter; growth and results oriented
  • Prior experience in college-level admissions a plus

Our Company
Pedago is an education-technology company with a mission to democratize access to high quality education programs and career advancement opportunities. Smartly, our innovative learning system, offers a free, selective MBA degree, along with other disruptively affordable business and corporate training programs, and combines the best of traditional top MBA programs with the next generation of interactive online learning.

Founded by the former CEO and fellow executives of Rosetta Stone, Pedago is a rapidly expanding company seeking candidates who thrive in a fast-paced environment with opportunity for growth. Our MBA and EMBA already enroll over 350 new elite students every six weeks, making it the largest highly selective MBA program in the world – and we see room for significant further growth.

Pedago supports workplace diversity and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity/expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, or any other protected class.

Apply for job

items.content:
Springpod was born from our desire to transform the way employers engage with students. We empower students to take control of their career path by connecting them with leading employers from the world of science, technology, engineering and maths. From work experience placements to apprenticeships and beyond, we are determined to help students discover their future career – before they leave education. Join us and be part of our mission to revolutionise the way young talent find their dream career.

We’re looking for experienced sales people with hunger, enthusiasm and energy to grow our enterprise customer base. You’ll play a key role in the growth of Springpod and will report into our Commercial Director.

Responsibilities

Research accounts, identify key players, generate interest and develop accounts to create opportunities.
Strategically close high-value business from enterprise clients.
Account management, to drive further revenue from existing enterprise client base
Updating our CRM, managing your own pipeline and reporting back on active deals

Requirements

2-3 years proven sales experience and a track record of success in B2B sales, taking leads from discovery to close
Confidence in selling an innovative technology solution, taking both online demos and face-to-face meetings
Experience in Early in Career Recruitment, TalentTech, B2B Enterprise Sales a must
Experience with deal sizes of £10k – £50k+, and sales cycle taking 1 – 3 months
Experience using HubSpot CRM or Salesforce

Benefits

Fast-paced start-up environment with a lot of responsibility and self-management
Competitive basic salary (30K) and uncapped commission structure (OTE – 50K+)
Very sociable team – fortnightly team meals & weekly drinks at our favourite local pub
Luxury working environment with free fruit, cereal and a great coffee machine
The ability to work remotely some of the time if desired
Training & CPD budget

items.content:
Campusboard is a nationwide marketplace that aims to help the 2.4 million university students in the UK find accommodation, find flatmates and trade unwanted items. One of our main goals is to provide students with an easy and informative way to find private student accommodation for the duration of their studies in the UK.

*THE ROLE*

Your main mission will be working closely with our Chinese language students to help prepare their accommodation options and to provide them with the assistance they require when booking accommodation. This will involve regular conversations with students in the UK & China to ensure all of the requirements for the students are met, and they are able to book their accommodation stress-free and with all the information they need.

The role is flexible and is also open to students who may be looking for work this summer. Remote work is also possible for those not living in London or students who may be travelling during the summer.


*WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:*

* Fluent in Mandarin Chinese both written and verbal.
* Knowledge of Cantonese is a plus, but not required.
* Highly organized, motivated and responsible.
* Stellar communication skills, both written and verbal.
* You can effectively manage your own time and workload.
* Ability to work with a large number of students while maintaining strict attention to detail.
* Prepared to deal with ambiguity present in a startup environment where things evolve quickly.

If you're unsure, please apply – we'd love to hear from you!

items.title: Bid Manager - Remote Part time
items.content:
Mars Spiders is the digital and design agency for public services. We've helped various government departments differently about public services.
Mars Spiders is looking for a brilliantly talented Bid Manager to help us shape and deliver new proposals and tenders for projects. You'll support our sales process, working closely alongside our team of Project Directors and Head of Client Engagement. You'll take part in conversations with prospective senior clients, helping us to turn complex problems and briefs into tangible proposals that we can deliver. You'll have an excellent oversight of the opportunities across government for digital transformation and a thorough understanding of the sector's priorities.
Our company is growing and so is our ambition. We need someone who will provide a creative but focussed approach to our sales process, to help us on our mission to design better public services. We think this role could be the perfect opportunity for a recent graduate of the local government National Graduate Development Programme or similar.
The world as we knew it is gone and with it the big bad expensive ways of delivering government. Now is the time for radical change. For new delivery models but equally new ways of designing our public services, fit for the future not held back by the past.
Sound like a challenge you can help us with? What are you waiting for, please get in touch.
What is the job?
You'll be part of Mars Spiders's operational support team, reporting to our Client Director. You will:
• Work alongside Mars Spiders senior managers and Project Directors, attending meetings and workshops as necessary to support with proposal and bid writing
• Oversee the end to end tender processes - drawing on the skills and resources across the Mars Spiders team to deliver them on time
• Write creative and coherent content for bids, proposals and tender opportunities alongside our team of Project Directors and senior managers
• Track opportunities across the Digital Marketplace and other relevant tender portals, ensuring we're aware of relevant and exciting opportunities for our design team to work on
• Work with the Mars Spiders team to understand our strengths, knowledge, and experience - drawing on this to inform our sales work
• Use your knowledge and insights of our work and the team, to help pitch new ideas or opportunities to Mars Spiders senior managers and project directors
• Keep up to date with trends across the sector, understanding where you feel Mars Spiders should prioritise engagement and business development resource
• Be super detail orientated as well as being comfortable delegating to others in the team
• Provide occasional operational support to Project Directors across our current portfolio of work
• Be interested in all things LocalGov, digital design and delivering better public services!
This isn't a traditional sales manager role. We are looking for somebody who really understands our clients biggest priorities and challenges, and who is passionate about making positive change in public services for users.
What you will bring to Mars Spiders?
• Energy and drive to motivate the team to make sure we have the right tools and assets to help us win important work
• Detail, focus, and rigor to our sales process - making sure we're on track and don't miss out on brilliant opportunities
• Challenge the current ways we do things and influence some of our processes for the better
You might have:
• Worked in or with organisations that design for public impact
Why work at Mars Spiders?
• The opportunity to achieve impact through your work
• Flexible working
• Generous parental leave
• We're collaborative and readily give our time to help others develop
• We hang out together, whether that's at team retreats, summer and Christmas parties, or Friday team breakfasts

The role is a remote home-based but you should be willing to travel

items.title: Risk Management – Compliance
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
items.content:
Risk Management – Compliance at Ernst & Young

Remote

United States

Core Business Services

UNI00DN2

Our Risk Management team enables responsible growth through close collaboration with the business to protect EY from the risks that arise from its professional practice. The team works with the business to identify, monitor and manage EY’s risk, providing coordinated advice and assistance on independence, conflicts, compliance, regulatory, policy, security and risk management issues, as well as effectively managing ethics-related claims and queries. Through oversight of key risk processes, Risk Management helps to minimize the threat of litigation, avoid regulatory enforcement and limit damage to our reputation. Under Vision 2020, our Risk Management team is strategically focused on risk; embedding risk discussions into business planning activities at all levels of the organization.

The opportunity

The volume and complexity of regulatory compliance requirements EY is required to meet continues to grow and as a result the quality and coverage of EY’s compliance programs is required to continually improve. The current opportunity to join the compliance team provides the successful candidate an opportunity to contribute to the design and implementation of EY’s cross-organization compliance framework, including processes, controls and monitoring procedures. The role also offers the successful candidate the opportunity to work with senior members of the compliance team as well as the Risk Management executive more broadly to increase visibility and awareness of EY’s compliance programs by Partners and staff. Combined, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to work with senior leaders in Risk Management and Service Line Quality to contribute to EY’s commitment to strengthening the culture of compliance and to building trust and integrity in the market.

Your key responsibilities

The successful candidate will work with members of the Service Line Quality teams, in particular Assurance, as well as other compliance specialists throughout the business to build EY’s response to ISCM1 – the governing international standard on quality control and compliance EY is required to comply with. Working with other technical experts the role-holder will help document EY’s compliance framework as well as identify opportunities to create synergies between the various frameworks and recommend improvements to address ISCM1 requirements.

The candidate will also work with the compliance leader to prepare and deliver information to the business on EY’s compliance programs and efforts with the objective of raising awareness and understanding by Partners and Staff.

The compliance team is a virtual team with members in locations across Europe, The US and AsiaPacific. There is also a core team of compliance analysts based at GDS.

The successful candidate will be required to travel occasionally for one-to-one and team meetings.

Skills and attributes for success

  • A strong team player, comfortable working collaboratively, virtually and independently
  • Excellent communication and networking skills – able to influence a broad range of internal and client facing professionals
  • Ability to work in a high pace, agile environment
  • Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines, managing multiple priorities effectively
  • Ability to synthesize complex information into simple, high impact messages

To qualify for the role you must have

  • Experience working in regulatory compliance, preferably Assurance
  • Experience in a cross-border role, successfully managing multiple complex projects at a global level
  • Good understanding of the Risk Management business, key stakeholders and influencers
  • Experience working in a diverse team

Ideally, you’ll also have

  • High level of influencing and networking skills
  • Ability to translate technical material into digestible, simplified and user-friendly material
  • Ability to challenge views/perspectives while securing buy-in within RM and beyond

What we look for

  • We’re looking for an experienced, high energy individual who embraces change and innovation in order to ensure that we can continue to deliver world-class RM initiatives in an ever-changing environment.

What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer

  • Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
  • Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
  • The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

EY is committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Join us in building a better working world.

EY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for job

items.title: Nurse Disease Management I
items.content:
Nurse Disease Management I at Anthem, Inc.

Remote

United States

Medical

PS21748

Your Talent. Our Vision. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care.

This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America’s leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.

Nurse Disease Management I

CA, NV, WA

Location: Work At Home – Anywhere in the US

You must be able to work your shift in your time zone – no flexibility

Work hours:

  • 8:30 am – 5:30 pm PST
  • 11:00 am – 8:00 pm EST
  • 10:30 am – 7:30 pm CST

The Nurse Disease Management I is responsible for participating in delivery of patient education and disease management interventions and for performing health coaching for members, across multiple lines, for health improvement/management programs for chronic diseases. Primary duties may include, but are not limited to:

  • Conducts behavioral or clinical assessments to identify individual member knowledge, skills and behavioral needs.
  • Identifies and/or coordinates specific health coaching plan needs to address objectives and goals identified during assessments.
  • Interfaces with provider and other health professionals to coordinate health coaching plan for the member.
  • Implements and/or coordinates coaching and/or care plans by educating members regarding clinical needs and facilitating referrals to health professionals for behavioral health needs.
  • Uses motivational interviewing to facilitate health behavior change.
  • Monitors and evaluates effectiveness of interventions and/or health coaching plans and modifies as needed.
  • Directs members to facilities, community agencies and appropriate provider/network.
  • Refers member to catastrophic case management.
  • Requires an AS/BS in nursing; 2 years of condition specific clinical or home health/discharge planning experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
  • Current unrestricted RN license in current state(s) required.
  • Prior case management experience preferred.
  • A current unrestricted CA, NV, and/or WA RN license is required. (You must have one of these currently to be considered, will have to obtain the others once employed).
  • Manage care experience.
  • Previous work at home experience preferred.

Anthem, Inc. is ranked as one of America’s Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine and is a 2018 DiversityInc magazine Top 50 Company for Diversity. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.antheminc.com. An Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran.

Apply for job

items.title: Finance Manager (m/f/d) // MVP Factory
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Finance Manager (m/f/d) // mvpfactory

Company: mvpfactory

Tags:

MVP Factory delivers the best software in the market. We enable companies of all sizes to efficiently design, test, build and scale top technology products.

We’re expanding rapidly and are now looking for a Finance Manager to help us achieve our ambitious growth plans.

This position would suit someone who thrives in a dynamic, start-up environment with a long term view on developing themselves and loves a challenge. You’ll have the opportunity to work directly with the CEO and be the main point of contact for all things commercial internally. We’re looking for someone that’s pragmatic and diligent, who likes to find smart and innovative ways of working.

THE ROLE

  • Supervision of all invoice management (audit and pre-registration) and coordinate with our tax office
  • Control and monitor payments and bank account maintenance
  • Account reconciliation, bank bookings, provisions, cash management and controlling
  • Preparation of monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements, as well as financial project controlling
  • Contract management and documentation
  • External project controlling

YOUR PROFILE

  • You hold a degree or equivalent education in Finance/Accounting/Economics
  • 3+ years professional experience in Finance/Accounting
  • Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) in German and English
  • You love detail and are thorough, reliable and responsible
  • You’re certainly a \’numbers person\’, but also think analytically, are well structured and like solving problems.
  • In general, you work best independently, but communicate well with others to get what you need to allow a smooth process
  • You’re a superstar with Excel and/or Google Spreadsheets, MS Office/G-Suite
  • Ideally, you’d also have some experience with DATEV software

WHY US?

  • Competitive salary
  • As part of MVPF, you’ll build a network of companies and people all over the world and share knowledge with the best entrepreneurs, designers and developers in the industry
  • We embrace remote work and allow our employees to work remotely whenever possible.
  • Amazing views over Berlin in our 29th Floor office, right next to the river!
  • Access to the best resources – whatever you need to do your job the best way possible
  • \”Take as you need\” vacation policy + occasional international pop-up offices to facilitate remote work (for the last two years Cape Town in January)
  • Regular team events – we celebrate our successes together
Apply for this position

items.title: Sales Tax Bookkeeper
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Sales Tax Bookkeeper at TaxValet

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

Location: Available 100% Remote

TaxValet is looking for multiple Sales Tax Filing Contractors to submit sales tax returns to state governments accurately and on-time. This opportunity will be available on an ongoing basis and could lead to a full-time role with TaxValet.

Responsibilities + Tasks

You will be assigned a set list of clients to submit sales tax returns for with all the calculations done for you. Our team works remotely and generally everyone is online from 8AM – 1PM PST to answer questions. You have flexibility for when you can work, however we want everyone online at a minimum from 10AM – 1PM PST so that if you have questions they can get answered quickly.

  • Submitting sales tax returns to local governments (calculations will be provided for you)
  • Saving copies of returns and payment confirmations
  • Tracking and communicating your progress so the team is kept up-to-date

Time Commitment + Expectations

  • Based on how long it typically takes to submit sales tax returns, you can expect to work approximately 15-25 hours/week for a 2 week period each month.
  • We are specifically looking for help with the Q2 return deadline in July, however this opportunity could become a regular monthly contract depending on your availability, interest, and performance.

Eligibility Requirements

The ideal candidate will have the following attributes:

  • Experience with submitting sales tax returns
  • MUST BE AVAILABLE ONLINE DAILY FROM 10AM – 1PM PST (1PM – 4PM EST)
  • You are looking for something long-term and part-time
  • You are enjoy repetitive work, and have stellar attention to detail
  • Experience working remotely (have a camera, microphone, headset, etc.)
  • Able to pass a background check
Apply for job

items.title: Utility Sales Executive
items.content:
Utility Sales Executive at EnergyHub

Remote

Utility Sales Executive

EnergyHub is looking for a dynamic Sales Executive with a track record of sales success, strong analytical and communication skills, experience working in the utility market, and passion for the clean energy field. This position will play a critical role and help grow our DERMS business by initiating, developing, and building lasting relationships with utility customers. The Sales Executive will demonstrate domain expertise, thought leadership, command of the sales process, and the ability to develop strong relationships, using these abilities to build a robust pipeline and meet sales targets. Specific responsibilities include:

  • Sell the company’s DERMS software and services to utilities
  • Develop, write, and project manage complex and lengthy RFP responses, including the creation of original content without the support of a proposal-writing team
  • Develop a robust and qualified sales pipeline, communicating progress and results with the rest of the sales team
  • Provide utility prospects with convincing, compelling business cases and arguments to support the value of EnergyHub’s offerings
  • Work closely with utilities to understand current and future utility needs and identify new business opportunities; collaborate with the sales, product and marketing teams to ensure that EnergyHub is building the right products and delivering the right messages to the market
  • Represent EnergyHub at conferences, trade shows, and industry events

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience in a business development or sales role in the utility industry, including experience with demand response, energy efficiency, and enterprise SaaS
  • Demonstrated track record of closing high-revenue business opportunities with utility customers
  • Deep industry network and an ability to generate leads independently
  • Excellent written communication, verbal communication, and presentation skill
  • Flexibility for significant amount of travel (20-50%)
  • Location is flexible – Midwest, Southeast, or Mid-Atlantic preferred

EnergyHub is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Sales Executive
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
*Role:*
Close monthly SaaS revenue deals by understanding the needs and buying process of prospective corporate partners and demonstrating the value and ROI of the WeGift platform.

*Responsibilities:*
* Working closely with marketing and an incoming SDR to assist in researching, qualifying and accepting sales leads.
* Initiate proactive discovery processes with prospective leads to qualify timing, organisational technical and commercial fit.
* Proactively analyse and evaluate discovery and sales calls to continually improve the sales process, feeding back to the wider team.
* Educate prospective partners on the benefits of digital gift cards, technology as a service and monthly pricing as a commercial model.
* Build ROI calculators and commercials models to assist the partner in their commercial decision.
* Gather key commercial, technical and contractual requirements as part of the closing and onboarding process.
* Working closely with Implementation and Customer Success Managers to assist with successful customer launches
* Evaluating your own process and the wider teams and continually feeding back to iterate and refine the sales process.
* Ensure CRM, sales notes, and reporting data is clean, precise and up to date.

*Requirements:*
* 4-6 years enterprise SaaS or PaaS B2B sales experience.
* Proven track record of selling to mid-market and enterprise customers with minimum contract values of £20k per annum.
* Proven record of delivering month-on-month sales growth, with a decreasing sales cycle and an increasing close rate.

*Compensation*
* £40-60k
* £40-60k annual performance bonus (paid quarterly based on objectives)

*What’s in for you?*
We believe there is a clear distinction between perks and benefits. Perks are easily replicable, whereas benefits are something that are unique to us and something that we have taken the time to think about and tailor to fit our culture and ethos.

*Benefits*
* Pay reviews every 6 months to make sure we’re paying market rate.
* Participation in the Employee Options pool so you get to own a piece of WeGift.
* Pension scheme (3% contribution)
* A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).
* Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.
* Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.
* WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.
* Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.
* Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.
* Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.

*Perks*
* Brand new We Work office based in Monument, London.
* A new laptop as standard - no one wants an old one when they need to be doing their best work + all the trimmings you need to get the perfect work setup.
* Catered lunch once a week.
* Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)
* Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Sales Associate
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
*About MyTutor*

One-to-one tuition is proven to significantly improve pupils’ grades, confidence and life chances. Yet it remains out of reach for many. MyTutor’s mission is to bring *life-changing tuition to all*. Our handpicked network of tutors work online with pupils from all walks of life, and we’ve given over a *quarter of a million lessons* so far – raising results on average by one whole grade. We’re proud of the fact that over *400 schools* have also chosen to work with us. And that we’ve earned a Trustpilot rating of 9.4/10.

We understand the hectic lives of families with teenagers, and our flexible lesson times mean parents can juggle schedules more easily. On our website, it’s simple to find a tutor your child gets on with – and every lesson is tailored to their needs. Also, by having lessons via live video, pupils can access the best tutors no matter where they live or when they need help. No travelling for Mum and Dad, no waiting around, no strangers in your home. Pupils can have their lessons anywhere – at Grandma’s, at a friend’s house or on holiday, so there’s no disruption in the run-up to exams.

Tuition is now more *affordable and accessible*, making life less stressful for busy parents doing their best.


*About the role*


You’ll be joining our passionate, ambitious team in an exciting, fast-paced & high-growth environment. We pride ourselves on an amazing customer experience at MyTutor with over 95% of our reviews at 5* and some great feedback on Trustpilot. As a *Part Time Sales Associate*, you will be responsible for contacting parents and helping them *get started* with a tutor on the platform. No previous experience working in education is necessary; we have amazing in-house specialists and top talent from the industry to train you!


*What you’ll do*


* Contact parents - who have created an account but who have not booked a tutor - via phone, email and live chat
* Pitch our service and help match the parent with a tutor for an introductory Free Meeting
* Build relationships with your leads and advise them on how to get started on MyTutor
* Follow up with previously matched parents and act as an account manager to help them book their first lesson
* Identify opportunities to improve operational efficiency and provide feedback on trends and patterns of parent requests
* Work with the Customer Experience Manager to continuously iterate on communication and processes, to ensure we are providing the best service for parents, and the best results for the business
* Collaborate with the rest of the team to meet targets and support each other
* Work flexible shifts covering a variety of early mornings (7.30am-10am), evenings (5pm-8pm) and weekends (Saturday and Sunday, 9am-12pm and 4pm-7pm)



*Requirements*

* You love the idea of helping parents find the perfect tutor to help their child succeed
* You have previous experience in sales and customer-centric roles
* You’re an excellent communicator who is at ease empathising with customer needs and feels driven to help others
* You’re happy to adapt a sales script to fit each call you make - ensuring that any questions and concerns from parents are addressed
* You’re able to feedback collaboratively and effectively across teams
* You’re comfortable using a laptop/PC and are open to learning how to use our backend sales CMS system
* You are able to work efficiently with the team to achieve team targets, whilst ensuring attention to detail and quality of service


*Benefits*

* Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people
* A work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and support
* Opportunity to work autonomously and make use of your creative flair
* Training and investment in your learning
* £10 an hour base rate, with competitive commission based on results
* Team training days and flexible working hours


MyTutor is committed to creating an *inclusive workplace* and have set up our own EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.


*To apply*

Get in touch with your CV and let us know why you’re interested in working with us.

items.title: Grants Manager
items.content:
Grants Manager at Muscular Dystrophy Association - MDA

Remote

Employee Type: Full-Time

Location: Remote

Position Description: 
The Grants Manager reports to the Head of Research and is responsible for managing all phases of the grant lifecycle to ensure alignment with MDA’s research policies and overall mission and goals.

Responsibilities:

Review Process

  • Process and administer assigned grant programs
  • Assist in the distribution of reviewer critiques
  • Oversee the changes to critiques and scores for assigned application reviews
  • Assist in resubmission or new application processes
  • Guide reviewers through review process for assigned grant programs
  • Update policy manuals and instructions for assigned grant programs
  • Update all application forms and instructions for assigned grant programs
  • Collaborate with relevant parties regarding new programs, deadlines and revised database forms for assigned grant programs
  • Assist other members of the grants management team as needed

Review Meetings

  • Create and execute timelines for assigned grant reviews
  • Manage assigned review meeting budgets
  • Collaborate with MDA Travel department
  • Support the committee members travel for assigned grant review meetings
  • Prepare all pre-meeting and post-meeting materials for assigned grant review meetings
  • Assist other members of the grants management team with review meetings as needed

Post Award

  • Acquire MDA authorizations to fund for grants for assigned grant programs
  • Generate Post-Award documents such as Notice of Award, Milestone Schedule, etc., and upload to various websites for storage.
  • Create post-award accounts and update all relevant sections for assigned grant programs
  • Manage award deliverables in accordance with grant policy manuals and schedules for assigned grant programs
  • Initiate payments per payment and/or milestone schedule for assigned grant programs
  • Provide post-award status reports for assigned grant programs
  • Serve as point of contact for award inquiries for assigned grant programs

proposalCENTRAL and other databases

  • Collaborate with Scientific Team to better utilize database programs
  • Manage both pre-award and post-award information entered into proposalCENTRAL for assigned grant programs.
  • Initiate recommendations and complete approved updates within proposalCENTRAL for assigned grant programs
  • Provide all database support and assistance for assigned grant programs
  • Provide database support and training to new user staff members

Reporting

  • Prepare assigned sections of the Board reports
  • Produce and provide information relating to past, current and future year funding for the assigned grant programs
  • Produce and audit check requests from assigned programs for accounting
  • Update and oversee the changes to disease reports for assigned grant programs within the MDA
  • Update committee listings on MDA website and internal reporting modules.
  • Provide databases for email and other mailing purposes
  • Prepare other financial and grant analyses as needed

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Competencies:

  • Communication Skills: Clearly and persuasively communicate, listen and seek clarifications; participate in meetings, write clearly and informatively.
  • Initiative – Demonstrate ability to work independently and as part of a team; exhibit sound and accurate judgment, including prioritization and time management skills. Able to provide support to multiple team members simultaneously.
  • Computer Skills: Intermediate level proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and Google Docs, ability to learn and adapt to new technologies.
  • Customer Service: Prioritizes internal and external interactions and responds appropriately.
  • Professionalism: Work well in a fast-paced environment; treat others with respect and consideration; accept responsibility for own actions; positive/upbeat attitude.
  • Flexibility: Able to multitask in a changing work environment. Manage competing demands and unexpected events. Willing to change approach to best fit the situation.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree with a minimum of 2-5 years’ experience in a grants management related role with demonstrated ability to manage, motivate and inspire staff.
  • Strong leadership skills; ability to work effectively as a team leader and collaboratively in matrix reporting structures.
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
  • Excellent attention to detail; strong project management skills and ability to meet deadlines.
  • Strong analytical skills, particularly with financial data and budgets.

MDA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Apply for job

items.content:
Account Executive, Group Sales at Inman News

Remote

Inman News

Anywhere in the U.S.

JOB DESCRIPTION

The real estate community around the world turns to Inman first for accurate, innovative and timely information about the industry. Known for its award-winning journalism, cutting-edge technology coverage and forward-thinking events, Inman is the industry’s leading source of real estate information.

The Account Executive, Group Sales, will primarily sell Inman event tickets to a wide variety of targeted prospective buyers, with a focus on real estate organizations. This position will also play a key role at Inman events, assisting in the operation of sales-related activities for clients and attendees.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Make a high volume of outbound sales calls to prospective Inman event ticket buyers, specifically targeting real estate organizations and those that provide services to real estate professionals
  • Perform grassroots marketing activities to real estate organizations across the country to drive audience development and sales leads
  • Keep accurate CRM records and perform necessary follow up with customers in order to close sales
  • Process orders in Eventbrite and take all necessary steps to complete the sale
  • Assist in the planning and execution of Inman sales elements at Inman events
  • Special projects and assignments as business dictates

KEY SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE

  • 2-3 years prior sales experience (event, group sales, and/or real estate experience a plus)
  • A commanding desire to learn and succeed in sales
  • Cold calling experience with a track record of success
  • The ability to write succinct, crisp emails and a great phone manner
  • com experience a plus
  • A team player, hard-working, passionate, enthusiastic and confident
  • Naturally entrepreneurial and a problem solver
  • Fueled by success with a desire to grow

Inman is an equal opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive workplace environment. This is a full-time, remote position. Our company is 100% distributed so we are seeking candidates from anywhere in the U.S.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Enterprise Sales Representative at Eagleview Technologies Inc.

Remote

REMOTE-US-BASED

Company Information

Mixing technology, data, and first-in-class innovation, EagleView® is not only leading the property data analytics market, but also changing lives along the way. Come join us and make great things happen!

EagleView is a fast-growing technology company driving game changing innovation in multibillion-dollar markets such as property insurance, energy, construction, and government. Leveraging 17 years of the most advanced aerial imaging technology in the world, along with the most recent advances in machine learning and AI, EagleView is fundamentally transforming how our customers do business.

At EagleView, we believe that making our culture engaging and empowering are keys to success. Our kitchens are stocked 24/7; social, athletic, and wellness opportunities are plentiful; and the growth, education, and potential of employees is a top priority, making EagleView a “Best Place to Work” for more than five years running.

Job Description

We’re hiring for an Enterprise Sales Representative focused on driving our business in our key markets. In this role, you’ll be relied upon to maintain and grow current client accounts as well as aggressively pursue new business. The person that’s going to be successful in this role is going to be a self-starter, resilient and driven to win with deep interpersonal skills and the ability to craft creative solutions.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Source and develop potential client relationships and actively manage existing client base.
  • Identify opportunities for increased revenue and volume.
  • Actively develop relationships with key users.
  • Conduct strategic account reviews regularly to review service needs and usage trends.
  • Define business objectives by identifying products and pricing that meet customer needs.
  • Create and conduct proposal presentations and RFP responses.
  • Identify business trends and forecast demand.

Skills & Requirements

  • Strong documented history of success and top performance.
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
  • 3+ years of sales experience.
  • Experience with enterprise sales strongly preferred.
  • Sales experience one of the following markets strongly preferred: Government, Insurance, Energy Infrastructure, Construction

EagleView® offers competitive pay and robust benefit plans along with the opportunity to grow your career in a fast-paced, fun and casual environment.

EagleView and its subsidiaries are committed to leveraging the talent of a diverse workforce to create great opportunities for our business and our people. EOE/AA. Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Sales Sourcer
items.content:
Senior Sales Sourcer at Splunk

Remote | Freelance

Location: Any city in the U.S. (must already be located in the U.S.)

This role is a Sourcing role, and we are looking for someone who loves to source and build pipeline for Recruiters

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey.

This role is contracted through end of Splunk’s fiscal year (end of Jan 2020) with the possibility to extend based on performance and business need.

The Role:

Due to our hyper-growth in building a game changing product, we are seeking an extraordinary Sr Sales Sourcer to join our dynamic and fun Talent Acquisition team. If this is you, you have experience in building a robust pipeline of high-caliber software sales talent, and you have ability to demonstrate an “outside of the box” approach in your search methodology. As a Sr Sales Sourcer, you will demonstrate your creative searching skills to track down critical sales talent for building cutting edge software. You will communicate intelligently with your sourced super-candidates, persuade them to engage and interview at Splunk, and partner with Hiring Managers and our Recruiting Team to maximize their interviewing experience. You will be responsible for sourcing of passive sales technology professionals and leading them through the entire recruitment process up to the offer stage.

Responsibilities:

  • Become an expert in Splunk technology, new products, applications, and how to prospect & convert passive folks into interested applicants.
  • Create and execute talent strategies based on deep understanding of business needs aligned with understanding of the candidate market place (both internal and external).
  • Utilize knowledge of multiple recruiting sources and advanced sourcing techniques to identify candidates. Drive sourcing activities via networking, internet research, local, regional and national recruiting forums focused on diversity
  • Generate a strong qualified engineering pipeline, and produce a target list of passive candidates for assigned searches through research and heavy sourcing; research, networking, cold calling, and phone screens.
  • Source passive candidates through referrals, networking, internet searches, communities, etc.
  • Build communities of talent

Requirements:

  • 3-7 years experience sourcing technology/software sales superstars at enterprise software companies and a successful reputation and references to back it up.
  • Extensive experience in sourcing gained at either an executive search firm or from a fast paced, high-growth enterprise software environment.
  • Demonstrated success in sourcing and recruiting IC and management level sales candidates within the enterprise software sales space including Cloud, Big Data and the IT industry with tact and tenacity
  • An eye for detail and strong intuition for culture fit while screening candidates
  • Understanding of sales methodologies, technology, ability to read and understand what makes a stellar Sales Consultant or Technical Sales Reps successful
  • Able to establish trust and credibility with Sales Leaders and influence talent decisions through a consultative approach, when working with our sales hiring managers while taking new requirements, reviewing candidate profiles and updating candidate pipeline progress.
  • Ability to partner effectively with all teams in a matrix organization
  • Highly articulate and collaborative. Ability to network and establish effective relationships
  • Leads by example: A great teammate who is inclusive, collaborative, self-directed, highly motivated with a sense of urgency.
  • Deep expertise in building and networking with high caliber software sales talent. Ability to demonstrate creativity in your search methods and generate a high quality candidate pipeline under very tight timeline. Knowledgeable with using Boolean logic and LinkedIn Corporate Recruiter.
  • Knowledge about other ways to strategically find great and collaborative Sales Candidates through social media and external referrals (you know how to use more than just LinkedIn)
  • Hi-integrity; hi-degree of professionalism, and can be trusted with confidential HR information.
  • A strong bias for action,impeccable follow up, results-oriented mindset, not scared by stretch goals.
  • Strong negotiating, closing, and follow-through skills
  • Strong social networking and a strong brand ambassador
  • Experience with Applicant Tracking Systems, Jobvite is a plus.
  • Growth mindset
  • This role can be remote.
  • We are looking for a strong sourcer who has experience and passion for sourcing sales candidates. Please include that experience on your resume.

What We Offer You:

  • A constant stream of new things to learn. Including cutting edge internal recruiting tools.
  • Highly talented, collegial and dedicated peers.
  • Breadth and depth. Do you want to make an impact? The work you’ll do will directly impact our product, brand and the experience of our candidates.
  • Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing our talent through ownership and leadership opportunities.
  • An open, supportive and collaborative work environment.
  • Work Flexibility. We don’t expect people to work 12-hour days. There will times where we will sprint, however, we want you to have a successful time outside of work too. Want to choose your hours? No problem. Need to work from home periodically? No problem? We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and commitment to providing an extraordinary candidate, manager and team experience, and believe that balance helps cultivate an excellent environment.

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which you are applying.

For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Apply for job

items.title: Social Worker Case Manager Neonatal ICU
items.content:
Social Worker Case Manager Neonatal ICU at ProgenyHealth, Inc.

Remote

Local in PA or 100% remote
Plymouth Meeting, PA 19462

ProgenyHealth is a leading provider of care management solutions for premature and medically complex newborns. We partner with health plans and their neonatal providers to work collaboratively in developing a plan of care specific to the needs of each child – from admission to the intensive care nursery until they are safely transitioned from the hospital, through the first year of life. Our program promotes appropriate utilization, improves access, educates family members, reduces costs, and improves outcomes.

Job Role
The Social Worker will work in conjunction with the nurse case managers, coordinating care of the high-risk newborn population served by ProgenyHealth based on the CMSA national standards for case management practice. The Social Worker will demonstrate strengths in working independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment. An understanding of ProgenyHealth goals and outcome measures is important to the accountability of the Social Worker and the success of the member-focused Specialty Care Management Programs

Responsibilities

  • Focus on empowering the caregiver and family to support optimal wellness while advocating for the necessary services and community resources across the health care continuum
  • Assess, plan and implement care strategies that are individualized by patient and directed toward the most appropriate, least restrictive level of care
  • Build and maintain relationships with caregivers and healthcare providers to develop an individualized plan of care that is member focused and addresses physical and psycho-social barriers to optimal outcomes
  • Identify any impediments to member progress and advocate for patients and families as needed to ensure the patient’s needs and choices are fully represented and supported by the healthcare team

Qualifications

  • Licensed Social Worker in state of residence with a current, unrestricted license is required; and agree to obtain licensure in other state(s) when applicable for client contracts.
  • Minimum of 2 years background working in Pediatrics/NICU managed care or clinical environment
  • For 100% remote positions, Five or more years of managed care experience in a health plan or acute care health system in a case management role is required.
  • Experience working with a Medicaid population is preferred.
  • A background in effecting change to overcome social determinants of health, including mental health and substance abuse.
  • Basic level of proficiency in PC-based word processing and database documentation (Word, Excel, Internet, Outlook) as well as managed care systems or EMRs.
  • Excellent communication skills and organizational ability are required.
  • Must be self-motivated and willing to learn multiple tasks.
  • Must be well organized and able to prioritize tasks.
  • Must demonstrate accuracy in spelling and documentation.
  • CCM certification highly desirable; and is required after two years of employment
  • Ability to perform job functions with autonomy and be a self-starter
  • Must possess excellent interpersonal skills, telephone etiquette and maintain positive communication at all times
  • Must have commitment to excellence in customer service.

Benefits/Culture
Our team is our most important asset. some of the benefits we offer our team are:

  • 401K with company match
  • Medical and dental benefits
  • Long Term Disability
  • Paid Time Off
  • Business Casual Work environment
  • Team orientated events throughout the year
  • Role specific – partial or full telecommuting (after training period)
Apply for job
