items.content:
Medical Case Manager at The Hartford

Remote
  • 1901680

Description

WHAT CAN YOU TELL ME ABOUT THIS ROLE?

As Medical Case Managers, we seek to improve on our patients abilities! This position is part of a dynamic, fast-paced team of experienced Medical Case Managers located remotely across the United States. The ideal candidate for the Medical Case Manager role will oversee Short Term (STD), Long Term (LTD) and Premium Waver (PW) disability case files. On average, a Medical Case Manager shall handle 65-75 cases with a moderate degree of complexity and acuity of medical condition. This individual will have the opportunity to collaborate with claims staff, the injured worker, an employer, and other healthcare professionals to promote quality medical care with a focus on returning our patients back to work. Our goal is to achieve optimum, cost-effective medical and vocational outcomes. We embrace The Hartford Behaviors of Delivering Outcomes, Teamwork, Building Strong Partnership and Striving for Excellence!

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • The successful hire will be responsible for the review of Long-Term Disability (LTD), Short-term Disability (STD) and Premium Waver (PW) claims with complex medical conditions referred for medical assessment; clarification of limitations/ restrictions; and/or case management.
  • Work closely with the STD/LTD/PW Claims Team to identifying appropriate claim referrals and effectively assessing claims to ensure they reach the appropriate claim outcome.
  • Collaborate with Rehabilitation Case Managers, Ability Analysts, Employees, Policyholders, Healthcare Providers and Vendors to facilitate case management strategies to a potential Return to Work.
  • Clearly document and track efforts and outcomes.
  • Periodically participate and facilitate training programs and/or presentations

Qualifications

  • At least 3 years of current clinical experience in an acute care, orthopedic, neurological, physical rehabilitation, industrial medical settings or current experience as a Disability Case Manager
  • Registered Nurse (RN) preferred, however we will consider candidates with LPN and Disability/Case Management experience
  • Insurance industry experience is strongly preferred!
  • Bilingual Spanish skills are strongly preferred for our ideal candidate
  • CCM, CDMS, COHN, CRRN or comparable industry certification is a plus!
  • Clinical ability to assess Disability Claims with complex medical histories which may include claimants with subjective diagnoses, co-morbid conditions, etc.
  • Strong written/ verbal communication skills; computers and Microsoft Office programs.
  • Ability to explain complex medical conditions and ability to communicate with attending physicians to identify current limitations/restrictions as it relates to the workplace.
  • Accurate clinical assessment and analytical skills, ability to make sound judgments and to accurately document activities, and the desire to learn about the insurance business.
  • Prior experience in facilitating RTW for disabled employees, knowledge of return to work best practices, ergonomics, FMLA, and related Human Resources is desired.
  • Must keep current in area of expertise and acquire CEU’s as necessary to maintain certification.
  • Negotiation skills, problem solving, plan development competencies are essential
  • Organizational and Change Management skills, accountability in meeting deadlines, and being a team player are also essential

WHAT ELSE CAN YOU TELL ME?

  • This position is a Remote from Home Work opportunity.

Job Function: Case Management

Primary Location: United States

Schedule: Full-time

Job Level: Individual Contributor

Education Level: High School Diploma/GED (±11 years)

Job Type: Standard

Shift: Day Job

Employee Status: Regular

Overtime Status: Exempt

Travel: No

Remote Worker Option: Yes

items.content:
Director of Sales

We are looking for a Director of Sales to provide leadership, strategic direction, and daily management of our growing sales organization. You are someone with a passion for coaching and who loves to work hands-on with their team. You should apply if you are creative, have experience building high-performance teams and promoting top talent, and if you’re excited about our mission to build a world where no one’s health is hindered by their need.

About the Role
The Director of Sales will:
  • Report to the CEO
  • Develop strategy to support opportunity growth
  • Recruit for and lead a small but growing team
  • Develop the team through call-shadowing, 1:1 coaching, and pipeline reviews
  • Participate in the sales cycle and push deals to close
  • Take a data-driven approach to pipeline management and forecasting
  • Identify opportunities for process growth and improvement
  • Track, and report sales metrics, account activity, and revenue forecasts to leadership

About You
  • 5+ years of proven success as a sales leader at a small, growing company
  • 3+ years of complex enterprise sales success
  • Accomplished in hiring, coach, and managing experienced enterprise sales talent
  • The mindset to lead by example in terms of your work ethic and willingness to “get your hands dirty”
  • Experience with Account Based Selling or other comparable sales strategies for
  • Ability to thrive in a startup environment
  • Proficiency with Salesforce administration and other sales engagement technology
And the following would be preferred
  • 2+ years experience selling into health plans


Benefits

Together, we live into our Core Values

  • We lead with empathy: We believe in kindness, empathy, assuming good intentions and finding mutual understanding from our teammates, customers, and users.
  • We lean into vulnerability: We're not afraid to ask for help or give and receive feedback. We build off our failures and don’t shy away from tough conversations.

items.title: Platform.sh: Sales Development Representative - APAC Timezone

hiringOrganization.name: TutukaFull-TimeMiddle East, South East Asia, EuropeFollow Up BossFull-TimeU.S.AHealthy Hemp OilContractRemote

items.content:
Sales Development Representative - APAC Timezone

Mission

Call it what you want, Platform.sh isn’t your typical SaaS company, and this isn’t your typical entry-level sales role. We’re a 100% distributed organization, focused on redefining how organizations build and run web applications at scale. We help our customers bypass all the complexity and cost of infrastructure and DevOps, and enable them to focus on creating incredible experiences for their customers with software. Platform.sh counts everyone from Fortune-50 enterprises to scrappy SaaS entrepreneurs as partners, and we’re looking for curious, customer-focused individuals to help us find and win more.

How do we win? By making it easy to work with us. By making it easy to buy. By understanding our customers business and challenges. We’ll expect you to dive in and learn, and be on a daily mission to help our prospects choose Platform.sh.

This role will report to the sales organization, working in close collaboration with the VP of Sales.You’ll also work closely with our distributed sales team. 

In a given day you might:

  • Interact with inbound prospects through conversational channels to engage and qualify them for further sales engagement, or to optimize self-service flow.
  • Prospect enterprise partners through multiple channels, and work with our global account exec team to qualify.
  • Contact existing partners and customers to help them engage further with our product and/or team.
  • Work with sales and marketing leaders to develop and refine outbound and inbound strategies.
  • Wrangle spreadsheets, LinkedIn, and CRM data to figure out strategies to connect with buyers 1:1. This job is about working smart, not just “hitting your dials.”

Must-have skills:

  • Curiosity! You must be driven to learn about our customers, their businesses, technology (ours and theirs), and B2B sales.
  • Communication. Being a distributed company, we don’t have the benefit of walking around to see one another, so proactive communication is a must. We’ll expect you to both give constructive feedback and ask for help when you need it.
  • Organization. Data is our lifeblood. We need to be great at collecting and organizing prospect and customer feedback to tune our sales/marketing process and product, and feed our customer acquisition. We use Drift, Marketo, and Salesforce primarily. Knowledge of or ability to learn is key!
  • Comfort with pace and uncertainty. We’re moving fast, growing quickly, and figuring some things out. We don’t bullshit, and we support each other. You need to be comfortable with helping to figure things out along the way.
  • Goal orientation. This is a sales role after all. We’re all about developing qualified leads and pushing the business forward.

Apply if:

  • You’re inquisitive and analytical.
  • Want to work in a fast-paced environment, collaborating with a globally distributed [and rapidly scaling] team.
  • You care more about learning and pushing yourself than ping pong, snacks, and kegerators.

Sound Like a Good Fit? We’d love to talk to you!  

* This is a remote job. Candidates must be located in the APAC Time Zone.

items.title: Accounting Clerk
items.content:
Accounting Clerk at Robert Half International

Remote

Location: MI-Troy

Description
Mortgage Lender

Robert Half Finance has an immediate need for a talented Mortgage Lender. The day-to-day operations of this role include, evaluating credit and financials, engage with customers and clients to determine loan needs, prepare loan proposals and process loan applications and documentation.

The Mortgage Lender is a full-time opportunity and is situated in the Troy, Michigan, area but allows you to work remote or anywhere in the world where there is a bank available.

What you get to do every single day

  • Complete loan contracts
  • Advise clients on loan policies and restrictions
  • Maintain and update client account records
  • Coordinate with team to meet scheduled closing dates
  • Submit loan applications and documentations to underwriting in a timely manner
  • Maintain compliance with local, state, and federal laws
  • Interview loan applicants
  • Advise borrowers on financial status and payment methods
  • Perform any and all other duties as needed

Requirements

  • Bachelors degree in finance, economics, or related field; masters degree preferred
  • Certification by Mortgage Bankers Association (MBA) and American Bankers Association (ABA); certified financial marketing professional (CFMP), certified lender business banker (CLBB), and certified trust and financial advisor (CTFA), preferred
  • Mortgage loan officers must be licensed as a mortgage loan originator (MLO)
  • State loan officer license from the National Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS)
  • Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite
  • Knowledge of local, state, and federal loan regulations
  • Strict adherence to company financial policies and processes
  • Experienced at compiling and following policies and processes
  • Able to analyze financial records and transfer data

Robert Half Finance & Accounting, the world’s leader in specialized financial staffing, provides exciting full-time opportunities in the areas of accounting, bookkeeping, finance, audit, taxation and more. We pioneered the professional staffing industry, and we’ve been successfully matching professionals with employers since 1948. Our proven proprietary processes, along with our relationships in 325 locations worldwide, allow us to provide you unparalleled access to exciting career opportunities. But don’t take our word for it. Our company has appeared on Fortune magazine’s list of “World’s Most Admired Companies” since 1998, and 9 out of 10 of our customers would recommend our service to a colleague.

Apply for this job now or contact our nearest office at 888-490-5461 for additional information.

All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

2019 Robert Half Finance & Accounting. An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veterans

By clicking ‘Apply Now’ you are agreeing to Robert Half Terms of Use.

Salary: $100000 – 150000/year
Location: Troy, MI
Employment Type: Permanent
Job Reference: 02250-0011030619
Staffing Area: Full-Time Accounting & Finance

items.title: National Sales Account Executive
items.content:
National Sales Account Executive at CyberCoders

Remote

Washington, DC

Full-time $120k – $200k

Ready to make a real impact in a growing, prominent local & education focused consulting company? We help local & nation-wide procurement managers to increase their SLED business & save public government entities millions of dollars in the process. We’re made up of former fortune 500 executives, state & local officials & procurement consulting veterans helping us lead our space for over 10 years running. Although our preference is to have this person located in our beautiful, Washington DC office, we are happy to bring on someone remotely with the right type of experience.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Achieve revenue goals put in place by the company
  • Actively finding & closing business with Large Enterprise accounts, helping them open up & expand their SLED business
  • Prospect new business opportunities by staying on top of market trends and conducting market research
  • Identify Key accounts of prospective clients
  • Participate in educational opportunities, read professional publications, maintain personal networks and participate in professional organizations
  • Retain and grow existing business partnerships through up selling and maximizing revenue
  • Stay organized and maintain accurate client data through a CRM platform
  • Maintain organization confidentiality

What You Need for this Position

  • BA, BS (MBA is a plus) & 8+ years of relevant experience selling services, solutions, technology, etc. into fortune 500 or other large accounts
  • Strong background in full-sales lifecycle, selling into major corporate accounts for a well-known brand or entity
  • Proven experience rising the ranks in a sales organization (i.e. Seller —> Sales Manager—-> Regional Sales Manager —–> National Sales Manager, etc.)
  • Account Management, background ballooning accounts through consultative sales is helpful
  • Proven ability to form & grow professional relationships
  • SLED sales experience is a plus

What’s In It for You

  • Flexible Work Environment with Work from Home Options
  • Great Company Culture where your coworkers are your peers, not “bosses”
  • Competitive Benefits Package (Base up to $120k + $200k OTE)
  • We pay offer Standup desks in our sleek, new office space, Laptop of your choice, Health/Vision/Dental, expense reimbursement, 401k match

So, if you are a sales manager, national sales director or business development director with experience selling to Fortune 500 companies, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Preferred Skills

  • Regional or National Sales
  • Selling to Major Accounts
  • Prospecting
  • Negotiate Contracts
  • Fostering Relationships
  • SLED
  • Cold Calling

items.title: Growth Manager
items.content:
*Our company*

Settled is building the future of home buying and selling. We’re on a mission to put a smile on the faces of everyone buying or selling a home by building next-generation products and software. That means bringing together buyers and sellers in an exchange that they are more in control of and certain that it will complete.

As well as being led by former Google execs, Settled is venture capital backed by firms including 500.co, Piton Capital, Accelerated Digital Ventures and Connect Ventures. We’re at that exciting stage where our business is growing rapidly and we’re focused on building a team who’ll be part of our journey for the years ahead.
People are at the heart of everything we do and we spend a lot of time thinking about our team and our culture. We love working with smart, creative thinkers who are passionate about collaborating and making a difference.

*Role and responsibilities*

* Define and execute a growth roadmap in a completely new product category.
* You will build and engage the go-to community of home buyers and sellers from scratch - seeding with content led marketing and amplifying word-of-mouth.
* You will also test and iterate on a number of potential channels for growth: inhouse organic, social, referral channels to leverage and activate the community into leads and referrers (SEO, Social, Affiliate, PPC/Display, Referrals) You will continually test to determine which are scalable and profitable.
* You will design experiments and develop supporting campaign/funnel strategy quickly, innovatively and inexpensively, working with Content and Product to build inhouse.
* Work with the Content Manager, Design, and freelancers to oversee the production of effective content assets: landing pages, video, display, lead-generation tech.
* Partner with our Analytics lead to set up the measurement and reporting on the KPI’s, lead measures and ROI of each channel - and develop ways to scale.
* You will have deep understanding and empathy for customers. You will know the customer funnel intimately and innovate with Product on opportunities for delight, growth and optimisation.
* You will dig into data sources to understand the competitive market, the customer segments, and how to target and position our product offering for awareness, consideration and acquisition.
* Manage media budget & recommend budget allocations based on KPIs and ROI on spend.
* Work cross-functionally with product, content, tech, customer experience and analytics to build experiences that meet ambitious growth targets

*Your experience will include*

* 3+ years of building businesses from zero, particularly with limited budgets, in a tech, ecommerce or SAAS business
* You will have built internal growth channels, particularly using content marketing, community and SEO as drivers
* You will have built and iterated to ROI-positive channels in an ecommerce, SAAS or tech environment
* You will work hand in hand with product/tech to ideate on improving the funnel - and prioritising which will drive most return
* You will create original lead-gen driving awareness of the industry problem that Settled solves
* You will be a pro at using platforms/tools to drive growth: Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, Google and other relevant potentials
* Driving low CAC through data-driven content marketing initiatives, using a variety of SEO tools including Google Analytics, Search Console, AHRefs, SEMRush
* Evidence of building in-house campaigns - optimising conversion rate and ROI through rapid execution on messaging and media targeting
* A driver of new ideas and suggestions to drive the company’s awareness and reputation forward
* Highly analytical, data-driven
* Strong project management and setting up structured systems

*Perks and benefits*

* Choose between Macbook Pro or DellXPS
* Annual training/conferences budget
* Perks at Work
* Book budget
* Gadget budget
* Company swag
* Dog-friendly office

*Culture*

Settled is a high paced dynamic company, our employees are all passionate about making a real disruption to the property market for the benefit of our customers.

We are a team of people that like to have fun both in work and out of work. Some of the things to expect from our team:

* Bad jokes
* Bad taste in music
* Bad singing

But overall a team who really help one another and work closely with each other and have fun doing so!

items.content:
Growth Manager at vidIQ

Remote | International

Job description

We are looking for a very experienced SEM machine. You must be an expert in conversion science, landing page conversion, adwords, remarketing and social ads. We’re looking for a candidate experienced with both SaaS and Freemium business models. The growth manager will be responsible for developing and executing customer acquisition and retention of our customers, as well as up sell products and services.

This is a fully remote, full time position. We are looking for a candidate who is passionate about YouTube, and who is willing to learn a lot about video marketing on the job.

Requirements

  • You will lead end to end planning, strategy, budgeting and goal-setting for user acquisition on mobile and web
  • Optimize and grow existing and new high-performing search campaigns in Google
  • Develop and manage high performing remarketing lists and campaigns
  • Maintain and monitor keyword bids, account daily and monthly budget caps, impression share, quality score and other important account metrics.
  • Manage the creation of keyword lists.
  • Provide creative copy suggestions and graphical ad templates
  • Provide recommendations and execute strategies for keyword opportunities, campaign structuring, targeting, display network, and other facets of paid search in accordance with campaign objectives
  • Plan and deploy media budgets that are KPI driven and pace towards forecasted revenue goals
  • Drive conversion of prospective consumers to active customers through funnel optimization including A/B and multivariate tests for SEM campaigns and landing pages
  • Collaborate with a cutting-edge team. Partner with Product, Content and Development teams to execute audience-centric and ROI driven campaigns.
  • Communication to team and management on project development, timelines, and results.
  • Establish performance benchmarks and KPIs for all campaigns
  • Partner with creative team to develop campaign assets that align with our brand guidelines
  • Work closely with product teams and brand marketing to create a seamless user journey that thoughtfully connects different vidIQ products and enhances our brand story

Preferred Candidate Requirements (Suggested)

  • 4+ years of relevant experience
  • Versatile marketing skill set: you can come up with creative concepts, write ad copy, give feedback on design, implement ads, analyze and report on results
  • Strong background in PPC campaign architecture and optimization
  • Mastery of Google Adwords, Yahoo and Bing paid search platforms
  • Experience with automated bid management solutions
  • Strong understanding of Google’s Quality Score and how to optimize for it
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented and strong analytical/problem solving skills
  • Growth-oriented, customer-centric strategic mindset
  • Experience in email or performance marketing with a preference for growth marketing expertise
  • Robust analytical skills – the ability to digest large amounts of data, identify trends and pursue the right questions to take action
  • Strong written and verbal communication and problem-solving skills with an impeccable eye for detail
Apply for job

items.title: Sales Account Manager
items.content:
Hello!

 

Our team is looking for a solid, experienced Remote Account Management specialist in the accounting/tax industry who is a native English speaker and who would be available during NY business hours.

 

We provide an easy to use and extremely affordable software to accountants and tax practitioners that helps them streamline their office environment to make doing business easier for themselves and their customers.

 

Our core clients at this point are small to medium sized accounting offices who are struggling to keep things organized and grow their business.

 

What we need is someone who can reach out to prospects who have expressed interest in our system, registering for a demo webinar, and performing the necessary follow up once they do to turn them into paying customers!

 

Who’s our ideal candidate?

  • Experience in calling clients and prospects to set appointments, some of whom might be cold leads that haven’t been contacted by us yet
  • Experience in the tax and/or accounting industry so you can “talk the talk.”  This isn’t 100% necessary if you are smooth and polished on calls and can learn quickly...but it would be nice if you had some familiarity
  • The ability to work uninterrupted during normal business hours
  • A keen understanding of who your audience is and the level of professionalism that you must have
  • Someone who has helped onboard and support business customers

 

At this time, the hours requirement is very reasonable (3 hours a day), but we will be getting much busier shortly so we hope to find someone with flexibility.

 

Additionally, to be certain you’ve read this entire posting, please start your proposal by telling me what the weather is like by you right now. Those who don’t follow this simple instruction will be rejected immediately - which is great for you since you've read this part :) 

 

Thanks!  We look forward to hearing from you!

items.title: Sylvie McCracken International LLC: PST Evening/Weekends Enrollment Coach/Sales Position
items.content:
PST Evening/Weekends Enrollment Coach/Sales Position

My team and I are looking to add an evening/weekend sales person to work as part of our enrollment team for our group coaching program where we help doctors and other health professionals create 6 figure passive income streams with ebooks.

We've built an "evergreen" funnel that consistently produces 4-5 pre-qualified, pre-scheduled calls per day per rep.

Would you like to:

Earn $700 or MORE per enrollment? Be handed at least FIVE red-hot, pre-sold inbound leads EVERY DAY to talk to, with ZERO cold calling?

Be on the phone with prospects that have already SAID YES 10 times BEFORE they even get on the phone with you? Would you like to make an incredible DIFFERENCE in the lives of clients?

We provide our sales enrollment team:

 

AMAZING pre-sold leads

Surgeon income from home

A Fun and Flexible working environment

A World Class Program to sell

Sales training with a legendary sales trainer

The ability to change lives

**A PROVEN, Predictable Sales Enrollment System

This position is for ambitious, hardworking salespeople that want to make lucrative commissions while making a massive difference in the world.

 

NOTE: This is NOT for everyone!

You MUST have total integrity including turning away a client (forgoing the sale/commission) if they’re not a good fit for our program.

You MUST be willing to work the Enrollment System we provide you.

You MUST be coachable/ open to feedback.

You MUST be willing to provide references.

You MUST have consistent access to reliable internet (we are a 100% remote team).

You like speaking on the phone

 

If you meet ALL of the above criteria, let’s talk!

If you’re interested, please complete the following 2- step process to begin - this is the only way to contact us regarding the position.

 

1- complete this application: http://sylviemccracken.pages.ontraport.net/Enrollment-Coach

 

2- Take this quick assessment and email us the results to support@sylviemccracken.com : tonyrobbins.com/disc

 

3- Create a quick (under 3 min) video on WHY you are the perfect person for this role, and send to us at support@sylviemccracken.com (you can upload to YouTube or similar as unlisted and send us the link)

 

We'll contact you if you’ve been selected to move to the next step.

 

Thank you!

Sylvie McCracken


Founder & CEO of Ebook Engines

items.title: Senior Manager of Complaint Handling
items.content:
Senior Manager of Complaint Handling at Philips

Remote
  • United States of America – Home Based
  • Full-time
  • 319704

Job Title: Senior Manager or Complaint Handling

Job Description

In this role, you have the opportunity to

To improve complaint operations, a Sr. Manager of Complaint Handling is required to focus on the activities supporting the Complaint Operations Function. This role is responsible for achieving critical KPIs and compliance to applicable regulations.

You are responsible for

  • Manages a team of individual contributors supporting complaint operation activities such as; new complaint handling employee onboarding, training, complaint process ownership, complaint handling database SME, records review, and continuous improvement of processes, procedures, and tools.
  • Monitors metrics and drives process improvements based on performance trends.
  • Leading the team as a people manager, motivating the team and ensuring through good leadership that defined performance outcomes are ensured.
  • Drive product quality improvements and support quality-based processes to ensure the highest quality of our products and solutions as well as compliance with all applicable regulations and requirements. This includes teaming up with business partners to share feedback in order to improve product performance.
  • Ensure proper analysis of product quality, safety, and reliability issues and effective communication to management and other functions.
  • Initiate and facilitate corrective or preventative actions as needed.
  • Ensure quality customer and regulatory communications.
  • Assisting in the development and implementation of strategic goal and objectives.
  • Establishes and assures adherence to budgets, schedules, work plans, and performance requirements.
  • Support and participate in internal and external audits.

You are a part of

You will be part of the Monitoring and Analytics & Therapeutic Care business group management team and will report directly to the Head of Complaint Handling.

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Management and strong leadership skills in a challenging working environment with a proven track record of 3+ years of experience in managing complaint handling team with responsibilities covering training, complaint process ownership, TrackWise SME.
  • 7+ years of related experience in a medical device or regulated industry preferably in combination with Post Market Surveillance and related processes.
  • 3+ of daily usage of electronic complaint handling system, preferably TrackWise
  • Experience in working under compliance enforcement such as; Consent Decree, Warning Letter
  • Working knowledge of appropriate global medical device regulations, requirements, and standards, such as 21 CFR Parts 803, 806, and 820, ISO13485, ISO14971, European Medical Device Directive (93/42/EEC), Canadian Medical Devices Regulation (SOR/98-282), Japanese MHLW Ordinance 169;
  • Has wide-ranging experience, uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills at all levels in the organization, a real people manager.
  • Good analytical skills and process improvement capabilities with the ability to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
  • Strong written and oral communications skills.
  • High reliability and quality focus.
  • High engagement, motivation and flexibility.

In return, we offer you

The opportunity to manage a team currently going through rapid growth. This person will be trusted to implement a strategy to improve regulatory compliance and process efficiency. This person will be collaborating with post market leadership to transition the organization to meet EU MDR post market surveillance compliance.

Why should you join Philips?

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways.

To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.

It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to age, color, citizenship, disability or perceived disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital or domestic partner status, military or veteran status, national origin, pregnancy/childbirth, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws. Philips is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Apply for job

items.content:
Villa Sales Specialist at World Travel Holdings

Remote | Entry-level

Villa Sales Specialist

Job Locations: US-Remote

Category: Sales

Type: Regular Full-Time

Are you passionate about sales? Do you possess luxury travel experience? Would you like to work from home? If yes, this may be the role for you!

World Travel Holdings is seeking a Villa Specialist to work in our Luxury Division. In this role, you will maximize revenue by successfully building client relationships, closing sales, and maintaining client relationships that generate repeat business and referrals. Completing paper work, administrative functions and other non-phone work related to the effective processing of customer Villa rentals to provide a remarkable client experience.

About World Travel Holdings
World Travel Holdings is the world’s largest cruise agency and award-winning leisure travel company with a portfolio of more than 40 diverse brands. In addition to owning some of the largest brands distributing cruises, villas, hotels, resort vacations, cars and luxury travel services, World Travel Holdings has a vast portfolio of licensed private label partnerships comprised of top leisure travel providers, including almost every U.S. airline, leading hotel brands and prominent corporations. The company also operates a top-rated travel agency franchise and the country’s original host agency, and is consistently recognized as an industry leader in work-at-home employment. Its global presence includes operating multiple cruise and vacation brands in the United Kingdom. World Travel Holdings has offices in Wilmington, Mass.; Ft. Lauderdale, Fla.; Virginia Beach, Va.; New York, NY; and Chorley, England. For more information, visit WorldTravelHoldings.com.

© World Travel Holdings Inc; 100 Fordham Road; Bldg C; Wilmington, MA 01887; USA

Responsibilities

  • Handle all company supplied villa leads in a polite and courteous manner, and in accordance with WTH sales guidelines. Convey enthusiasm to customers with a genuine desire to be of service.
  • Effectively identify the full extent of the customer’s requirements to optimize sales of villa products and services. Use your product and destination expertise to make full-experience recommendations to the customer.
  • Work with villa suppliers to confirm availability, process and release holds, and invoice the customer once a purchasing decision has been made.
  • Inform customers of the appropriate terms and conditions along with any other relevant information relating to their villa reservation. Highly recommend the purchase of trip protection throughout the quoting and booking process.
  • Input reservations using the company reservation and invoicing system. Ensure comprehensive and accurate collection of all appropriate customer information, and send invoice, contract and accompanying documents to customer in a timely manner.
  • Complete paper work, administrative functions and other non-phone work related to the effective processing of customer villa rentals.
  • Execute Villa’s “Guest First” philosophy in all interactions.
  • Build rapport and long-term relationships with customers.
  • Maintain periodic contact with existing and prospective customers through outbound efforts to generate new business and build a repeat client base.
  • Ensure performance goals are achieved consistently and in accordance with WTH luxury brands quality standards.
  • Initially deal with customer inquiries and complaints involving the Supervisor or Customer Service when appropriate.
  • Work with peers within the villa division Buddy System framework.
  • Report to assigned team meetings and/or training sessions.
  • Enhance product knowledge by completing online, on-demand courses as required.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 2+ years selling luxury travel; experience with villa travel preferred
  • Demonstrated ability to interact successfully with affluent clientele
  • Strong destination-based knowledge of popular luxury vacation destinations such as France, Italy, Mexico, Europe, Hawaii and the Caribbean
  • Highly motivated to sell; ability to build strong customer relationships and offer exceptional service
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills to include personable, professional telephone etiquette
  • Self-disciplined and accountable for achievement of goals, continuous learning and self-improvement
  • Demonstrated proficiency with the internet and Microsoft applications including Word, Excel and Outlook
  • As a work at home agent, you must be able to provide a designated space for a home office free of distractions, high speed internet connection (minimum Internet speeds of 2.0 Mbps upload and 5 Mbps download) and a separate phone land line (not over the internet) dedicated to this position. Please note this home office must not be in the same residence as another current World Travel Holdings’ at home employee.
  • Must be able to work a flexible, full-time schedule (40 hours per week). Core hours for villa sales are Mon-Fri, 8a-8p EST and Sat/Sun, 9a-6p EST (hours subject to change).
  • Must be a resident and live in one of the following states: AL, AZ, AR, CO, CT, DE, FL, GA, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, LA, ME, MD, MA, MI, MN, MS, MO, MT, NV, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, OK, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VT, VA, WA, WV, WI, and WY
Apply for job

items.title: Junior Purchasing Buyer
items.content:
Junior Purchasing Buyer at Danette May Mindful Health

Remote | Entry-level
  • Remote
  • Full Time
  • Product Management
  • Entry Level

Mindful Health is the company behind America’s Leading Healthy Lifestyle expert, Danette May. Danette May is also the founder of The Rise movement and the superfood company iRise Organics, and the author of the book The Rise: An Unforgettable Journey of Self-Love, Forgiveness, and Transformation (Hay House 2018). She is also the bestselling author of the books 7-Day Jumpstart, Bikini Body Detox, and Bikini Body Recipes. Her programs include the online coaching and membership program Fit Rise; exercise DVDs, recipe books, online health and fitness challenges, and healthy lifestyle and mindfulness coaching. The Danette May brand focuses on the three pillars of healing: healing foods, healing movement, and a healing mindset.

Mindful Health was named #48 on the Inc. 500 2018 list of the fastest-growing private companies in the US. Through our various entities, iRise Organics and FitRise, we strive to change the world via healing & organic foods, sustainable eco-friendly packaging, and a healthy approach to body movement and mindfulness. We seek individuals who are passionate about healthy living, are on a personal path of growth and are committed to transforming the world around them in their own way. We believe that we are all individually empowered to change the world.

For more information on our Company and culture please visit www.danettemay.com/career

This position is fully remote, telecommute, work from home.

Intent:

The Junior Purchasing Buyer will have the main responsibility of planning, organizing, and supervising the comprehensive purchasing functions for the nutritional supplement, superfood, and overall products business of iRise Organics. This individual will have a strong focus on compliance with mandated requirements and will oversee daily activities related to major purchases. Will also respond to a range of inquiries regarding processes or outstanding purchase orders and invoices. They will report into the Director of Products and will assist with negotiating terms and conditions with vendors and/or service providers and achieving department objectives and goals within budget.

Description & Influence:

  • Maintain all purchase orders, manage invoicing process for all products and orders with our main fulfillment center, as well as vendors
  • Track inventory levels and products to ensure adequate stock levels
  • Source, price, and purchase raw materials, components, and operating supplies
  • Issue, follow-up on, and maintain purchase order system, including files
  • Maintain production schedule for weekly meeting as it pertains to material arrival date.
  • Work with Quality Control to qualify new vendors and raw materials
  • Obtain proof of Certificate of Liability Insurance from vendors annually
  • Obtain Bio-terrorism Registrations from vendors and follow up as necessary
  • Obtain Certificates of Analysis for all raw materials and Finished product
  • Obtain Specifications Sheets when available
  • Liaison with fulfillment centers: Update Inventory, PO, ASNs, RMAs, Ending balance, and order special inventory for special events.
  • Obtain Vendor Qualification reports: Yearly
  • Site visit and Audits in the absence of Quality Auditor
  • Maintain vendor files
  • Assist in determining purchasing schedule
  • Maintain professional relationship with vendors
  • Work alongside Director of Products to negotiate pricing with vendors
  • Work with Accounting to ensure invoices are paid on time
  • Ensure cGMP and FDA compliance with the Purchasing function
  • Understand and abide by the policies detailed in the Employee Handbook
  • Due to changing workloads, employees will be required to work in multiple areas and may be required to perform other duties or tasks on an as needed basis.
  • Perform additional projects as delegated by the Director of Products

Background & Experience:

  • 2 years experience with Manufacturing ERP Systems. A preference will be given to Process Pro or Batchmaster.
  • Associates 2 year degree preferred in accounting, business management or similar experience
  • Ideal background in nutraceuticals, pharmaceuticals, parts manufacturing, food or nutritional supplements
  • Must obtain a working knowledge of regulatory/quality requirements and perform within all Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and policies.
  • Moderate to Expert(preferred) MS Excel, Word.
  • MRP experience preferred
  • Strong attention to detail with an ability to plan and manage projects
  • Strong understanding of accounting principles as they relate to invoicing payment and receipt tracking
  • Articulate and able to interact and communicate with outside vendors and internal stakeholders
  • Inventory management experience a plus
  • Contract negotiation a plus but not required
  • Purchasing and cost/expense management.
  • Able to function in a quality driven environment.
  • Typing speed of 40 WPM
  • Strong work ethic with the ability to take ownership, roll up sleeves, and get things done
  • Must have an entrepreneurial spirit

items.title: Truvani: Director of Sales
items.content:
Director of Sales

Who We Are & What We Do 

Truvani is a health and wellness brand that has one clear mission: create products people use in their daily lives with CLEAN ingredients.
Many companies claim it. We actually mean it.

Our co-founder Vani Hari, better known as The Food Babe, started out as an activist who wanted to hold big companies accountable for what they put into their products. And she made tremendous progress with the help of her online following dubbed "The Food Babe Army."

But after years of fighting, she realized that the only way to make a truly lasting change in the food system is to compete with these big companies head-to-head.

So, she launched Truvani. We are a fast paced, high-growth health and wellness company that is looking to work with talented, ambitious people who want to create the best health and wellness products.

About The Position

Truvani is looking for a Director of Sales to join our team. You’ll be responsible for expanding distribution in the US, aligned with the national sales strategy. By delivering best in class new product launches, sales planning and customer engagement, you will be playing a vital role in the growth of Truvani.

Our Ideal Candidate

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing or related field
  • Experience in the Grocery and Natural Channels (including but not limited to: Hannaford, Earth Fare, Giant Eagle Safeway) with CPG selling background in dry grocery
  • Established relationships and demonstrated success working with key retail accounts along with the leading brokers and distributors (KeHE, UNFI, DPI) servicing these channels
  • Strong planning and organizational skills along with excellent interpersonal, written/oral communication and presentation skills, including full competence with Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint & Word)
  • Proven ability to work independently as well as collaboratively
  • Demonstrated ability to excel in an autonomous, hands-on, fast paced entrepreneurial environment
  • Highly adaptable & resourceful with a pioneering spirit
  • Proficient in Data Tools (SPINS, Nielsen, Retailer Portals), Microsoft Excel and Trade Analytics (selling price, margins, etc.)
  • Ability to travel extensively

Your Responsibilities Include

  • Directly call on major retailer’s headquarters
  • Build a strategic and collaborative annual trade promotion calendar for retail customers
  • Identify and execute on opportunities to expand the sales of Truvani across all Channels
  • Request and analyze distribution reports to determine market coverage and opportunities for future growth
  • Set performance expectations and manage all appointed brokers and distributors to achieve quality distribution in targeted accounts, timely execution of new item introductions, schematic implementation and promotional programming and ensure that they have all necessary resources required to succeed in the market place (e.g., product samples, sell sheets, promotional calendars, etc.)
  • Attend trade shows to represent the brand and develop sales opportunities
  • Identify opportunities to build strong connections with key individuals and form meaningful and impactful relationships to continue to drive growth, beyond distribution
  • Offer strategic direction, guidance, and support to brokerage teams that align with Truvani business goals
  • Conduct store audits (with broker management and/or field sales reps where possible) to ensure merchandising standards are adhered to and promotional programming is being executed
  • Assist in the implementation, training, and auditing of brokerage teams and distributor territory reps to execute sell in and sell through initiatives
  • Utilize existing resources to run sales reports and analysis to support future sales initiatives and decisions
  • Manage relationships with key distributor buyers and supporting teams in the region

The Nitty Gritty

  • Full time market-based compensation based on experience
  • Health benefits offered after 60 days
  • Paid time off and paid holidays
  • Position is available immediately and will remain open until filled
  • This is a permanent position with an opportunity to grow within the company (so we would like to hire someone that is awesome and is excited about being a part of our team).

items.title: B2B business development lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
WHO IS BEELINE?

Beeline is on a mission to help the world have better journeys on two wheels through great navigation software and hardware. Founded in 2015 by Mark and Tom, two friends who wanted to solve getting lost in London on their bikes, Beeline has now grown into a healthy young business with big ambitions to grow (currently in discussions with VC backers to accelerate this further)


Beeline’s first product, the Velo, is a beautifully designed device that sits on the bike handlebar and gives navigation guidance to the rider. It was launched on Kickstarter in 2015, and has since sold over 10,000 units. The Moto (the edition for motorcycles) is launching this month and has already taken over 9,000 pre-orders. The first deal to integrate into shared bikes and scooters, or micromobility, has recently been confirmed, with several others in the pipeline – the number of Beeline users will at least triple in the next 9 months. In parallel, we’re building machine learning mapping and routing algorithms dedicated to bikes and scooters, with backing from the European Space Agency.

Micromobility is set to be part of the transport solution for our ever more crowded cities. So it’s not only the hottest topic in tech right now but done right, has the potential to have a real impact for good by decongesting and depolluting our cities.

We firmly believe that great navigation will be a key enabler to that growth and are very excited to have closed our first deal (the first in the industry). However, we want to be THE navigation provider to this whole industry, not just to one player, and we need someone to lead the charge on that ambition.

WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for someone to work directly with the founders of the business to drive our growth into micrombility. The role will be a blend of strategy and sales - becoming an expert in this fast growing industry and building strong relationships with decision makers inside some of the fastest growing tech companies right now as well as the city officials who are trying to keep up with them. You’ll also help shape our product strategy by bringing your thinking to how we offer value to these operators beyond just navigation and cement our position as an invaluable layer in the industry.

You’ll have a year or two of commercial experience under your belt and be comfortable with market analysis. More important than your experience will be your ability to think analytically, look at the big strategic picture and most importantly, be fascinated by how the shifts in urban transport could change the shape of cities in the future!


IMPACT OF THE WORK:
Two wheeled transport is set to play a huge role in the future of our cities as well as a leisure activity, and we think our products will be a key enabler to this growth. Bike use is growing for good reasons – the combined impact of improving citizens’ health and wellbeing as well as the broader environmental benefits make this a no brainer.

The trend in micromobility is a huge driver in this change (as well as two wheeled delivery fleets like Deliveroo and Uber Eats and the growth of e-bikes). Providing them with great navigation will both enable them to grow and maximise their positive impact and will likely be the strongest area of growth for our business for the next few years. So you’ll be absolutely pivotal in the success of Beeline as well as making the world a better place.


WE CAN OFFER YOU:
A competitive salary and generous options (shares)
Hands on startup experience working with the founders in a business-critical role
A part to play in the future of urban transport
A relaxed, supportive and jovial team culture - we aim to take our work seriously without taking ourselves too seriously. Socials in the pub or running round the local park are commonplace!
The opportunity to shape the future of this young, growing company

YOU CAN OFFER US:
1-3 years commercial experience (likely finance or consulting, but not a must)
Interest in the future of cities and mobility
A rounded skillset:
Research skills
analytical skills for developing Go-To-Market strategy
Strong interpersonal skills for developing relations with cities and operators
Creativity, especially for product strategy
Comfortable designing and implementing processes - this is a fairly new role in a fast-paced area: adaptability and speed of execution will be crucial

items.title: Nurse Disease Management I
items.content:
Nurse Disease Management I at Anthem, Inc.

Remote
  • United States
  • Medical
  • PS21748

Your Talent. Our Vision. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care.

This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America’s leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.

Nurse Disease Management I

  • CA, NV, WA
  • Location: Work At Home – Anywhere in the US
  • You must be able to work your shift in your time zone – no flexibility
  • Work hours:
    • 8:30 am – 5:30 pm PST
    • 11:00 am – 8:00 pm EST
    • 10:30 am – 7:30 pm CST

The Nurse Disease Management I is responsible for participating in delivery of patient education and disease management interventions and for performing health coaching for members, across multiple lines, for health improvement/management programs for chronic diseases. Primary duties may include, but are not limited to:

  • Conducts behavioral or clinical assessments to identify individual member knowledge, skills and behavioral needs.
  • Identifies and/or coordinates specific health coaching plan needs to address objectives and goals identified during assessments.
  • Interfaces with provider and other health professionals to coordinate health coaching plan for the member.
  • Implements and/or coordinates coaching and/or care plans by educating members regarding clinical needs and facilitating referrals to health professionals for behavioral health needs.
  • Uses motivational interviewing to facilitate health behavior change.
  • Monitors and evaluates effectiveness of interventions and/or health coaching plans and modifies as needed.
  • Directs members to facilities, community agencies and appropriate provider/network.
  • Refers member to catastrophic case management.

Requirements:

  • Requires an AS/BS in nursing; 2 years of condition specific clinical or home health/discharge planning experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
  • Current unrestricted RN license in current state(s) required.
  • Prior case management experience preferred.
  • A current unrestricted CA, NV, and/or WA RN license is required. (You must have one of these currently to be considered, will have to obtain the others once employed).
  • Manage care experience.
  • Previous work at home experience preferred.

Anthem, Inc. is ranked as one of America’s Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine and is a 2018 DiversityInc magazine Top 50 Company for Diversity. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.antheminc.com. An Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran.

items.title: Sales Representative
items.content:
Sales Representative at VIDA Select

Remote | Part-time

TITLE:  Can you sell love? [Superstars only]

No need to read further unless you are an overachiever and can prove it.

We don’t hire backgrounds. We hire top producers.

Whether you’re…

  • Looking for extra money to supplement your income from another sales job.
  • A mom who’d like to earn from home selling something that changes lives.
  • Simply someone who’d like to come build an empire within our fast-growing matchmaking company.

…If you have the stuff, we’ll know!

  • We are looking for a superstar with a fun, outgoing personality who knows how to make ‘em say “Yes.”
  • You’ll be doing phone calls with singles – primarily men – who have signed up for a free consultation at www.VirtualDatingAssistants.com because they are interested in learning more about our matchmaking services.
  • You must be highly self-managed, a buttoned-up presenter, great communicator and an unstoppable closer.
  • If you’re average, you can earn 20 dollars per hour with us from the comfort of your home. If you are a star, you can easily earn 30 to 40 dollars an hour in your pajamas.
  • This is a part-time opportunity with the potential to become full-time if you’d like to increase your hours over time.

Think you’ve got what it takes?

items.content:
Senior Accounts & Campaigns Manager

Based in London

£35,000 - £45,000 + Benefits

Deadline: Sunday 23rd June 2019, 11:59pm

Application Method: CV and Covering Letter, both no more than 2 pages please.

Due to the high number of applications that we receive we are sadly unable to get back to everyone. If you haven’t heard from us by Wednesday 3rd July 2019, it means that you haven’t been successful this time.

Semble is looking for an experienced accounts / campaigns manager to lead on the delivery of high profile, purpose led projects and campaigns.

● Do you have two or more years’ clearly demonstrable experience delivering high profile projects or campaigns in a busy environment

● Are you self-motivated, resilient, and with bags of energy?

● Do you have a track record of working with existing clients and partners to develop new opportunities?

● Do you believe in the power of communities and corporations coming together and taking positive action to change the world?


If that’s four big ticks from you then you should definitely read on! If it isn't, please, please, please don't apply for this particular role. These are essential requirements, and we'd hate you to waste your time.

1. What is the purpose of this role?

Ultimately you will be responsible for delivering some of the high-profile campaigns and projects in Semble’s growing portfolio.

A close second to that will be a natural flair and passion for ensuring that Semble is constantly striving to be the best that it can possibly be.

Thirdly, you will also need to be comfortable with spotting new opportunities and developing those, with the support of the new business team.

2. What are the key responsibilities for this role?

To ensure campaigns and projects are delivered to time and to budget
To ensure contracts and finances are well managed
To report and evaluate impact of the campaign
To ensure data is managed securely
To constantly strive to improve systems and processes
To ensure all partners are supported and kept up to date with the campaign as a whole
Managing members of the delivery team
3. What are the minimum skills, knowledge and experience needed for this role?

At least 3 years’ experience of end-to-end management of large purpose-led or change programmes, projects or campaigns
Experience of managing a diverse team, preferably including remote management
Experience of successfully developing relationships with external and internal clients and stakeholders at all levels
A clear and demonstrable understanding of what the challenges are when working for a small business or start-up
Experience of developing complex project plans and comfortable managing budgets and performance in a target driven environment
Experience of working within a tightly knit team, but needing to be largely self-motivated
Experience of developing and improving processes, tools and systems
Experience of using data for analysing and reporting on performance of a large campaign
Skilled at thinking creatively to develop new approaches and materials to further engage external stakeholders
Ability to manage own workload effectively
Ability to manage a team and build effective processes
Ability to use initiative and draw on experience in dealing with day-to-day tasks, risks and challenges
Desirable skills, knowledge and experiences

Experience of data protection and GDPR
Experience within, or working with, the community sector
Knowledge or experience of marketing and communications theory and practise, particularly for digital.
Experience of fundraising or proposal writing
Experience of Theory of Change journey
4. About Semble and Our Community
Semble is the UK’s most active network of community projects with an online platform that currently hosts over 3,500 environmental and social projects. We connect community projects with local people and companies who want to help them to achieve their goals and join their story.


Our vision is: Bring people together to make a change

For the last five years, Semble has been growing its platform for community projects nationally and developing an impressive client base. We’re building the team, developing our brand and platform, and are now looking for someone to help us super-charge our community!

We run projects such as #Made Local, #GreenerwithGreggs (an environmental fund for Greggs), #GivexCollaborate (a team-based volunteering campaign for Dentsu Aegis Network), #YourPintCan (a neighbourhood investment fund for Carling), and Outdoor Classroom Day (a global day to get over 20m children outdoors to learn & play at school, in partnership with Unilever and a network of NGOs). Last year we ran the Offline Festival for community businesses.

5. Benefits & Further Details
In this role, you will be working closely with the Head of Client Campaigns and the wider team. You will have significant opportunities for personal development and play an important role in developing and nurturing our community.

We have a lot of fun, with drinks evenings, picnics & team away days. Community volunteering is actively encouraged with each team member having 2 days per year to volunteer, and at least 2 days to visit community projects to find out more about how Semble can help them, and to collect stories and content for social media and the Semble platform.

Other benefits include:
• £35,000 – £45,000 depending on experience
• Central London location, with option of working remotely for part of the time
• 25 days holiday allowance p.a.• 25 days holiday allowance p.a.
• Pension contribution
• Clear training opportunities and career path progression
• Discretionary bonus scheme, related to business performance
• Shared gym membership

No Recruitment Agencies please, you do a great job but we’ve got this one covered.

items.content:
Digital Ad Specialist/Media Buyer

Snappy Kraken is an award-winning MarTech company and voted #14 of 50 Best Places to Work in FinTech. We are truly changing how financial professionals do business, for the better! We're looking for a Remote Digital Ad Specialist to join our dynamic remote team.

The Digital Ad Specialist will help elevate the value Snappy Kraken brings to our clients by: (1) helping them increase awareness and generate leads through online ads, (2) helping demystify the world of digital advertising for advisers (and make it profitable for them!).

Think you're the one? Ask yourself:

  • Do I quickly grasp and master new technology and platforms?

  • Do I understand the principles of digital marketing?

  • Can I create and refine processes to promote efficiency and results?

  • Am I a collaborator and innovator?

  • Am I self-managed and do I exercise good judgment?

If you answered yes to all of these questions, we want to hear from you!

To be considered, all of the following must be submitted with your application:

1) Make a 3-minute or less video about yourself and what makes you the best candidate for this position. Provide the link to your video in the questionnaire.

2) Upload your current resume and salary requirements.

Benefits for FT employees:

  • Competitive compensation and a remote work environment

  • Health/Dental/Vision/Life/AD&D/STD/LTD available after 90 days with employer premium contribution

  • 401k with company match available after 6 months

  • PTO and paid holidays

  • More perks and benefits

Check out our website to see what we're all about atwww.snappykraken.com

At this time, only candidates authorized to work in the United States should apply.

items.title: OUTRIGGER ADVISORY GROUP: Senior Account Executive, Marketing Consultant

hiringOrganization.name: HotjarFull-TimeEMEAHubbard Digital Pty. Ltd.ContractUSA, Australia, Canada, New ZealandCastosFull-TimeAnywhere - Remote

items.content:
Senior Account Executive, Marketing Consultant

Senior Account Executive, Marketing Consultant
We're looking for a high performing salesperson with the ability to onboard new clients and maintain accounts. OUTRIGGER ADVISORY GROUP is a marketing and operations consulting firm offering a full-service automated marketing and analytics systems customized to help companies increase their revenue.

You tend to have an entrepreneurial-like working style. You're proud to help others and are an expert at the consultative closing technique. You connect with people and build rapport with ease. You enjoy helping customers grow their business. You're a go-getter, yet you're not out to sell just anything to make a quick buck. Your ethics and drive to produce long-lasting partnerships are a high priority. You have great relationships established with decision makers with SMB's and/or larger corporations. You are a fast-action taker and hit the ground running without overanalyzing. You like a fast-paced workflow and thrive on getting results for both our team and our customers. This role will report to the CEO directly and will be an integral part of the team. This role is partly remote. The selected candidate will be meeting with companies on-site as well as attend scheduled meeting both online and in-person.

APPLY HERE - http://bit.ly/2Vu5xB2

What you’ll do:
As an Account Executive, you will consult with businesses to discover their marketing needs and present proposals for workshops and/or marketing services. You will have training on the systems and learn our consultative closing methods to better assist customers and close new business. Metrics will be established with you to determine your level of commitment and ability to find and close new business. This is mostly a remote position with weekly in-person meetings via internet, phone, or in-person.

Primary Responsibilities:
You will mainly be following our sales and marketing plans and conducting prospecting and sales related tasks. You will produce and maintain lead lists, make initial contact to establish rapport, and meet with prospects to analyze their current marketing strategies. Once you understand what they need, you will research their online presence and develop a customized report and develop a proposal. Then, you will deliver the presentation and offer workshops and the best multi-media options to support their objectives.

Experience and Skills:
·     5-8 Years of sales experience with a marketing agency or a small business in a sales role
·     Understands digital marketing channels, such as Facebook ads, YouTube ads, Instagram ads, and Google Ads
·     Proficient working with spreadsheets and entering data and CRM's
·     High energy with a positive attitude
·     Strong work ethic with a drive to produce sales
·     Self-starter, capable of working independently
·     Self-managed
·     Provide reports and input data for various metrics
·     Attend events to prospect for new business
·     Speak at events as an expert in the industry
·     Capable to follow a system for lead generation
·     Capable of time management and conducting income producing activities
·     Follow-up on leads and current clients
·     Work with the structured marketing plans and input data into CRM
·     Task-oriented
·     Well-versed with marketing automation technology
·     Capable of outreach including cold calling, meeting face-to-face
·     Willing to provide info for a background check and work-related references
·     Reliable transportation with a valid drivers license and insurance
·     Be able to sit for several hours at one time at a computer, capable of driving to and from appointments, and have high-speed internet access

Ideal Candidate:
·     Has experience selling marketing, workshops, or corporate training packages
·     Has a database of businesses in Colorado or a book of business
·     Previously ran business development for a small business
·     Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Business, Marketing, PR, or Media
·     Understands the consultative closing technique
·     Thrives on learning new skills and growing new business

Contract role with the opportunity for advancement to a full-time employee.

items.title: Ad Monetization Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Ad Monetization Manager at Jaumo

Remote | International

ABOUT US

We’re looking for a new teammate in our lean company (24 people from 14 different countries, over 60% engineers), and give you the opportunity to be part of a fascinating journey. We’ve seen incredible growth over the last 8 years, driven by a talented and versatile yet small team. It worked well so far, but now we want more.

We’re looking for a passionate expert who owns ad monetization at our company. Someone who loves experimenting and trying new things, but someone who also really genuinely cares about our users. You will help build the most engaging user experience that solves customer needs and maximizes revenue.

ABOUT THE ROLE

You are an Ad Monetization Manager (f/m/d) with strong experience, and you will be an essential part of our bootstrapped and 100% remote company with a flat organizational structure. The position is full-time. This is an excellent career opportunity to join a fast-growing company in a key position.

WE OFFER YOU

  • a great work-life balance – work whenever you want from wherever you are. Results – not hours. We care about what you achieve.
  • no bullshit – we are a fact- and engineering-driven company (including the founders)
  • to work on something important. A lot of businesses say they change lives, but we actually do it. We’ve helped millions of people find love and happiness.
  • 30 days paid vacation
  • a competitive salary

YOU WILL

  • be responsible for the ad monetization strategy of our award-winning apps – used by over a million active users every day
  • develop a deep understanding of our different customers and their needs; leverage this understanding to optimize our ad revenue strategy
  • be the primary point of contact on all things ad operations
  • own Mopub, Admob, Facebook Audience Network, and other partners including waterfall management, QA, reporting, optimization
  • oversee daily ad revenue
  • design, manage and analyze ad revenue experiments
  • manage and optimize digital campaigns executed in a programmatic ecosystem (supply and demand side)
  • be an active part in our cross-functional growth squad: work closely with engineers and growth marketers to uncover insights and new opportunities for growth and revenue
  • have a significant voice in our product strategy and portfolio of dating apps
  • make a difference in a small team of experts

REQUIREMENTS

An ideal candidate is autonomous, proactive, and brings bold thinking to the organization fostering an environment of innovation and experimentation. We’re looking for a person with a growth mindset that helps us lay the foundation for the next 10+ years of growth. We’re a bootstrapped company that doesn’t have millions in VC funding to drive growth at all cost. We’re building a sustainable, long-term company that our users love, and we love working for.

YOU

  • bring minimum 2+ years in the programmatic advertising ecosystem from a publisher standpoint
  • have preferably professional experience with a similar app including display, native ads, rewarded video, and offer walls
  • have experience in major ad serving platforms (DFP, AdX, mopub) and digital ad operations
  • have proven experience working with a variety of stakeholders in the ad tech space including SSPs, ad exchanges, agencies, ad verification providers, DMP’s, DSP’s.
  • are familiar with performance optimization and mobile marketing platforms like Adjust, Appsflyer, etc and ad tech dashboards like Mopub, Admob, FAN, etc
  • are proactive, resourceful and entrepreneurial, with little need for supervision and not afraid of failure
  • have done UA and Facebook campaign management as a bonus
  • have a lean, fact-driven, process and KPI-oriented mentality
  • have a high comfort with data and analytical thinking including a strong understanding of statistics. This will be a huge advantage for both being effective in the role and being a cultural fit
  • have strong project management, execution, and excellent verbal/written communication skills
  • can make things happen and you will not be here just to tell other people what to do

If this profile matches your expertise, experience, and aspirations, we’d be delighted to receive your full application, including references, salary requirements, and possible starting date.

Apply for job

items.title: Truvani: Partnership/Affiliate Manager

hiringOrganization.name: Hubbard Digital Pty. Ltd.ContractUSA, Australia, Canada, New ZealandCastosFull-TimeAnywhere - RemoteCartStackFull-TimeNorth America Only

items.content:
Partnership/Affiliate Manager

Truvani is looking for a seasoned Partnership/Affiliate Manager to join our team. You’ll be the point person for our affiliate program. You’ll be responsible for recruiting, managing, and motivating affiliates, as well as tracking, analyzing, and optimizing affiliate performance.

Our ideal candidate is a self-starter with strong prospecting skills. You must be willing to get creative in researching and recruiting new affiliates.

Our Ideal Candidate

  • The ultimate people person with exemplary relationship building skills.
  • Organized and detail-oriented. You’ll be responsible for overseeing all aspects of our affiliate program, from recruiting and onboarding new affiliates to consulting throughout the affiliate relationship.
  • A problem solver with the ability to anticipate and solve issues before they happen.
  • Proven track record in performance-based marketing models.
  • Experienced in tracking, analyzing, and optimizing campaigns.
  • Strong prospecting skills with the ability to get creative in finding new affiliate opportunities and negotiating deals.
  • A multi-tasker with strong analytic, reporting, and time management skills.
  • Has the ability to manage multiple affiliates simultaneously, set priorities, and work independently.

Your Responsibilities Include

  • Recruit, manage, and motivate affiliates / partners to promote Truvani products.
  • Research and identify potential affiliates and partners in the health and wellness realm as well as in complementary industries.
  • Oversee all aspects of our affiliate program, from recruiting to initial enrollment to consulting throughout the affiliate relationship.
  • Monitor affiliate activity, analyze performance, identify areas of improvement, and recommend ways to optimize performance and increase affiliate-generated revenues.
  • Work with marketing team to coordinate and monitor affiliate launches; provide performance feedback to marketing team.
  • Set and exceed monthly, quarterly, and annual goals for revenue - and help affiliates do the same.

The Nitty Gritty

  • Full time market-based compensation based on experience
  • Health benefits offered after 60 days
  • Paid time off and paid holidays
  • Position is available immediately and will remain open until filled

This is a permanent position with an opportunity to grow within the company (so we would like to hire someone that is awesome and is excited about being a part of our team).

Related Jobs See more Sales & Marketing jobs→

items.title: Senior Squad Captain Manager
items.content:
We’re looking for an experienced Senior Customer Support Manager to be an empathetic leader for our distributed Customer Operations (COps) team. We have 300 COps within our distributed team, and want to ensure they're all fully supported and continuously developed to perform at their best.

Our customer operations team is at the heart of Monzo

Every person in this team cares about our customers’ problems and is empowered to solve them quickly and with minimal fuss. We work in small squads of 8-10 people, which are split between communication channels and time periods. Some squads specialise in social media responses, helping customers over the phone or responding via in-app chat.

As Senior Squad Captain Manager, you’ll provide support and leadership

You’ll directly manage a number of Squad Captain Managers so they can meet their personal and professional development goals. You’ll organise people around you and take quick action when you see a problem coming - whether it’s not enough people covering the right types of queries, a training need, or something going wrong. You’ll listen to your people, guide them through hard times and celebrate their successes. You’ll have responsibility for some disciplinary and grievance matters and work closely with your colleagues in London,Cardiff & Las Vegas to make sure that we apply these policies fairly across all areas of COps.

Communication between offices is a key challenge

You’ll work directly with Head of Customer Operations and senior stakeholders within COps to share ideas and support each other. You’ll make sure communication between all areas is seamless, gathering feedback and sharing the same consistent message with all team members. Our current offices include London, Cardiff and Las Vegas.

Each day you’ll be:

- Instilling a strong customer-centric culture and keeping everyone focussed on what really matters: helping our customers with their personal financial lives
- Helping Squad Captain Managers outperform in their roles by: having regular 1:1s; giving and receiving feedback about people, process and QA; coaching, mentoring, and developing high performing squads and captains
- Running leadership group sessions, e.g. knowledge sharing
- Supporting the interviewing and hiring of new Managers/Squad Captains/COps
- Helping us become an exceptional place to work for the ambitious, highly motivated COps that we hire

You should apply if:

-You have significant senior management experience, ideally in a customer-centric role
- You’ve led successful teams to achieve their goals and have an empathetic leadership style
- You’re as comfortable working 1:1 as communicating with large groups
- You empower your people to find solutions themselves
- You can motivate teams working on ongoing operational work
- You are very hands-on and solve problems when you spot them
- What we are doing at Monzo excites you!

To be an effective Senior Manager you’ll need to know the ins and outs of the Customer Support job. You’ll have frontline COps training in your first few months and then transition into the Squad role.

Logistics:

The application process consists of a short phone interview, followed by a practical written exercise and a couple of on-site interviews at our office in London or Cardiff.
Salary is approximately £65,000 - 90,000 (dependent on skills and experience) plus stock options and other benefits.
