items.content:
Senior Recruiter, Sales Ecosystem at Medallia

Remote | Freelance

(Contract)

LOCATION: REMOTE, UNITED STATES

TEAM: TALENT ACQUISITION

ROLE TYPE: CONTRACT/CONTINGENT

Medallia’s mission is to help companies win through customer experience. The world’s best-loved brands trust Medallia’s Experience Cloud™, which embeds the pulse of the customer in an organization and empowers employees with the real-time customer data, insights, and tools they need to make every experience great. Named a leader in the most recent Forrester Wave and ranked in the 2018 Forbes Cloud 100 list, Medallia is growing quickly, with a global footprint that spans Silicon Valley, Austin, New York, Washington DC, London, Paris, Sydney, Buenos Aires, and Tel Aviv. Here, we value people for each of the aspects that make them whole. We believe that people should not be defined only by a job title—nobody is “just an engineer” or “just a salesperson.” We are each partners, parents, children, siblings, friends, and former classmates. We have different backgrounds and we celebrate different cultures. And, just like our product, we honor each of the experiences that build our people.

At Medallia we hire the whole person, not just a part of them.

A phenomenal opportunity exists within Medallia’s Talent Acquisition Team for an experienced, talent acquisition professional who is excited about not only scaling a team, but building a category. In this capacity, you will consult directly with senior sales ecosystem leaders, develop a deep understanding of Medallia’s go to market objectives, initiate innovative sourcing strategies, and identify, attract, and close top talent. With a bent for evangelism, passion for ownership, and maniacal focus on candidate experience, the ideal candidate will recall a history of success delivering results within a fast-paced, startup-style environment. If you thrive working as part of a fun, collaborative, and wickedly smart team, you’ll love the new challenge ahead of you.

Contract duration slated for 6-months with a possible opportunity for extension/conversion.

Minimum Qualifications

  • 5+ years experience in talent acquisition with expertise in hiring for sales ecosystem roles
  • Demonstrated understanding of the competitive landscape and how to research, develop, and execute against a plan to produce talent for immediate and future needs
  • Proficiency with talent acquisition technologies (ATS, CRM, sourcing tools, campaign management tools, networking technology, etc.)
  • Strong verbal and written communication capabilities, exceptional organizational skills, and an ability to prioritize competing tasks in a fast-paced environment

Preferred Qualifications

  • BA/BS in HR, Business, or related field or commensurate experience
  • 3+ years’ experience within an enterprise SaaS environment

At Medallia, we don’t just accept difference – we celebrate it and recognize the value it brings to our customers and employees. Medallia is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Equal opportunity and consideration are afforded to all qualified applicants and employees. We won’t unlawfully discriminate on the basis of gender identity or expression, race, ethnicity, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, Veteran status, sexual orientation, and any other category protected by law. Medallia is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities in accordance with the American Disabilities Act and state disability laws. items.title: Care Manager – BH
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Care Manager – BH at Magellan Health

Remote

BH

United States

R00000026622

Full Time

Under general supervision, and in collaboration with other members of the clinical team, authorizes and reviews utilization of mental health and substance abuse services provided in inpatient and intermediate care settings.
Collects and analyzes utilization data. Assists with discharge planning and ambulatory follow up activity.
Provides member assistance with mental health and substance abuse issues, and participates in special quality improvement projects.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

  • Monitors inpatient and intermediate level of care services related to mental health and substance abuse treatment to ensure medical necessity and effectiveness.
  • Provides telephone triage, crisis intervention and emergency authorizations as assigned.
  • Performs concurrent reviews for inpatient care and other levels of care as allowed by scope of practice and experience. In conjunction with providers and facilities, develops discharge plans and oversee their implementation.
  • Provides information to members and providers regarding mental health and substance abuse benefits, community treatment resources, mental health managed care programs, and company policies and procedures, and criteria.
  • Interacts with Physician Advisors to discuss clinical and authorization questions and concerns regarding specific cases.
  • Participates in quality improvement activities, including data collection, tracking, and analysis. – Maintains an active work load in accordance with National Care Manager performance standards. Works with community agencies as appropriate.
  • Proposes alternative plans of treatment when requests for services do not meet medical necessity criteria.
  • Participates in network development including identification and recruitment of quality providers as needed. Advocates for the patient to ensure treatment needs are met. Interacts with providers in a professional, respectful manner that facilitates the treatment process.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Independent behavioral health licensure ( LPC, LCSW, LPC) or RN (psychiatric)
  • Master’s level or Associate for RN
  • Two year’s clinical work experience
  • Knowledge of utilization management procedures, mental health and substance abuse community resources and providers
  • Knowledge and experience in inpatient and/or outpatient setting
  • Knowledge of DSM V or most current diagnostic edition.
  • Ability to analyze specific utilization problems, plan and implement solutions that directly influence quality of care.

Available for remote/ work from home position.

General Job Information

Title Care Manager – BH

Grade 23

Job Family Clinical Services Group

Country United States of America

FLSA Status United States of America (Exempt)

Work Experience Clinical

Education

  • Associates: Nursing (Required), Bachelors: Social Work (Required), Masters: Social Work (Required)

License and Certifications – Required

  • CEAP – Certified Employee Assistance Professional – Care Mgmt, LCSW – Licensed Clinical Social Worker – Care Mgmt, LMFT – Licensed Marital and Family Therapist – Care Mgmt, LMSW – Licensed Master Social Worker – Care Mgmt, LPC – Licensed Professional Counselor – Care Mgmt, LPN – Licensed Practical Nurse – Care Mgmt, RN – Registered Nurse, State and/or Compact State Licensure – Care Mgmt

License and Certifications – Preferred

Other Job Requirements

Responsibilities

  • Licensure is required for this position, specifically a current license that meets State, Commonwealth or customer-specific requirements.
  • One or more of the following licensure is required for this role with necessary degrees: CEAP, LMSW, LCSW, LPC, RN or LPN.
  • Minimum 2 years experience post degree in healthcare, behavioral health, psychiatric and/or substance abuse health care setting.
  • Strong organization, time management and communication skills.
  • Knowledge of utilization management procedures, mental health and substance abuse community resources and providers.
  • Knowledge and experience in inpatient and/or outpatient setting.
  • Knowledge of DSM V or most current diagnostic edition.
  • Ability to analyze specific utilization problems, plan and implement solutions that directly influence quality of care.

Magellan Health Services is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Tobacco-free workplace. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled. Every employee must understand, comply and attest to the security responsibilities and security controls unique to their position.

items.title: Sales Development Representative
items.content:
Location: Remote San Mateo CA
Role and job type:   Other…   Full-time

Job Description

This role is primarily to work on BitBounce Ads and focused on growing it into a major advertising business.

We are hiring Sales Development Representatives and Account Executives to help bring in new business and you will be one of the first on the team to execute our strategy as well as assist in building our structure and processes. We help our customers understand, craft and execute effective marketing campaigns so they can grow their business with BitBounce. This is an early, important role that is critical to our business and revenue growth.

CORE ACTIVITIES:

  • This is first and foremost a hunter role. You’ll be actively prospecting new business opportunities, onboarding customers onto BitBounce Ads as well as developing relationships with existing clients.
  • Responsible for the business development, client engagement, and sales life cycle of the BitBounce Ads platform to customers globally
  • Conduct in-depth research to identify lead opportunities and present sales strategies to BitBounce leadership
  • Document and track all potential and existing client interactions and lead follow-through using internal tools
  • Execute detailed on-site product presentations and web demonstrations of our software capabilities to C-level executives, directors, and marketing managers
  • Support BitBounce customers by acting as a product expert as well as helping them with questions and any roadblocks to them being more successful with BitBounce.
  • Designing product and process improvements with engineers, identify customer feedback and bugs.
  • Help shape our product and growth strategies.
  • Be responsible for reaching or exceeding revenue goals.
  • Attend select industry events to find new customers.

QUALIFICATIONS:

We are looking for smart, resourceful teammates with a passion for our products and helping our customers succeed with BitBounce products.

We specifically expect the following:

  • Clear and concise writing and structured thinking.
  • Highly collaborative disposition
  • Curiosity and interest in BitBounce products. If you have not already, signup for our products before we meet.
  • High level of empathy, a trustworthy personality and proven record of sales success.
  • An understanding of advertising and tech industries.
  • Knowledge of the cryptocurrency and blockchain industries is helpful.
  • Startup experience is preferred but not required.
  • Software Sales experience is preferred but not required.
  • Advertising Sales experience strongly preferred but not required.
  • This position will require occasional travel both domestic and internationally.
  • Knowledge of HubSpot products is helpful.

COMPENSATION:

  • Full time salary plus uncapped commission for closed sales
  • Opportunity for equity in a rapidly growing company
  • Health Insurance
  • 401k

Salary range

$50-65k base salary, uncapped commissions, equity

items.title: Business Development Summer Intern
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=6, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=26, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
DataSwift Summer Interns will gain a full immersion into the role of a technology salesperson, supporting every aspect of our business development pipeline. This role is intended to set undergraduate students up for a successful career in business and technology, working in a fast-moving team in a quickly scaling Startup.

You're curious, and we love that. Every business development role you’ve ever seen, or dreamed of, has been interesting to you - but it always seemed a little too much like grunt work. You’re interested in meeting people, building a network, gaining some skills, and putting your education and skills to some great work right away.

You want responsibilities, opportunities, a place to learn and a time to shine. A way to meet and engage with clients learn about new businesses.

You're one of those people who tries to keep your introduction of your company short, so that you could hear all about the people you’re talking to. You ask questions, find opportunities and gaps in knowledge, and try to bridge the gap between what people need and what you have learned (and can offer).

If you're for that kind of challenge, get in touch.

We need:

• a customer-centric, empathetic mindset

• ability to soak up knowledge...

• ...and transfer it, simply and effectively

Your colleagues and fellow students say you:

• are easy to work with

• are always on top of the latest tech/apps/trends

• think laterally

• are driven but...

• ...don't have sharp elbows

• are a person they would also enjoy going to the movies or having a coffee with

Your mom says that you:

• have been reading the business section of the newspaper since you were 10

• are an inventor at heart

• get your hands dirty

What’s in it for you:

• you get an immersive education in the real world, and full autonomy

• a complete crash course on early stage startups, investment, technology, and sales

• a brill new network that will sort you for life

• flexible work: working from home when you want, where you want, why you want to (we trust you)

• continual learning & development opportunities

• quarterly sprints around the world - we’ll fly you in for team building and learning (the last one was in Cyprus)

• a competitive stipend to help you pay rent

Compensation: £10,000-25,000 commensurate with experience

Equity: 0.01 - 0.025%

DataSwift is rewriting how the entire technology industry - the entire world! - builds apps and websites. The days of companies owning all the data, and doing whatever they want with it when the users have no say are over. We’re helping make more modern, more decentralised technologies with an infrastructure that’s going to scale to take over the world. We’ve been covered in Wired (https://www.wired.co.uk/article/gdpr-personal-data-private-data-accounts) and the Financial Times (https://www.ft.com/content/3278e6dc-67af-11e7-9a66-93fb352ba1fe) and we’re looking for someone like you.

Get in touch with us through our partners at Mark and Maven by emailing Maven Camilla at maven.camilla@markandmaven.com.

items.content:
TRX is recruiting a Sales Co-ordinator to join the sales team rolling out the TRX system across the globe. You will be based in London in the glorious surroundings of Somerset House.

TRX is a pioneering startup revolutionising the TV distribution industry. Bringing together experts from TV Content Production, Rights Management and Technology, TRX makes thousands of hours of television content available from over 100 leading content providers such as All3 Media, BBC Studios, Lionsgate, GMA, Mediacorp, Sky Vision, Studio Canal and Zee Entertainment for TV buyers globally to acquire content in a streamlined and effective way.

TRX has an advisory board of key industry figures including Andrea Wong, former President Sony International and John Ford, former President at Discovery Communications US.

The Role:

Reporting to the Senior Sales Manager you will be responsible for:

- Working as part of the Sales team and Client Services team to support all aspects of buyer engagement
- Assisting the Sales team in all logistical aspects of buyer relationship management
- Responsible for the input and updating of all sales team admin
- Responsible for helping organise sales team trips and market diary admin
- Provide administrative support to the UK based Sales Team in general- Executing and reporting on this strategy
- Responsible for day to day buyer registrations and the process surrounding this
- Regular reporting and updating to the Sales team
- Regular monitoring of buyer activity across the TRX system
- Some client facing reporting

Desired Skills:

- Ideally, experience in a co-ordinator role at a distribution company or within an acquisitions team.
- Proven ability to take initiative and go the "extra mile" to exceed expectations
- Natural communicator, confident and well presented
- Flexible ‘can-do’ attitude with enthusiasm and initiative in abundance
- Willingness to work flexible hours to accommodate for time difference with London Head Office
- Pro-active, creative thinker and passionate, with a desire to learn and develop within the team
- Proven written and spoken communication skills
- Passion for the TV rights and distribution industry
- Efficiency, attention to detail and excellent organisation skills imperative
- Interest in tech

The Package:

- Package dependent upon experience
- Generous holiday allowance and other company benefits

Please forward your CV together with a short covering email outlining your suitability for the role. TRX.tv are keen to fill this role as soon as possible so please do not wait before applying.

items.title: Birmingham Partnerships and City Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We’re looking for a dynamic, ambitious and results-driven business development manager to own Wriggle’s performance in Birmingham, and ensure it flourishes and grows over the next few years (starting with a bang in 2019!).

The role will be hands-on and entrepreneurial. You will need to roll up your sleeves to develop new business (local Birmingham restaurants, cafes and bars), and help existing partners to improve their performance, as well as owning the performance of the business unit.

Our preference is for the right candidate to know Birmingham and its food scene, and be based in our Bristol office (with the rest of the team) - travelling to Birmingham once or twice a week. However, we will also welcome applications from Birmingham-based candidates who have experience of working remotely.

Key functions include:

- Developing new business (the best local food & drink establishments)
- Managing existing accounts, and helping them to grow
- Owning the performance of the Birmingham city unit
- Delivering key projects

The right candidate will have buckets of energy, excellent organisation skills, alongside a love of Birmingham and its food scene (or – if you don’t know the Birmingham food scene yet – a passion to get to know it!). We want someone ambitious, who wants to grow with Wriggle.

Skills required:

- Proven track record in Business Development
- Excellent organisational skills
- Target-driven
- Analytical and numerate
- Excellent communication skills; personable and looking to build long-term relationships

Nice to Haves

- Experience working with restaurants/food & drink
- Photography skills
- A love of local food & drink and Birmingham

Location:

Either:

- Based in Bristol, and visiting Birmingham 1 or 2 days per week (Wriggle’s preference); or
- Based in Birmingham and visiting Bristol once a week

To apply, please send a copy of your CV and covering letter to the application email.

items.title: Commercial Partnerships Manager
items.content:
Use your deal-making skills to build a powerful network of London’s fastest-growing technology companies.

Are you excited by meeting with London’s brightest entrepreneurs and learning about ground-breaking technology? Are you ambitious, driven and hungry to establish yourself as a part of London’s thriving startup ecosystem? Do you dream of having autonomy over your own fast-paced business development career?

If so, read on!

GrantTree works with many of the UK’s most innovative companies, helping them to maximise their government funding opportunities. Our partner network consists of fast moving technology companies and affiliates including Microsoft Accelerator, Monzo and Crowdcube, to name just a few. We’re looking for an enthusiastic deal-maker to make this network even better.

As part of GrantTree’s partnerships team, you will be identifying, building and managing strategic partnerships with scaleups. You’ll be dealing directly with senior executives and founders, negotiating commercial deals and building high value client relationships. You’ll also be working with and meeting clients all over the capital, with freedom to design how and where you work (swanky cafe meetings are a staple!).

But you won’t be going it alone. You’ll be learning from an experienced and highly successful partnerships and sales team, who will prepare you to assemble and manage your own network and sales pipeline.

On a typical day, you might:

Pitch GrantTree’s services to potential clients
Broker partnerships and negotiate commercial deals with founders, FDs and CTOs
Identify, develop and manage strategic partnerships with scaleup affiliates
Attend a network event or run a workshop explaining GrantTree’s offering
Report results to GrantTree’s sales team

About Us

GrantTree has a unique way of working. In our culture, everyone has the freedom, power and trust to do their best work. We’re a self-managing company, meaning our team can choose where to work, what meetings to attend, and what to work on. We allow you to explore your potential, and do what you love doing, without the shackles of people managers. Ultimately, we aim to uphold human aliveness and commercial success simultaneously. It has been successful for us so far, although it's not for everyone (check out our GlassDoor reviews to learn more).

REQUIREMENTS
Strong networking and communications skills
At least 2 years experience in a commercial role
Success in closing sales leads
Experience with the startup and scaleup ecosystem
Curiosity and enthusiasm for cutting-edge technology
London based and able to attend evening events

BENEFITS
We believe that people should be rewarded fairly for the work they do. At GrantTree there is no secrecy over salaries and the way we work them out. For this role, your salary is likely to lie between £30-40k depending on experience.

Aside from money, we offer a place where you can be yourself and engage in empowered, purposeful work. We want you to develop your skills and fulfil your potential. We have a flexible approach to working, and while we encourage you to spend some time in the office initially and from time to time, in general you can work remotely as often as you like. Our office is in the heart of the tech community, near Old Street, and has a fab roof terrace.

Other benefits include:

£2,000 yearly training budget for courses and tools to help you on your individual developmental journey
Weekly “lunch force” allowance - sit down for a meal with different GrantTree partners each week to help build natural collaborative and friendly networks
Monthly company-wide picnics
Flexible working - you have the ability to choose where and when you work best
No dress code - bring your authentic self into work, complete with wearing what you’re most comfortable in
Up to six weeks of holiday per year
Three additional paid days off for volunteer work
Pension scheme via The People’s Pension
50% of your personal mobile phone tariff paid for
Cycle to work scheme
Quarterly wellness days and quarterly fun days
Subsidised private health insurance via Vitality
Free food, snacks, fruit, and booze
Equal Opportunities

Teams are stronger when they have a diverse range of people. We welcome applications from everyone, regardless of the categories they put themselves in. If you think you’re the right person for the job even though you don’t quite fit the role spec, be daring and apply!

items.title: Sales Representative

items.content:
ABOUT US:

SkipsoLabs is a tech company that helps corporates build out their Innovation Ecosystems and manage their Innovation programs. Our company is a market leader in providing crowdsourcing, idea management and open innovation platforms for top corporate clients worldwide such as Microsoft, Deloitte and Disney just to name a few. We offer a combination of crowdsourcing, game mechanics and big data analytics, to scout new technologies, drive product development, create new revenue streams, foster a culture of innovation.



WHY JOIN US:

You will have the opportunity to work alongside the management team and have regular interactions with industry leading clients. This is a great opportunity for anyone who loves the Internet and would like to work in an exciting high-growth start-up. If you are looking for a challenge and would like to become a key part of a fast-moving tech company, get in touch!



THE IDEAL CANDIDATE:

Somebody that is ready to take on any task or challenge. If you don't know how to achieve a goal you look it up and propose the best solutions within the context of SkipsoLabs. You are intelligent, curious, articulate and can adapt to any situation. At the same time, you are an active listener and are open to discovering alternatives to your solution. Most importantly, you have a great work ethic and are respectful to your co-workers and clients.



If you’re a goal-oriented team player with a competitive spirit, and up for your next challenge, we’d like to speak with you.



RESPONSIBILITIES

Build a network of qualified prospects via desktop research and Linkedin
Communicate daily with prospects with outbound emails and cold calls
Organise and manage demos of our products to potential clients
Prepare daily reports on sales activity and KPIs
Work closely with Sales Team Director
Shadow Sales Director on calls and presentation
Achieving growth and hitting sales targets

REQUIREMENTS
0-2 years in an outbound selling, lead generation, or customer contact environment (preferred)
Bachelor’s degree or set to graduate in May 2019
Great work ethic and outstanding communication skills (verbal and written English)
Results-driven personality (base salary with performance-based commission)
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Ability to work in a team and independently (self-motivated)
Based within the European time zone
Experience working in a software company (a plus)

BENEFITS
Competitive salary + Commission
You will be an essential team member, contributing to the growth of our company from day one
Work with a highly creative and entrepreneurial team
Join our company at the right time and be sure to become a part of our core team if you do a good job (and if you enjoy your time with us!)
Remote working allowed
Awesome offsite team meetings

items.title: Regional Sales Manager
items.content:
This is a unique opportunity to impact every renter in the UK through exciting and highly rewarding work.

Join us on our mission to create a world of deposit FREE renting!

We expect more people to rent than ever before. That’s why we believe renting should be more affordable and accessible. We are a young and innovative startup solving an affordability problem by offering deposit-free renting to millions of tenants across the UK - with lots more exciting stuff to come.

We have built a core team and a product we are proud of, raised significant seed capital and partnered with the UK's largest independent letting agency. Plus, we’re currently working with the world’s largest institutional landlord so we’re well on our way to driving the renting revolution!

As a Regional Sales Manager, you will work in the northern regions of the UK to help flatfair meet its ambitious growth targets (although we'd want to see you in the London HQ once or twice a month!). This field-based role needs an experienced, go-getting sales dynamo to drive innovation, growing flatfair through strategic partnerships and representing the brand as we continue to scale across the UK and further afield.


Focus of the role?

Identifying, attracting, negotiating and launching partnerships with a variety of landlords, property managers and letting agents, both public and private, in the area of Northern England and Scotland
Manage full life cycle, from initial outreach, through onboarding to relationship management
Account manage existing relationships in the region, optimising our partnerships and identifying future opportunities
Focus on providing an outstanding sales experience to flatfair's potential partners, effectively communicating our vision and platform, and building a greater network within the industry
Being an ongoing thought partner for agencies, partners and suppliers by leading on strategic initiatives and high level planning
Identify marketing, event and networking opportunities for flatfair to attend/sponsor or speak at
Be able to deliver a perfect elevator pitch over the phone and in person as well as writing carefully crafted emails
Effectively collaborate remotely between the London based HQ account management, business development and tech team to ensure all customers enjoy the full flatfair experience.


Who are you?

Extensive experience (10+ yrs) in sales with a strong network within the property/lettings industry
Driven by closing new business, you'll love the thrill of discovering what makes potential customers tick and communicating how flatfair can support them
Excited about the idea of working autonomously to contribute to the growth of a fast-scaling startup
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically
A car owner, you'll be willing to travel across the north and Scotland


What’s in it for you:

Uncapped commission: This role is all about growth, and we want to incentivise you to succeed. With a competitive basic salary and generous uncapped commission, as well as travel expenses, you'll be looked after
Flexibility: We want you to be your own leader and encourage an autonomous and flexible work style right across the business
Socials: We like to bring everyone together for a weekly team lunch, regular social events and get-togethers in a fully stocked kitchen with snacks, fruits and drinks (and you’d get to lead on organising them!)
Holiday: 25 days holiday a year (plus UK public holidays), and we encourage you to use them all up!
Learning and training: We’ll contribute towards training courses and conferences that help you learn and grow professionally and personally
Personal development: Following a motivating career path, we value growth from within and encourage people to step up


--

Note to agencies and third parties: we have a team who owns all of our talent processes at the moment and are happy with how we’re growing. We love your enthusiasm to work with us, but we’re not looking for new partners currently so please hold off on cold-calling us for now.

items.title: Business Development Representative in London
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Join a fast-growing London UK scale-up and sell a Product that is Turning Heads.

Trint™ is the scale-up that blows manual transcription out of the water. Its browser-based platform converts any audio or video file to text in just minutes. Then Trint’s interactive editor marries audio to the text, making it easy to search and polish transcripts to perfection. Hours of tedious labour are reduced to just minutes. Users can add captions in one click and effortlessly make the content of their recordings searchable and shareable. And we have a lot more tricks up our sleeves!

“By far the best automated transcription platform.” The New York Times

Early adopters include: The Associated Press, BBC, The New York Times, ESPN, Vice News, The Washington Post, Thomson Reuters, Indiana University and The State of Wisconsin.

The role:

We’re looking for a candidate who will help us supercharge Trint! You will be a key part of a team that is accelerating sales across EMEA and North America.

Responsibilities will include:

This is primarily an outbound sales role, focused on lead generation in our fast-moving sales team. You will support Sales Managers by handling incoming leads, and by proactively reaching out to prospects for our Enterprise offering. You will achieve that through B2B outbound phone calls, emails and events across multiple industry verticals and companies.

As a Business Development Representative, you will focus on:

Sales: Qualifying inbound leads for Sales Managers, and completing the sales cycle for SME prospects.
Prospecting: Identifying key markets to target and qualifying against our solution to determine fit for our Enterprise offering.

Cold outreach: Performing a number of daily outbound calls to generate client bookings, effectively pitching Trint’s solution and value proposition

Email Lead Generation: Creating a list of prospects and targeting via high volume outbound campaigns as well as individual targeted emails

CRM Maintenance: Data collection, maintenance of sales records and recording information on opportunities and prospects in Salesforce

Target Achievement: Achieve team and individual sales targets set by our Commercial Director.

Required skills:

- Prior sales and business development experience, focused on outbound lead generation
- Proven prospecting experience in a B2B context
- Strong business development skills in new sectors and markets
- Experienced adopting new technology, with aptitude to develop and teaching new technical workflows
- Most importantly, you will be engaging on the phone and be the kind of person that our customers love talking to!
- Confident in speaking with C-level Executives and extracting information and requirements to build a solid value proposition
- The mindset to strive and succeed in a dynamic startup environment

Helpful skills that will make you shine even brighter:

- Additional languages (HINT: we support 13 languages)
- Know-how of SaaS selling
- Startup exposure
- Working knowledge of a cloud-based CRM

Benefits:

- Team Events & Beer Fridays
- Opportunities for international travel
- A relaxed & sociable office environment
- Gym Subsidy
- Office Snacks
- Flexible working & working from home
- Cycle to Work Scheme
- In-house Yoga
- 25 Day Holidays Allowance + Bank Holidays
- Critical Illness Cover
- Income Protection Insurance
- Workplace Pension Scheme

And more to come! We’re on the look-out for new and exciting perks which help us on our journey to becoming an employer of choice

Salary based on experience + OTE plan

items.title: Global Campaign Manager - Small Business
items.content:
*About us*
Drive our growth and shape our future.

At GoCardless we’re looking to scale from processing £5 billion a year to over £20 billion. Our vision is to create a global connected payments network, making payments simpler on the internet no matter what country you're in or what software you are using.

We’ve built a friendly, collaborative culture where we hire and develop ambitious people that share our desire to produce work we can be proud of. We value learning and feedback, and there will be significant scope for you to develop and expand your role as our team continues its rapid growth.



*The role*
We are seeking an ambitious and high-performing Global Campaign Manager to join our rapidly expanding team at a very exciting time. We are looking for a candidate that has successful experience in planning and executing global/local marketing campaigns that drive new customer acquisition from the small business segment.

This role requires a highly organised, hard-working individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment where collaboration across teams is crucial to success. Someone who is metrics driven and motivated by seeing their work contribute to the achievement of business goals. This role reports to the Head of Global Campaigns.



*Responsibilities include:*
* Own end-to-end global campaign planning, development and execution for the small business segment

* Create innovative, successful and measurable global demand generation campaigns to drive pipeline and self-serve (web) sign-ups

* Work with creative and content teams to define content goals and approach, identify and ideate on compelling storylines, and align these elements to the campaign brief, messaging documents and activation strategy to create a comprehensive and measurable content plan

* Develop/project manage integrated media plans for campaigns – including web marketing, nurture, paid search, social media and events – in partnership with the rest of the marketing team

* Partner closely with product marketing and sales to confirm/strategise on campaign themes, messaging, personas, industries and assets etc.

* Apply KPIs, analytics, and insights to better profile, target and re-target prospects, driving continual campaign optimisation

* Work with marketing operations to ensure all tracking requirements are in place for necessary performance reporting

* Work cross-functionally to ensure the timely execution of small business segment campaigns across all geos


*Desired skills:*

* 3-4 years of B2B marketing experience with proven success in driving demand from a small business segment.

* Experience marketing for software and/or SaaS services is preferred

* Experience of marketing within a global remit - working closely with regional teams to design and build out effective global campaigns

* Ability to effectively analyse performance data and leverage insights to continually improve results

* Experience working with CRM and marketing automation platforms such as Salesforce and Pardot

* Self-starter who has built campaigns from the ground up

* Able to prioritise competing projects

* Strong stakeholder management skills


We welcome a wide diversity of candidates from varying backgrounds – if you’re unsure, please apply.

items.title: Sales Executive
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Location:

London or remote.

What we do:

OnCare is a software platform for social care. We make care easier, safer, and more effective. We've started by making tools to help home care providers manage care delivery, and will be growing our platform to become the future marketplace for all types of care.

We’re a tech for good business, making care easier for everyone – care workers, agencies, people receiving care and their families, and we know that by doing this we can raise the standards of care across the board.


A day in the life of our Sales Executive:

We’re looking for a bright, energetic Sales Executive to join the OnCare team. In collaboration with our marketing efforts and the CEO, you’ll help us to achieve over 10x growth in our customer numbers, through a mixture of phone and email outreach, and face-to-face visits.

You’ll be selling software into domiciliary (homecare) agencies. This is a traditionally paper-based and non-techy market - so an ability to explain complex concepts in a simple, non-threatening way, and ability to vary your communication style based on the audience are key to this role.

You'll be responsible for all aspects of the sales cycle from customer outreach and creation of sales collateral, through to managing relationships with existing clients, creating sales strategies, and helping to optimise sales and marketing channels.


You'll love working with us if:

You take pride in selling technology that does some real good in the world
You enjoy working in a relaxed environment and like working to clear targets
You want to be part of a small but dedicated team of problem-solving experts with an open communication culture contributing to the wider business goals
You can tolerate occasional puns that are so bad they need to be explained, and you don't hate Beyoncé


What we offer

items.content:
Job description

We are looking for an experienced, ambitious sales person to join our team. Your job would be to find potential clients who would be interested in outsourcing their projects or departments to Croatia and close deals with them.

If you have a good network among London's entrepreneurs, you are independent, result driven and you can progress rapidly, this might be the perfect job for you!


About us

Remote Bob is connecting remote employees from Croatia with London based start-ups. We have a team in London and in Croatia, our co-founders are both serial entrepreneurs with an MBA.

We are enabling London based start-ups to outsource their projects and departments without
compromising in quality. Here, in Remote Bob, we can reassure all our clients that the delivered work will be exceptional. Our remote employees are based in the EU, and we are offering local support; recruitment, people management, training, quality check and payroll. With our help, working with a remote team has never been easier!

Benefits

A chance to be a significant part of creating the biggest hub with remote employees in Croatia, gaining knowledge from co-founders and earning a competitive salary.

When sending your CV please answer these questions:
1. How would you acquire clients?
2. What target would you set for yourself for the first 3 months?
3. Salary expectations?

items.title: Office Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Welcome! We’re Attest: a Consumer Growth Platform. We’re on a mission to bring every business closer to consumers, and empower them with the insights that drive predictable and repeatable growth; enabling them to create and deliver better, more useful services, products and experiences for communities worldwide.

We’re spearheaded by a bunch of awesome individuals, and our guess is that you’re pretty awesome, too. We’re ultra-proud of the inclusive company we’ve built to date. Attest is not just an exciting place to work alongside great people, but a feeling – one of belonging and adventure. We’re delighted that you’ve taken the first step to becoming an Attester by expressing an interest in who we are and what we do.

*About the People team*

Our People team ensures that all Attesters are able to do their absolute best work through the design of engaging roles; providing stimulating, collaborative work environment; and encouraging experimentation. We believe that we’re all the same but different, so we take fostering a psychologically safe environment – where individuals feel free to bring their authentic selves every day – pretty seriously.

We’re looking for our very first Office Manager at Attest; someone dynamic but amazingly organised. They’ll have previous experience in facilities management, can bring their experience in end-to-end office fit-outs, and display a high level of administrative prowess.

Currently a small yet mighty team of 47 people, we’re looking to double in size by the end of the year. This means we’re fast outgrowing our current office space, so we’ll need your help in ensuring that our new working environment is incredibly enjoyable to be in – somewhere our Attesters look forward to spending their time.

*In your first three months you’ll...*

* Get to know Attest and our People. You’ll experience our company-wide onboarding to better understand what we do, as well as build relationships with our diverse members.
* Help us get settled into our interim space. Moving can be very disruptive, so we’ll rely on you and learnings from your past experience to make it as smooth a process as possible.
* Own all-things office. You’ll confidently and independently act as the primary point of contact for all office-related matters, providing effective and efficient day to day running of our space.
* Take on operational administration. We’ll trust you to provide confidential and efficient administrative support to our Central members including correspondence and carrying out the occasional business errand. You’ll also be trusted to own and manage an office budget.

*Within your first six months you’ll...*

* Facilitate the move to our permanent home. You’ll work with various members of the People and Operations teams to facilitate the meticulously planned logistics and fit-out, enabling the smooth and efficient moving of our then 70+ team; while also tying up loose administrative ends with our current landlord.
* Deliver amazing experiences. We’ll rely on your creative, and imaginative input to plan and host a range of team events, including our end of year party.

*By month twelve (and beyond), you’ll...*

* Create a physical work environment to be proud of. Harnessing your interior flair, you’ll work collaboratively with the team to plan, design, and implement a magnificently creative and inclusive workspace.
* Maintaining and Improving. You’ll continually be looking for ways to build on the great elements of our office, and generate new and exciting ways to keep the environment positive and full of good energy.

*Who you are*

* Linchpin. You’ll love making a difference by helping others and being the go-to person for anything and everything to do with the office and our working environment.
* Conscientious. You’ve got impressive attention to detail, and take pride in our surroundings; you regularly think of creative ways to improve, delight, and create variety.
* Clear and concise communicator. You’re very skilled in rallying people together and providing guidance and instructions to groups in order to successfully attain a desired goal as quickly as possible.
* Calm and collected under pressure. With your never-ending list of tasks, you’re uber-organised, methodical way of working and resilience keeps you powering through with every bit of enthusiasm and charm.

*Applying for the Role*

When applying for the role, please include answers to the following questions:

* What excites you about potentially joining us at Attest?

* What are the first few things that you notice when you visit an office/building for the first time?

* Tell us about one of the most rewarding office projects that you've managed end-to-end.

* Tell us about the most memorable event that you've organised.

*Interview Logistics*

The application process for this role will include: a 30-minute video interview with a couple members of our PeopleOps team; an in-person interview at our office in London; a take-home assignment; and a final-stage interview at our office in Central London.

We appreciate that you may be further along interviewing at other companies, so please give us a heads up if this is the case so we can bear timelines in mind.

*What we’ll offer in return*

Our benefits and perks are designed with a focus on the wellbeing, engagement, and growth of our Attesters.

* A competitive salary that fairly recognises your experience and potential;
* High-quality equipment – whether you prefer a MacBook or a Windows machine, we’ll invest a sizeable amount (over £2K) to provide you with the right tools and set-up to help you do your best work;
* 25 days paid holiday – we care about our team’s wellbeing, so we make sure you have time to fully switch off, rest, and recharge;
* Flexible working hours and working from home – whether you have parental responsibilities, just need some headspace, or have a parcel being delivered, we’ll support you in making your work and personal life a manageable blend;
* A generous Growth & Development budget to spend on the resources and tools that will help you grow in your role and achieve your career goals;
* 10% adventure time to invest in charitable activities, your growth and development, and/or side projects for Attest;
* Weekly team lunch – a team who eats together, works hard together, and stays together, right? We order in lunch every week, but also acknowledge those who are less fortunate than ourselves: for every meal we order, our supplier donates a meal in support of the Akshaya Patra Foundation;
* Fully-paid sick days – Mental health and physical health are treated equally at Attest. Whether you’ve been knocked out with the flu, are having an operation, or need some time off to manage anxiety, stress or depression, for example, we encourage all our Attesters to rest up and come back when they’re feeling more like themselves;
* A values-led working environment that encourages putting people first, honesty, curiosity and leadership.

Is this role not quite the right fit for you? Or, have you not seen a suitable position available on our careers site?...We’re always on the look-out for interesting, bright folk to join our team of Attesters. Connect with us to stay in touch, and we’ll notify you when we have new opportunities.

*About our people and culture*

Attest is a place where you’re encouraged to bring every part of you needed to do your best work; every part of you needed to build strong, meaningful and long-lasting relationships with your fellow Attesters, our clients and partners.

We champion our people in their entirety. With our team of Attesters, we take a human-first approach, optimising for joy and adventure, ingrained in everything we do.

We’re a friendly, collaborative team, and value putting people (our team, clients and consumers) first; honesty, curiosity, empowerment and leadership are core to our team working style. Decisions are made with careful and quick consideration at Attest, to support fast and efficient growth.

*About Attest*

We believe that great companies put consumers and data at the heart of every decision. These companies create better, more useful products and services, which leads to happier consumers and ever-greater success.
Through our Consumer Growth Platform, everyone can now gain answers to their questions from audiences of over 100 million consumers across 80 markets.

Our clients use Attest to learn more about their target consumers, enter new markets, build new categories, validate decisions, develop better products and services, measure their brand, track competition, all with the goal of driving sustained growth across the business.

Our clients include Heineken, Walgreens Boots, Samsung, Fever-Tree, Discovery, Transferwise, and Nutmeg, among many others.

We’re backed by leading VCs, including New Enterprise Associates (NEA) – the investors behind companies such as Uber, Salesforce, Box, and Tableau; Oxford Capital and Episode 1 (the investors behind LoveFilm, Zoopla, Betfair, Shazam, CarWow and many other greats); plus several high-powered amazing Angel investors.

*Diversity statement*

Diversity matters, and we celebrate it at Attest! We’re building an inclusive place to work where everyone feels they belong. We see you and you’re welcome here. Attest doesn’t discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic including race, religion or belief, gender or gender reassignment, age, sexual orientation, marital status, or disability.

We want to give everyone the opportunity to showcase their best selves during the interview process and beyond. Do let us know if there are any adjustments you’d like to make to ensure it’s more inclusive – we’re learning too, so we’re more than happy to adapt and accommodate where possible.

items.title: Freelance Business Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Bespoke Brand Developers is a Digital Marketing agency located in the heart of Covent Garden, established in 2017. We help businesses generate leads and ultimately increase revenue.

We are looking to take on 2 Business Developers.

The people we are looking for will be confident, articulate and highly-motivated characters.

This is a freelance position which can be done from the comfort of your own home, with sales scripts and lead lists provided. This opportunity is ideal for someone who is working part-time or student and looking to fill their time and earn some decent money.

You will be appointment setter, and further down the line closing clients on the phone yourself. If you're not comfortable with cold calling, this position probably won't be for you.

You will be calling businesses offering our Social Media Marketing services initially, while also offering web design, SEO and digital marketing consultancy.

Our social media marketing packages start from £1,500 and range to £10,000 a month.

NOTE* As we are a startup, this is a COMMISSION only role- we don't want to waste your time.

Commission Structure:

Appointment Setter: 10% fee for 1st-month client revenue, 2.5% passive income for each month thereafter
Closer: 20% fee for 1st-month client revenue, 5% passive income for each month thereafter

Example: A typical client we sign is valued at £2,500. Therefore, you would earn £500 for closing and £125x(11)=£1,375 every month after- we sign clients to either 6, 12 or 24-month contracts.

If you are interested and would like to apply, please send:
- Name
- Contact Details
- CV

Email: enquiries@bespokebranddevelopers.com by 30/06/2019.

Best wishes,

Joe Testouri
Founder
www.bespokebranddevelopers.com

items.title: Paid internship: Business Development UK
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Business Development Associate

KeyNest is a fast-growing network of shops where Airbnb hosts and Property Managers can securely store their keys so that their new tenants / guests / cleaners / contractors can pick them up whenever is convenient for them. We are a global partner of Airbnb and have checked-in more than 100,000 guests.
We’re looking for a Business Development Associate to grow our network of KeyNest Stores. This is a paid 3-6-month internship based in London.

The role:
• Recruit new Stores in London and the UK to join the KeyNest partner programme, in person and over the phone
• Liaise with our customers to find the best suitable partner
• Train and/or mystery shop our partner Stores where required
• Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of our product offering to customers

Who we are looking for:
• Excellent communication and outgoing personality
• Available to travel extensively in and around London and occasionally outside
• Pro-active, self-motivated and work well in a team environment style
• Excellent English, knowledge of other languages a plus
• Experience as an Airbnb host / guest is a plus
• Available for 4 months minimum

What we offer:
• Weekly salary payment
• Possibility to be hired full-time or to continue working remotely whilst at university
• Unique chance to make your mark in a dynamic and very fast-growing company shaking up the sharing economy
• Central London office

If you want to join the KeyNest team, please get in touch at careers@keynest.com – we look forward to meeting you.

items.title: Brands Account Manager, Paris (London Based)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
WHAT WE ARE UP TO AT APPEAR HERE

Appear Here is the leading marketplace for short-term retail space, working with everyone from industry leading brands to exciting start-ups. Our mission is to create a world where anyone with an idea can find space to make it happen. We’ve raised over $20m in funding to date - from tier one investors Balderton and Octopus, as well as some of the world’s largest landlords. Named one of Wired Magazine's ‘100 Hottest Start-Ups’ and The Financial Times’ most ‘Disruptive Companies,’ Appear Here has become the go-to destination to make innovative and creative retail ideas happen across London, Paris and New York. We believe we’re building a game changer for both the retail and property industries: and so far 120,000+ brands and 1000s of landlords agree with us.

As a Brand Account Manager for Paris, your role it to help brands find appropriate space on the platform to launch their ideas. Working with both small independent retailers looking to get their ideas off the ground and multi-nationals that want to run amazing campaigns. You will develop an in-depth knowledge of the French spaces on our platform, and be responsible for a sales pipeline of hundreds of brands at any one time. You will make large volumes of inbound and outbound correspondences per day (80 - 100+) so you should be high energy, comfortable picking up the telephone and have a passion for retail. Please note, this role is based in our London office but you will be working on deals for the French market. You must be a native French speaker with perfect written and spoken French, and business level English.

WHY WE LIKE YOU

- You are a native French speaker with perfect written and spoken French. Native Parisian is a distinct advantage. This role will be based alongside our UK Brand Account Managers in our Lodon office
- You're passionate about brands, have a solid understanding of retail, and an opinion on which brands are hot, and where they would fit in Paris
- You have experience in - or natural aptitude for - sales and get excited by punching for aggressive targets
- You're a great communicator who is comfortable speaking across telephone and email
- You have a natural flair for building rapport with people from all backgrounds
- You're scared by the 9-5; you want the adventure and hard work of coming in at the early stages and helping us build the future

THE ROLE

- Cultivate relationships with new and existing brands through phone calls, emails and some in-person visits to help them find the right space on our platform for their idea
- Respond to inbound enquiries from prospective brands in France, taking them through the Appear Here process
- Work with the Landlord team (remotely, they are based in the Paris office) to build your knowledge of the available spaces and to inform their space acquisition efforts
- Chip in and support on other projects or tasks that come up in the business -we're a startup and there's a lot to do!
- Find ways to improve our processes, bring your ideas to the table, and then execute on them! It's everyone's responsibility to figure out how to optimize everything!
- Research the brands' marketing and commercial strategies and creatively find ways to promote the use of short term retail space

THE TEAM

The Commercial Team is responsible for all aspects of helping brands find the right space for a successful short term rental on the AH platform. You will be working with a high energy, outgoing group who genuinely enjoys the work they do. Our backgrounds are varied, from asset management, and retail to tech-startups. Now we plan to build a billion dollar global property-tech revolution! We'll be listening to music and often stay late or work the odd weekend to hustle and get shit done. The team works hard because we love what we do and the brands we work with and we want you to as well.

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT

Plenty of social activities, including board games evening at the office, product team nights out (bowling, darts, mini-golf, and more) and a monthly product team lunch at a local restaurant

Hear from amazing speakers within different industries. Appear Here hosts an 'Underground Session' event each month, inviting 4 experts to share their experiences and opinions. We also have an internal 'Global Gathering' once a year which includes exclusive talks from investors, industry-leading brands, and inspiring members of our community.

Sharing culture through our 'Product talks'. If you have learned something new, this is the place to share it with the team through a short presentation.

Friday lunch once a week our company comes together for a team lunch. This is an opportunity to get to know people from different teams while enjoying dishes from our favourite local restaurants.

SOME MORE PERKS

- Stock options. We believe everyone should be an owner.
- Scale with the business. This role offers the potential to have an incredible career trajectory.
- Team socials. From blindfolded martini making to sound baths, we organise quarterly team events that go big on experiences.
- Breakfast and snacks throughout the day (including our favourite cheeseboard).
- Work with different teams, across different projects.
- Best idea wins. Whether you’re an intern or the CTO, if you can make the case for it, we’ll make it happen.
- Opportunities and budget for personal learning development.
- Great location. We’re right next door to two of the best food markets in London. In your first week, we’ll send you out with different teams to show you the best eating spots.

items.content:
We are an exciting London based digital branding agency. We provide digital solutions for our clients through social media management, web design, and online marketing. We are currently in the process of expanding our team and growing our business operations as our number of international clients have increased

Currently maintaining strong client relationships and our internal company culture is the backbone to what makes Jelingu thrive as an agency and an essential element of our brand.



Job Post
New Client account & team manager


As a client account manager you would be responsible for managing your own portfolio of clients, new potential client and maintaining company account relationships.



Typical work activities

The role is broken into two parts:

Part1
Serve as the lead point of contact for all customer account management matters Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships Negotiate contracts and close agreements to maximize profits Develop trusted advisor relationships with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives Clearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders Develop new business with existing clients and/or identify areas of improvement to meet sales quotas Forecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts) Prepare reports on account status Collaborate with sales team to identify and grow opportunities within territory


Part2
The second part of the role will involved interviewing, training and hiring new team members aswell as managing aspects of our internal operations. You will be answering all incoming calls .


Main duties in a nut shell

1. Answering calls from prospective clients

2. Trainning and inducting team members

3. Completing business proposals

4. Breifing design team

5. Creating management reports

6. Marinating the relationship between clients and the design team

7. Managing client accounts.


Requirements
• Exemplary planning and time management skills
• High level verbal and written communications skills
• Good understanding of building relationships
• We love people that can bring forward fresh ideas
• Creativity
• Brilliant people person and communications skills
• Keen to learn and grow with the company
• Business savvy


* No previous experience is necessary ongoing training will be provided.
The role is flexible and remote working can be incorporated.

If you feel you meet the criteria for this intern position we would love to hear from you. This intern position is flexible and we have long-term career opportunities for the right candidate. Educational credits can also be offered

items.content:
Lydia is one of Europe’s fastest-growing fintech start-ups. Our mission is to make payments as simple as possible. How? By providing one app to pay for everything in all situations - from paying back a friend for last night’s pizza to buying lunch at a food market.
We launched Lydia in Paris in 2013, and we are now the number one mobile payments service in France. We have over 2 million users across France, the UK, Ireland, Spain, and Portugal, and more than 100,000 people create an account every month.
We’re looking for entrepreneurial, highly motivated talent to join our mission to become Europe’s universal means of payment. You will be working closely with the UK and Ireland teams to continue Lydia’s expansion into the Irish market. Your tasks will include key aspects of growing Lydia’s user-base in Ireland.

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE
Identify business development opportunities in Ireland’s student sector
Conducting the whole sales cycle from prospecting, signing accounts, account management, and up-selling
Event planning and organisation
Social media management: assisting in creating content for the Lydia social media channels (Facebook, Twitter and Instagram).
Organising marketing projects
Creating marketing collateral documents
Contributing to social media strategy

REQUIREMENTS
Native or fluent in English (spoken and written), knowledge of Irish (Gaelic) / French is a plus
Recent graduate with excellent knowledge of the Irish student market
Extremely well-organised, detail-oriented, rigorous
Creative problem-solver with an analytical mindset
Proactive self-starter that can take initiative and seizes any challenge, no matter how big or small
Ability to multitask, can work under pressure
Excellent communication skills

BENEFITS
The opportunity to work at one of France’s fastest growing start-ups
Have a real impact on the company’s growth and evolution in a new market
Training in our Paris office

Start date: immediate
Compensation: according to experience
Contract type: freelance
Location: Ireland, remote

items.title: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Title – Sales Development Representative (SDR)
Location – Central London, UK (Remote Workers Considered)
Hours – Flexible, typical day 1030 – 1830 (factoring in US Clients)

Overview

CircuitHub is expanding its Sales Team and is looking for Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) to help grow our customer base.

Who are CircuitHub?

CircuitHub is on a mission to fix rapid electronics prototyping. With the use of software and automated manufacturing, we are changing the way Printed Circuit Boards (PCBs) are assembled, speeding up production time, reducing costs, and dramatically improving the overall experience.

CircuitHub was founded in San Francisco, graduating from the infamous start-up accelerator Y-Combinator in 2014 and has since raised venture capital from the likes of Google Ventures and a number of other high-profile investors. CircuitHub has since relocated its factory to the East Coast in Massachusetts, as well as having a Central London office.

Responsibilities of an SDR

Lead Generation – Analysing what a potential customer for CircuitHub would look like and building prospecting lists of these profiles. This will primarily be US customer focused, although there will be an opportunity to take a more global view over time.

Prospect Outreach – You will be reaching out to these prospective customers via email and phone calls generating interest in CircuitHub’s offering.

Prospect Conversion – After generating interest you will aim to convert this interest into a customer registration and an appointment for a demo of the CircuitHub platform. An Account Executive will then manage this opportunity converting them into an active customer.

Support – Working for a start-up often means getting involved in many areas that fall outside of your core responsibilities. This will mean that you may regularly need to support other areas of the business. For example, helping out with customer demos, getting involved in Customer Support as well as any number of other areas.

Learning and Developing – During your day to day role you will be surrounded by lots of new information every day, be asked challenging and complex questions from customers and use various different internal systems. As a member of the CircuitHub team you will be responsible for rising to these challenges, seeking internal support as required, and then learning from this to better build your knowledge.

Experience and Skillset

• Graduate, or have at least 1 years B2B sales experience
• The ability to communicate incredibly well via email and phone
• The confidence to speak with prospective customers over the phone multiple times a day
• Demonstrate a willingness to work towards targets and be accountable for your performance
• Be self-motivated with the ability to work well independently
• Knowledge of Microsoft Office or GoogleDocs

Reward

Salary – You will be paid a competitive salary
Commission – You will receive monthly commission linked to your performance
Stock Options – You will receive stock options which will vest over time
Progression – You will be part of a growing team in a growing business, which will mean there will be plenty of opportunities to progress if you perform well in your role.

items.title: Chief Sales Officer / Co-Founder
items.content:
Our start-up is a data/marketing B2B online platform that has received interest from a variety of start-ups, SME's and franchises, spanning multiple sectors across the UK. We aim to expand our platform in the US within the next thirty-six months.

We combine market research, digital advertising and paid surveys to offer an all-in-one powerful and effective online platform. Our platform delivers targeted consumer data to organisations through survey responses filled out by our users. Survey campaigns are created by researchers, promoted by our promoters and completed by our users. We aim to build a more ethical and efficient data market where consumers, freelancers and SME's are treated and rewarded fairly.

We have a growing sign-up list of users however as I lack experience in sales and business development, our start-up is in need of a savvy, persistent and bright individual who wishes to learn and help grow a truly disruptive product. The ideal co-founder can manage the entire business development and sales side of the company, including outreach to potential clients, booking and attending client meetings, and pitching and selling the product in-person and on multiple platforms.

As a team, we work from home and set weekly meetings to effectively communicate. We aim to relocate into a small office in the coming months, depending on our outreach success. The ideal co-founder can travel easily and is able to attend occasional team meetings in central London. So far, the role is unpaid and the successful applicant would have significant shares in the company, with the intention of growing the company over a 5+ year period.

I believe people are the most precious resource in an organisation. This is not a journey for the faint-hearted and though I am still learning myself, I'm an incredibly driven and motivated young entrepreneur who focuses on building sustainable, long-term relationships with both clients and the team. Don't worry if you're not incredibly experienced, I prioritise potential over achievements.

If your ambition is to grow a start-up from the ground up and begin working as part of a small team of 3 to build a platform into a global brand, you've come to the right vacancy.

items.content:
Digital Account Manager (part-time)

In Marketing We Trust

 Worldwide verified
**The Position Summary**

Title: Digital Marketing Account Manager
Location: Remote. APAC timezone
Reports to: Client Services Director
Works on: Company’s client projects
Key objectives: Managing several high profile client accounts

**The Company**

We are a digital analytics Agency and we are very good at Analytics, SEO, CRO, Data Science. Find out more about our services

Our motto: Traffic is nice. Revenue is better.

We have the most fun doing it in competitive environments such as finance, education, jobs, insurance, automotive and many more.

We strive on being an extension of our client’s team and providing tailor-made, return-focused work.
We are picky about the clients we bring on-board and very protective of our reputation. We won’t engage with a firm unless we believe we can make a difference to their business and help them Get Stuff Done!

This stops us from taking on board demoralising projects and having us hating our jobs and our clients.
We think the current agency model is broken and we really believe we can build a better alternative. But we need great people to help make this happen and that’s where you come in!

We are a bootstrapped company, we grew exponentially in the last few years and now seating at 60 people working with us.
We are built to be remote from day 1, but if you want to say ‘Hello’, our office is 78 meters from the beach in Sydney. Make sure you bring your swimwear!


**The Opportunity**

We are looking for a passionate and driven Account Manager to join our growing team. You will work on multiple client projects in support of our clients' strategic accounts expansion.

You will need a mix of creativity and strong analytical skills to identify sales opportunities for our company. You will support to develop and execute strategies and help turn those ideas in order to grow and gain more market visibility.

You will be required to develop and service relationships with key clients worldwide to provide strategic and creative sales opportunities across our platform

**What we offer you**

Career progression is based on your ability to deliver and drive ideas and difference for both the client and the company, not your ability to play politics or by the cut of your suit (in fact, we have a no suit policy).

A highly collaborative remote working environment, where teamwork is championed, and ideas shared - you will be someone who is unafraid of contributing ideas and happy to work as part of a remote team and in exchange for your hard work, we can give you a unique opportunity to shape and contribute to a flourishing business to achieve your lifestyle goals.

We even fly the team each year to our awesome TrustEDConf event. The last one was in October in Borneo.
An important point that is often overlooked: you will be truly part of a team. For most remote workers, you can easily feel isolated from what's happening in the business. We take good care of our teammates. So much so that a person who joined our team late November told us recently that she has felt more part of a team, than when she was working in an office.

Don't take our word for it. Check what our teammates are saying on glassdoor (yep, 2 reviews are not great, but most are).


# Responsibilities
* Managing several high-profile accounts
* Assist in creating the digital strategy for the clients
* Manage and monitor commercials of accounts, including workload for all delivery team and financials
* Ensure client expectations are clearly defined and properly managed
* Constantly liaise with the Delivery team
* Recommend, design and implement digital projects
* Oversee project management support during projects lifecycle to ensure on-time completion of deliverables
* Review work before client delivery to ensure it meets the brief and the expectations



# Requirements
**Ideal candidate**

* 3+ years of experience with professional client relationship management
* Digital Marketing and/ or Digital Analytics experience
* Demonstrable ability to multi-task
* In-depth knowledge of online marketing tools and technology
* Impeccable communication and people skills
* Strong analytical skills
* Can work under pressure with strict deadlines


**Attributes and behaviours we love to see**

* A can-do attitude
* Ownership of your work
* Inquisitive
* Analytical
* Creative in context
* Results orientated
* Collegiate and supportive
* A sense of humour

#Location
- Worldwide

In Marketing We Trust

 Worldwide verified

items.title: Account Executive
items.content:
Account Executive 

Interview Schedule

 USA verified
**The Opportunity**

Interview Schedule is changing how teams hire. Our first product streamlines recruiting scheduling and coordination, saving teams hundreds of hours a month. We’re just getting started on, and have our sights set on making hiring a great experience for recruiters, hiring managers, and candidates. We’re building the platform to engage these key stakeholders and fix the $200 billion per year hiring industry.

This is an exceptional opportunity to join a small and fast-growing startup, transforming an industry with powerful and easy to use products customers love. As an early employee you'll have tons of ownership, a big impact on product, a say in our values, and opportunities to tremendously accelerate your career growth.

We're building a remote team and looking for the best individuals - no matter where you are. All we require is a reliable internet connection and passion for building an amazing company.

**What We’re Looking For**

This person is excited about scaling the revenue side of a business. They’re a salesperson first, always customer-focused, thoughtful about creating and scaling processes, and eager to own (and crush) a revenue number.

Initially, this job will consist primarily of selling (from prospect to close). There will be many other hats to wear – potentially ranging from demand gen, to CS, to support, and even product thinking – and this person is excited to take on new challenges.

At Interview Schedule we believe in ownership and accountability, and this person is eager to own and be accountable for revenue growth. They’re always looking for ways to add the most value, which may shift and evolve over time.

**What We Value**

In addition to ownership and accountability, we believe in: challenging the status quo, having empathy, being direct, being honest, and that nothing is “not my job.”

**What We Offer**

* Autonomy, impact, and ownership. As an early employee you’ll shape the product direction and company values.
* Competitive salary and significant equity in a fast growing, early stage startup.
* Remote employment - work where you want, when you want.
* Generous vacation policy - take time whenever you need to recharge. Building a lasting company is a marathon, not a sprint.
* Top-notch healthcare, dental, and vision coverage.
* Life and disability insurance.
* Annual company retreat - helps build camaraderie as a remote team.
* Computer and home office setup - we'll buy anything you need to do your best work.
* Continuing education allowance - learn what you want, when you want.

#Location
- USA
