tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote Business Development Representative

Company: Upstack
Headquarters: New York City, NY
Visit company website

PLEASE NOTE: THIS IS AN ENTRY-LEVEL POSITION - if you’re eager to start your career as a #remotewarrior and achieve some serious business development mastery in short order - backed by best-of-breed talent *and* tools - then this is the job for you.

About Us

Upstack is an exclusive network of the best remote developers in the world ready to extend your team and building amazing products. Some of our clients include MealPal, Unfold, Invision, JUUL, and The Chive.

The Role

We are looking for a Business Development Representative to be the face and voice of Upstack’s sales team. Your role will be to seek new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers through various channels.

You’ll be using our various tools to source leads, craft, refine, and send email sequences, call out to prospects, and creatively source potential net-new business for Upstack; specifically, this entails RPG-style tactical activities - you’ll gear up and head out on a daily quest to talk to people, evangelize, and ultimately set meetings for our AE team, who will love you for it and send you thankful .gifs on Slack, incessantly.

Responsibilities

  • Qualify leads from marketing campaigns as sales opportunities
  • Contact potential clients through cold calls and emails
  • Present our company to potential clients
  • Identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services
  • Customize product solutions to increase customer satisfaction
  • Build long-term trusting relationships with clients
  • Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market
  • Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) clients and Account Executives
  • Report to the Business Development Manager on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) sales results
  • Stay up-to-date with new products/services and new pricing/payment plans

Requirements

  • BSc degree from a 4 year university (preferably in Marketing, Business Administration) or experience in relevant field for at least a year
  • Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls)
  • Absolute hustler and has a “do whatever it takes” attitude
  • Creative and thinks outside the box
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills
  • Ability to deliver engaging presentations

Perks


You couldn’t be (potentially!) joining at a better time - Upstack is seeing tremendous interest in our services as shown by a healthy influx of excited, passionate customers that have real and pressing needs. To that end, the room for growth in this role is enormous - while you’ll be focused on daily tactical actions, we’re not seeking a sales-drone - we want you to not only have a say in the “how it gets done”, but a real preference for constant iteration and improvement.
We offer a base salary and commission based on performance. We’re happy to get into this in detail if we elect to conduct an interview - we strive for transparency on this front, and couple that transparency with clearly-set, consistent goals. Top-performing SDRs can expect above-market compensation for commensurate performance.

Also - we’re remote. We know - you’re on WWR - you’re looking at remote work. There’s a substantial difference between “remote-tolerant” or “remote-friendly” companies vs. “remote-native” - we’re “remote-native” - we get remote culture, and want you to leverage the unique perks associated with that framework.

As big believers in work-life balance, our expectations of substantial output and awesome performance comes with an understanding that people need time to recharge; we have a healthy, as-needed time-off policy (which we can also expand upon in an interview!).

Finally - with great Growth comes great responsibility! As our Sales teams go forth and farm, we want to put that right back into the business, and will be rolling out some additional perks to sweeten the deal as things move forward.

How to Apply


Apply via our BreezyHR link and let your personality show.

If you want to get extra points, think about the content above and consider adapting your application process to make us say “wow, this person knows what it takes to get a response.”

Please note: we’re not currently accepting resumes from recruiters, staffing agencies, or third parties in general. (But, we love y’all anyway!)

items.title: Partnerships Manager
items.content:
DESCRIPTION
At Cuvva we’re building insurance the way it should be.

No more lengthy forms. No more waiting on hold. No more ‘computer says no’ attitude.

We’ve gone back to basics to build products that actually work for the customer.

We are super focused on creating a friendly, simple and hassle-free customer experience.

Don’t just take our word for it - check out our website (https://www.cuvva.com), click on the speech bubble in the bottom right hand corner and chat to one of the team.



About the Cuvva team

We get it. Insurance isn’t traditionally considered exciting. At Cuvva we’re changing insurance and we are looking for people who find that as exciting as we do. We're building a diverse team and we welcome people with different types of experience and outlooks.



You’ll really thrive at Cuvva if you have a ‘can do’ approach, are willing to try your hand at different things, have ideas and show initiative.



The Role

You will help kick start our partnerships initiative. You will be a self-starter who is tenacious and uses creative methods to open doors with independent car dealers across the country. You will be finding new leads and promoting Cuvva to those leads. Through face-to-face meetings, you will explain how Cuvva works and the benefits of using it. This is a newly created role so you need to be a self-starter and happy to work autonomously and outside the office at times.

REQUIREMENTS
The right person for the role will be:

A real self-starter - the role is what you make of it.
Confident and outgoing.
Able to work autonomously and able to create processes where previously non-existed.
Happy to work remotely if needed.
Creative and able to think laterally.


Bonus

Prior sales/partnerships experience.
Knowledge of the car dealership industry.
BENEFITS
The team benefits include:

Working in our (dog friendly

items.title: PA / Office Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
ABOUT HERO

Recognized as one of the most innovative companies in retail, HERO has been hailed as the “Uber for Retail”, empowering associates in-store to shop live with millions of online customers who need advice and inspiration. Today, the app is used by retail employees in thousands of stores in 7 countries - in partnership with brands including LVMH, Richemont, Harvey Nichols, Credo Beauty and Levi’s - providing millions of online shoppers a more human shopping experience.

HERO has been featured by the WSJ, Forbes and WWD, and from our offices in London and New York, our team is on a mission to make commerce smarter.


THE ROLE

We are looking for a meticulously organised and efficient self-starter with outstanding people skills to fill the role of PA / Office Manager in a fast growing company based in the heart of London.

This is the perfect role for a multi-tasker who loves diversity in their role, looking to roll up their sleeves and dive into all aspects of the business! You’ll be joining one of the fastest growing retail technology companies in the world as we embark on our global expansion.

Two years into our journey, and with an excellent roster of brands in both Europe and the US, this is an exciting and dynamic role where you’ll play a key part in our growth and work directly with the leadership team.

Your focus will be on three key areas:

1. PA / Business Assistant Support

Supporting our Founder and CFO with day to day tasks - diary management, travel booking and other ad hoc errands.
Provide finance support - including expense reviews, overseeing new tools, helping to prepare for meetings and admin tasks.
Support the PSM team with associate engagement and training sessions.

2. Office Management

Greeting guests to our swanky new office and making them feel instantly part of the Hero family.
Organising meetings, including booking venues, ordering refreshments when clients visit the office.
Organising monthly team events / meals amongst other social activities including Easter, Christmas and Summer parties (we’re a fan of regular Karaoke nights here!)
Weekly online grocery shop and buying team gifts for birthdays or Hero anniversaries.
Manage courier pickups, deliveries, etc.
Collect and distribute post.
Ordering Office Equipment and supplies as, and when needed.

3. HR Support

Support onboarding new team members into the business including inviting them to introductory meetings, ordering their laptop or other IT equipment and getting them set up on all our internal systems.
Management of our HR platform Charlie HR.
Ensuring all documentation and contracts for team members are up to date.
Onboarding new joiners to Vitality, our private health insurance.


REQUIREMENTS

Articulate, smart and a total self-starter with impeccable written and verbal English.
A great communicator and able to prioritise workload easily, whilst multi-tasking and keeping calm in a fast paced environment.
Ideally 1 - 2 years experience in a startup or agency environment.
Ability to adapt, learn and grow quickly.
You’ll enjoy being with people and be a big part of the culture as we grow at Hero.


BENEFITS

Work with a talented team of likeminds who truly love what they do.
A competitive salary.
Generous healthcare plan for you and your co-habitating partner.
Pension plan.
An employee assistance program available 24/7.
A shiny new computer and any other equipment you need.
A chance to work in a creative, productive environment in London’s Fitzrovia with all the snacks, fruit, coffee and tea you can eat/drink
Plenty of team dinners and social events.

Please send a cover letter and CV to jobs@usehero.com.

items.title: Sales Enablement Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Welcome, welcome! We’re Attest: a Consumer Growth Platform that’s transforming how businesses deliver ever-greater value while powering their growth. Our mission is simple: to ensure that real consumer data is put at the heart of decision-making.

We’re spearheaded by a bunch of awesome individuals, and our guess is that you’re pretty awesome, too. We’re delighted that you’ve taken the first step to becoming an Attester by expressing an interest in who we are and what we do.

At Attest, we’ve simplified the exercise of gathering consumer intelligence so that our clients can spend more time understanding and actioning the results; making meaningful decisions faster and more often to grow their businesses predictably and repeatedly.

We’re looking for a smart, ambitious Sales Enablement Executive to support our sales team with their outreach, ensuring the data in our CRM and supporting sales tools is complete and accurate, and researching new opportunities.

You will be at the front line of our new business team creating and maintaining databases of key companies, contacts and decision makers, for our SDR Team.



What you’ll be doing

Data. Your main responsibilities will be to ensure our sales team have accurate, complete data across the tools they utilise in their day-to-day roles.

Research. There will also be an opportunity to conduct desk research that helps to inform our approach with potential clients, so we’re able to help when and where they most need it.

Learning. This is the perfect role for anyone interested in the fundamentals of marketing, sales, analytics and research. You’ll be working cross-functionally across all of these disciplines, making it the perfect opportunity to take an active role in understanding how they work, and supporting their success.


Who you are

Motivated. Attest values responsible autonomy. This means we’ll be trusting you to manage your time and meet your goals on your terms. If you’re not a self-starter, this won’t be a good fit.

Meticulous. The quality of our data is integral to our success, so you’ll need to have an eye for detail and not be happy until the work is completed to the highest standards.

Tenacious. Finding the right details can be tricky, so you’ll need to be persistent and focused to deliver results.

What you’ll bring to Attest

Strong Excel/Google Sheets knowledge. These will be essential tools utilised in your day-to-day, so you’ll need to be confident in how they work with knowledge of filters, functions, conditional formatting and more.

CRM/data experience. If you’ve worked with a CRM (saleforce.com), or other sales enablement tools before it would be a huge advantage.

An interest in business. We look for curiosity in every new team member here at Attest. You’ll need to demonstrate enthusiasm for the worlds of business, brands or consumer research.

Critical thinking. Everyone has good ideas and fresh perspectives on where we can improve. Be ready to make things better and innovate!


What we’ll offer in return

* Our benefits and perks are designed with a focus on the wellbeing, engagement, and growth of our Attesters.
* A fair salary that recognises your experience and potential (this is an entry level role that will pay the London living wage);
* High-quality Equipment – we’ll provide you with the right tools and set-up to help you do your best work;
* 25 days Paid holiday – we care about our team’s wellbeing, so we make sure you have time to fully switch off, rest, and recharge;
* Flexible working hours – whether you have parental responsibilities, just need some headspace, or have a parcel being delivered, we’ll support you in making your work and personal life a manageable blend;
* Weekly team lunch – a team who eats together, works hard together, and stays together, right? We order in lunch every week, but also acknowledge those who are less fortunate than ourselves: for every meal we order, our supplier donates a meal in support of the Akshaya Patra Foundation;
* Fully-paid sick days – Mental health and physical health are treated equally at Attest. Whether you’ve been knocked out with the flu, are having an operation, or need some time off to manage anxiety, stress or depression, for example, we encourage all our Attesters to rest up and come back when they’re feeling more like themselves;
* A values-led working environment that encourages putting people first, honesty, curiosity and leadership.


About our people and culture

Attest is a place where you’re encouraged to bring every part of you needed to do your best work; every part of you needed to build strong, meaningful and long-lasting relationships with your fellow Attesters, our clients and partners.

We champion our people in their entirety. With our team of Attesters, we take a human-first approach, optimising for joy and adventure, ingrained in everything we do.

We’re a flat, friendly, non-hierarchical team, and value putting people (our team, clients and consumers) first; honesty, curiosity, empowerment and leadership are core to our team working style.

Decisions are made with careful and quick consideration at Attest, to support fast and efficient growth.


About Attest

Great companies put consumers and data at the heart of every decision. Attest makes that simple and open for anyone at every business, continuously, at global scale.

We call it Scalable Intelligence. Through our platform, hundreds of companies of all sizes connect to networks of 100 million consumers across 80 different countries, to learn, grow and innovate better every day.

Clients like Unilever, Fever-Tree, EE, Publicis and Twitter rely on Attest to learn more about their consumers, markets and competitors. They use Attest to develop new products, test creatives, measure their brand, gain real-time feedback on trends and make better decisions, faster.

We’re backed by leading VCs, including Oxford Capital and Episode 1 (investors behind LoveFilm, Zoopla, Betfair, Shazam, CarWow and many other greats), plus several high-powered amazing Angel investors.


Diversity statement

Diversity matters, and we celebrate it at Attest! We’re building an inclusive place to work where everyone feels they belong. We see you and you’re welcome here. Attest doesn’t discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic including race, religion or belief, gender or gender reassignment, age, sexual orientation, marital status, or disability.

We want to give everyone the opportunity to showcase their best selves during the interview process and beyond. Do let us know if there are any adjustments you’d like to make to ensure it’s more inclusive – we’re learning too, so we’re more than happy to adapt and accommodate where possible.

items.content:
Facebook Ad Manager

Marketing
US, Canada, Australia, New Zealand
Company: Hubbard Digital Pty. Ltd.
Contract

Overview

We’re hiring a highly experienced Facebook ad manager to work on big budget campaigns for our top tier clients. You’ll be designing and implementing cutting edge strategies and scaling them to 7 figures and beyond while exceeding our client’s KPI’s.

We’ve been managing Facebook ads for top tier clients in the information product and coaching spaces for 5+ years and have become one of the leading Facebook ad agencies out there.

We need you to pioneer and innovate to create, implement and manage ad campaigns that incorporate every tool ad our disposal (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger bots etc.) to deliver outstanding results for our clients.

If you’re an expert with Facebook ads and you have extensive experience in the information product (online course) and/or coaching world we’d love to hear from you.

Here are some examples of what we do:

  • We recently started working with a client who is selling a $497 online course. We took them from a $200/day spend generating a 200% ROAS, to spending over $2,500 USD / day and generating a 250% ROAS. (In other words, from $12k in sales per month to over $100k in sales from a ~$30k spend)
  • We’re working with a client who has a large membership site. They were bringing in new members for $80 each before working with us. A few months in we’re bringing in new members for $35 each (on a $47/month product) This role is important because our client’s results are a top priority for us, and as an ad manager you are responsible for continuing to deliver these outstanding results.

    • This is a contract position, starting part-time with a view to move to full-time as quickly as possible (within 3 months).

    What will you accomplish in this role?

    You’ll deliver outstanding results for clients using Facebook and Instagram ads. Our goal is to support you on your journey from being in the top 1% of Facebook and Instagram advertisers in the world to the top 0.1%.

    Innovative strategies and tactics are encouraged and celebrated. We’re all about creative problem solving based on data.

    You’ll be given the freedom, flexibility and budget to experiment, test and stay on the cutting edge of FB and IG advertising. Your professional development and research is supported and compensated in order to keep you at the forefront of Facebook and Instagrams rapidly changing advertising environment.

    You’ll be implementing our industry leading methodologies and strategies for promoting online courses and coaching programs to achieve the highest possible ROAS for our clients.

    What we care about is: 1) delivering outstanding results for our clients; and 2) you love what you do every day and wake up excited to do it

    We don’t let a day go by without finding a way to improve our results based on the data available to us.

    In this role you will:

    1. Design and implement full-funnel ad strategies that achieve the highest possible revenue for our clients. We’re not just focused on lead generation. We implement full-funnel ad strategies with the sole goal of maximising our clients’ return on their advertising investment.

    2. Analyse data from large-scale ad campaigns and use that to optimize and design new tests

    3. Work directly with our amazing clients, providing insights, data and recommendations to go above and beyond for our clients. We go above and beyond for our clients to help them get the most out of their advertising investment.

    4. Scale our clients businesses to $100k USD / month in profitable ad spend and beyond

    5. Help companies use webinars, video series’, and other sales funnels to generate millions of dollars per year in revenue with a complete behind the scenes look at these businesses

    As a senior ad manager, we expect you to take ownership of the management and results of your ad accounts. You will be a daily “in-the-weeds” practitioner (aka: strategising, optimising, testing, analysing and reporting) as well as communicating with clients and your team.

    You will own 2 numbers as a senior ad manager:

    1. % of your accounts exceeding client KPI’s

    2. Monthly ad spend for each of your clients

    You’ll walk away from your time at Hubbard Digital having run advertising campaigns for some of the biggest companies in the online education and training space. You’ll also have a wealth of experience working on huge product launches and multi million dollar evergreen ad campaigns.

     

     

    Who will you work with?

    You will work directly with me (Andrew Hubbard, the CEO) and your team will consist of an account manager (who you will directly report to), and 2 other full time ad managers who you will work alongside.

    You’ll also interact with our graphic design team and video editors, as well as other core team members such as VA’s and support staff.

     

    Where will you work?

    We all work remote – Andrew, our CEO and founder is in Australia, and we also have team members scattered around North America.

    That means you have the flexibility to work from home, a coworking location, or wherever you do your best work.

     

    What are our core values?

    Everything we do is dictated by a core set of values shared by every team member.

    We care about our clients like they are our business partners. Our decisions are always based around delivering the best outcome for our clients. Integrity and honesty at all times.

    We value the relationships with our clients and our team extremely highly. Open, transparent, timely communication with clients and our internal team members is paramount.

    We value balance between work and personal time. You’re encouraged to take public holidays off, and we back that up by making those paid days off. Our team members also get paid vacation time each year (yes, even as contractors).

    We take a data-driven approach to managing our clients ad accounts.

    We’re a team of creative problem solvers and are insatiably curious. We’re creative and innovative. If we’re faced with problems we get in and figure it out – whatever that takes.

    We’re a leader in the field and deliver outstanding results for our clients because we focus on innovation and creating ad campaigns that are at the forefront of the digital marketing world. Our clients are in turn leaders in their respective fields.

    We only work with clients who are already successfully selling over 6-figures per year, have established sales funnels and are ready to pour fuel on the fire using paid advertising. Why? Because our client’s success is the most important thing to us. And we make sure our clients are in a position to succeed before we partner with them.

    We believe that by helping others who are making a difference and providing products and services that help others succeed, we can amplify that effect 10x and allow them to create an even bigger impact.

    Our goal is first to provide outstanding results for our clients that no other ad agency can match (we’re in the business of making them money), and also providing an outstanding experience for each of our clients that makes them delighted to work with us.

     

    REQUIREMENTS
    • 2+ Years of Facebook Advertising Experience
    • 2+ Years of Experience With Online Sales Funnels / Webinars
    • 2+ Years of Copywriting Experience
    • 1+ Years of Experience With Online Courses (Marketing, selling, creating etc.)
    • (Preferred) Facebook Blueprint Certification (We’ll pay to certify you if you aren’t already)
    • (Preferred) Remote Work Experience
    • Able to work part-time at first (up to 3 months), before moving to a full time contractor role

      •  

      BENEFITS
      • Work from anywhere (we’re 100% remote)
      • Occasional event and conference tickets
      • Competitive salary (negotiable based on experience)
      • Paid public holidays
      • Bonuses
      • Unlimited education allowance
        • Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Director of Strategic Accounts

Sales
USA
Salary plus bonus and options
Company: Braintrust
Full Time

Overview

Braintrust is the first freelance talent marketplace that is owned by its users.

Our core beliefs:
  • While talent is equally distributed around the world opportunity is not.
  • The old models are of how people work are dull, outdated and in urgent need of reinvention.
  • People should be able to do the work they love, on their own terms, and keep 100% of the value.

    • That’s why we decided to start Braintrust. To build the future of work.

    We’re on the cutting edge of a massive shift in the way that people work. Our platform enables talented people around the world to connect with organizations needing highly skilled workers for mission-critical projects.  Braintrust leverages blockchain technology to ensure incentives stay aligned across all network participants: freelancers, organizations that need talent, and those that help build the network.

    We’re founded by 3 successful serial entrepreneurs:  Adam Jackson, Gabriel Luna-Ostaseski and Brian Flynn. We raised a $5m seed round from leading Silicon Valley investors including IDEO, True Ventures, Homebrew, Galaxy Digital and Uprising.

    Come build the future of work with us.

    See our WSJ feature:  

    https://www.wsj.com/articles/venture-backed-project-would-cut-out-middlemen-in-freelance-work-11544529600

    Position Description

    As BrainTrust’s Director of Strategic Accounts you will be responsible for selling our platform to Mid-Market and Enterprise customers.

    Given the early stage of the company, you’ll be heavily involved in developing, testing and iterating on our Go-to-market plan.

    Our pipeline is largely created by our referral engine, product, and PR but this role will involve building and executing the system for converting interest into new customers. In addition, this role will involve building, testing and iterating on a targeted account strategy for VIP Customers.

    You will work closely with Braintrust’s Founding Team to be a member of a small but highly functional team of serial entrepreneurs.

    This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere in the USA.

    Qualifications:
    • : Minimum of 5 years as a top performing individual contributor in a full cycle role selling services to mid-market and enterprise customers.
      • Proven Sales Experience
    • : You’re the hardest working person you know
      • Work ethic and determination
    • :  You’re deeply competitive and have a desire to win.
      • Competitive nature
    • : You’ll be working as part of a distributed team and will need to organize your days, priorities and commitments.
      • Highly organized
    • : You must have a strong understanding of how to navigate a large organization to assess which accounts/projects are in need of our specific resources, as well as a strong critical thinking ability to evaluate the merit of creative new tactics.
      • Sales Skills
    • : Solid understanding of agile methodologies and software development life cycle as well as sufficient technical expertise to sell complex software projects without needing a sales engineer.
      • Technical expertise
    • : a Proven track record of working within a distributed team. You must have exceptional discipline, attention to detail, and motivation.
      • Independence
    • : You must deeply care about helping organizations solve their innovation challenges. Core Responsibilities
      • Empathetic

      Core Responsibilities:
      • Develop and expand key accounts
      • Refine qualification and account prioritization criteria that will be used to qualify leads and accounts.
      • Be responsible for the full cycle (from lead generation through closing) of mid-market and enterprise customers.
      • Manage the relationships, work with our fulfillment team and build a strategy for how we expand the size of large customers spend on the platform.
      • Assist in identifying, recruiting and onboarding additional members of the sales organization.
      • Assist in developing lead generation sources and campaign development

        • Compensation and Benefits:
        • Base Salary: $150,000
        • OTE: $250,000k and beyond with uncapped commissions
        • Attractive option grant
        • Flexible time off
        • Work from anywhere
        • Shared experiences and offsite with team members from around the world
        • Work with great brands and help solve real-world innovation challenges
        • An opportunity to be on the ground floor and build a platform that will shape the future of work

          • Our Commitment to Equal Opportunity:

          We are excited to work with and welcome applications from anyone who shares our values and who are qualified for the role that they apply for regardless of race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, familial pedigree, education, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or veteran status.

          Apply for job

items.title: Fit Small Business: Junior Writer for Credit Card & Bank Accounts - (Remote Friendly)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Junior Writer for Credit Card & Bank Accounts - (Remote Friendly)

Company: Fit Small Business
Headquarters: New York, NY
Visit company website

Your Job in a nutshell: The Junior Writer covering business credit cards and bank accounts will be an integral part of building the most comprehensive small business finance portal on the internet.

Credit cards and bank accounts are the most heavily used financial products among small businesses and you’ll help us give them the in-depth analysis they deserve. We’ll be covering everything from interest rates and fees to loyalty & rewards programs to employee card management.

This position includes:

  • Writing in-depth comparison articles of deposit accounts and credit cards.
  • Researching and writing articles about employee spending, travel policies, etc.
  • Building up expert sources for interviews and engagement to enrich our content
  • Updating account & product information.
  • Providing detailed responses to reader questions.
  • Developing infographics and visuals to support written content.
  • Building online tools like calculators and document templates.

Our mission: To deliver the best answers to people's questions.

Named to the Inc. 500 list of America’s fastest-growing private companies, Fit Small Business has more than three million small business owners and managers reading our content each month. We deliver well-researched, authoritative articles so these owners can make informed decisions to grow businesses that fuel the economy. Our founders have built successful businesses before, and FSB is profitable with no outside funding. Part of the team of 150+ people is in our NYC headquarters, near Grand Central. Others are distributed across the U.S., Canada, and the Philippines.

Does this sound like you?

The best candidates will be strong writers and have high attention to detail. They will have a strong understanding of credit cards, deposit accounts, credit scores, and credit reports. You should have a desire to stay on top of all the latest offers and how small business owners can most effectively take advantage of them.

Qualifications for success:

  • At least 2 years of relevant experience.
  • You are a great researcher and writer.
  • You are high energy, and passionate about helping small businesses.
  • You are comfortable working in a startup environment, where things change quickly.
  • You have a strong work ethic.

Tools We Use:

Wordpress, Insightly, G Suite, Slack, Trello, Guru

*It’s fine if you haven’t used these. Just be enthusiastic to learn them.

What we offer you:

  • Competitive salary
  • Quality health insurance (subsidized by FSB)
  • Traditional & Roth 401K plans with matching from first day
  • Vision, dental, disability and life insurance
  • Flexible Spending Accounts and Commuter Benefits
  • PTO
  • Flexibility
  • Perks and discounts via our PEO
  • A collaborative workplace, which will challenge you and celebrate your work
  • A chance to learn with and from interesting and enthusiastic colleagues
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Fit Small Business: B2B Sales Writer - (Remote Friendly)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
B2B Sales Writer - (Remote Friendly)

Company: Fit Small Business
Headquarters: New York, NY
Visit company website

B2B Sales Writer - Remote Friendly

Your Job in a Nutshell: You will be our resident expert in B2B and consultative selling, including topics such as sales tools (like CRMs), sales strategies, sales cycles, sales management, prospecting, lead nurturing, closing the deal, and more.

Candidates should have direct experience selling products or services to other businesses in a B2B environment. Strong candidates should also have a great network of people with selling experience, such as salespeople, sales managers, executives, and entrepreneurs.

This position includes:

  • Researching, writing, and editing long-form and actionable articles on sales tools and tactics for salespeople, sales managers, and sales-based small business owners.
  • Conducting interviews with sales professionals and experts (drawing from your own network and leveraging your Fit Small Business title to grow your network).
  • Providing in-depth responses to reader questions on sales-related small business topics for B2B or consultative selling.

Our Mission: To deliver the best answers to people’s questions.

Named to the Inc. 500 list of America’s fastest-growing private companies, Fit Small Business has more than three million small business owners and managers reading our content each month. We deliver well-researched, authoritative articles so these owners can make informed decisions to grow businesses that fuel the economy. Our founders have built successful businesses before, and FSB is profitable with no outside funding. Part of the team of 150+ people is in our NYC headquarters, near Grand Central. Others are distributed across the U.S., Canada, and the Philippines.

Does This Sound Like You?

The best candidates for this sales writer role will be strong writers with direct experience with B2B or consultative selling, such as a salesperson,  sales manager, sales engineer, or someone who’s worked to directly support these types of roles. They will have high attention to detail, and perhaps most importantly, a passionate desire to teach salespeople and business owners how to become better sellers through high-quality written content.

Qualifications for the success:

  • You have at least 2 years of experience in a B2B selling role, with a track record of success.
  • You have experience with sales tools such as customer relationship management (CRM) software.
  • You are self-motivated and able to manage your time with little oversight.
  • You are open to feedback, and strive to learn something new every day.
  • You are passionate about helping small businesses succeed.
  • You want to write for an online publication and are comfortable working in a startup environment where things change quickly.
  • Bonus points if you have experience writing sales-related topics.

Tools we Use:

Wordpress, Insightly, G Suite, Slack, Trello, Guru

*It’s fine if you haven’t used these. Just be enthusiastic to learn them.

What We Offer You:

  • Competitive salary
  • Quality health insurance (subsidized by FSB)
  • Traditional & Roth 401K plans with matching from first day
  • Vision, dental, disability and life insurance
  • Flexible Spending Accounts and Commuter Benefits
  • PTO
  • Flexibility
  • Perks and discounts via our PEO
  • A collaborative workplace, which will challenge you and celebrate your work
  • A chance to learn with and from interesting and enthusiastic colleagues
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Cro Metrics: Account Coordinator
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Account Coordinator

Company: Cro Metrics
Headquarters: Remote
Visit company website

Cro Metrics Account Coordinator


Cro Metrics, a fully-distributed data-driven web experimentation company is seeking to hire an Account Coordinator. The Account Coordinator is responsible for working with our Product Managers to execute successful web experimentation and personalization for a diverse group of clients. 

The Account Coordinator is a natural leader. S/he keeps external and internal stakeholders informed through our engagements, helps shepherd A/B/n tests from concept through launch, responds to client requests and keeps team members accountable for follow-ups and action items. Account Coordinators allow our Product Managers to focus on building client strategies, data and results analysis, insights/iteration and ideation. 

*Our positions are fully remote and to ensure compliance with all applicable labor laws, are open to U.S.-based applicants only. In general, we are not hiring in Washington state, Oregon state, San Francisco, New York, or New Jersey as it is difficult for distributed companies like ours to hire in those locations.*

The ideal candidate will have professional services (agency) experience, is highly detail oriented, and has at least a fundamental understanding of A/B testing and data-driven decision making. Experience with UX/UI and web analytics is a plus.

Direct responsibilities include:

  • Managing status agendas, scheduling, taking meeting notes and distilling them down into reference and action items
  • Writing A/B test specifications, creating mockups (annotated screenshots, simple designs)
  • Updating clients on test status, seeking approvals
  • Working with engineering and QA teams to move tests through implementation along with live test QA and monitoring
  • Assistance with organizing and building client presentations
  • Account management: fielding and routing client questions and issues, disseminating action items

Successful candidates in this role demonstrate:

  • An eye for detail and organization. Minor grammatical errors will jump out at you like a sore thumb. Undocumented resources frustrate you. Inbox zero is life. Note that this is not an ability but a strong personal drive to stay organized at all times.
  • Comfort communicating and listening diplomatically. Successful Account Coordinators listen thoughtfully and address the root problem while holding others accountable.
  • Ability to juggle multiple initiatives at once. Individual tasks in most engagements are generally not insurmountable, however there may be many distinct tasks moving at once - keeping them organized and done is paramount.
  • Experience and comfort working with teams and people of all shapes and sizes. Every client team will come with their own culture, quirks, and individual likes and desires. Successful Account Coordinators are able to assimilate into teams as if they are one of their own as opposed to an outside consultant.

What crushing it in this role looks like:

  • Every meeting is productive, clients are always informed, and no client ever needs to ask “Hey did you do the thing you said you were going to do?”
  • Working in tandem with Product Managers to drive successful outcomes for our clients. You feel a huge sense of accomplishment knowing you're part of a team that's helping deliver a positive business impact to each of our engagements. Client success translates to team success which translates to your success.
  • Embracing data-driven decision making and letting that guide everything you do. 


If you have questions as you go through this, make notes and if we haven’t answered them by the end, feel free to email mike@crometrics.com. 


Benefits
  • Matching 401k on the first 4% of income subject to a 3 month waiting period.
  • 100% remote, continue to work from where you are based. (However, this doesn’t mean ultimate freedom, this is a full time job where you get to work from where you live.)
  • Liberal vacation policy.
  • All the professional gear you need to be successful (e.g. macbook, monitor, and noise-cancelling blackwire headset)


Our Culture
Please read our about our culture on our culture page and our main jobs page.

A unique hiring process – we pay you to interview

We’ve found that the best candidates shine most when they are able to participate directly with the team and show their skills in action. This does require some work from you, so we’ll pay you to join the team during a “paid interview”.

Assuming your submission exceeds expectations, we will reach out to schedule a few informal conversations with our team to learn more about you, and provide an opportunity for you to ask questions of us. If all goes well for both you and Cro Metrics, we will hire you for a paid interview where you start working with us for approximately one week (12-15 hours max) as a 1099 contractor. This can be done on the side of your current full-time job so there is less risk to you.

If both parties like working together, we expand the relationship into a full time W2 role. If not, we go our separate ways and both sides “won” in the deal.

items.title: 51Blocks: Sales Manager
items.content:
Sales Manager

Company: 51Blocks
Headquarters: Denver, CO (Remote Work)
Visit company website

51Blocks is here to help businesses grow to their full potential. We work directly with entrepreneurs and owners across many different industries in the United States. We also specialize in working with other digital agencies in the form of white label marketing partnerships to help with strategy and fulfillment. We’re proud to be celebrating 10 years in 2019!

What we need:

We’re looking for someone who can lead our sales space by nurturing leads we’re bringing in through our own marketing efforts, our White Label partners, and ideally self sourcing their own leads for 51Blocks. This position does take a lot of independance and an innovative mind to be successful since you’ll be working close with our leadership team who will be supporting you running your own space.There is no cold calling involved in this role, but we do need someone who can bring a solid track record for growing sales in a digital marketing space.

Expectations:

  • Proficient speaking to digital marketing services (SEO, PPC, websites, hosting, etc)

  • Experience with Trello, Propeller, & Slack a plus

  • Experience in managing a sales department

  • Ability to create funnels and track leads through the pipeline

  • Ability to hit monthly target revenue goals by 60 days post hire

  • Ability to respond to leads quickly and efficiently without overthinking the process -- we have a great team who will be helping with quotes you send

  • Excellent problem solving skills

  • Knowledge of latest SEO, CRO best practices to help pitch services

  • Accepts ownership of the sales space and looks for new opportunities to improve overall process.

Our Remote Environment:

We’re a small digital marketing team with a lot of clients, so our goal is to be as efficient as possible. We all work online during standard business hours and maintain a high level of independence, organization, and communication with each other. If you’ve worked remote in a role like this before, that’s a plus! A big part of our culture is being part of a team, not acting as a freelancer-- so be prepared to meet some pretty cool people that you’ll get to work with on a daily basis!

  • US Based - You must be based in the US-- Please DO NOT APPLY if you’re outside the United States.

  • We work 7:30am-4:30pm MST.

  • This will be an hourly position. Project load may vary but will begin at a part-time basis of 10-15 hours.  With proficiency and a good work ethic, this will increase as the need arises.

  • Pay - TBD

  • Moving Fast - We will be moving fast with this position so please have availability to start right away.

REQUIREMENTS FOR APPLICATION:

If you are interested please respond with a unique cover letter, your current resume, and a 90-day plan with goals of what you would hope to accomplish and a compensation plan you would like to see. You will be selling SEO, PPC, email marketing automation and other digital products so you should be familiar with the industry of digital marketing as a whole.

items.title: Manager, Promotional Review Committee – Medical Affairs
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Manager, Promotional Review Committee – Medical Affairs at Salix Pharmaceuticals

Remote
  • Job Location: US-FIELD
  • Job ID: 11618
  • Pos. Category: R&D

Overview

Bausch Health Companies is a diverse and decentralized pharmaceutical company that is committed to focusing on our key stakeholders while delivering consistently high performance. Our values provide the overall direction for our company, and provide us with the tools necessary to rise to any challenge by leveraging our collective hard work and effort along with our unwavering competitive spirit. These values help us set goals based on our organization’s potential and what we hope it will become.

Responsibilities

The Manager of Medical Affairs is a member of Ortho Dermatologics’ Promotional Review Committee (PRC). This individual collaborates with legal, compliance, and commercial committee members to guarantee that the proposed promotional tactics and programs as well as educational materials comply with federal, state, and company regulations and policies. This individual is responsible for detailed evaluation of the completeness and accuracy of clinical evidence provided in support of prospective claims and ascertains consistency with FDA-approved product labeling. Additional job responsibilities will consist of publications, sales and medical affairs associate training and general assistance to projects the Medical Directors are involved in.

This position is based in Ortho Dermatologics headquarters in Bridgewater, NJ although working remote would be considered. It reports to Vice President, Medical Affairs Ortho Dermatologics.

Qualifications

  • Advanced degree, PhD, PharmD, or MD in health care field
  • Experience in Pharma industry and PRC preferred
  • Knowledge of FDA requirements related to the Promotional Review Committee (PRC) Committee function
  • Established expertise in drug information
  • Motivated self-starter with a positive attitude
  • Demonstrated project management ability
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
  • Strong administrative management skills
  • Proven ability to work effectively with others
Apply for job

items.title: Sales Associate
tags: DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Sales Associate at Lean Startup Co.

Remote | Entry-level | Part-time

Sales Associate (Part-time)

The position is 100% remote. We ask that you’re located in the US and available to communicate during PT business hours.

Who are we?

Born from the global movement spawned by bestselling-author Eric Ries, Lean Startup Company offers an advanced methodology that allows organizations to succeed in innovative ways.

Our skilled faculty provide year-round transformative practices focused on impact, outcomes, learning, and the mindset necessary to help companies thrive in a fast-paced environment. We serve every size company and sector of the economy — from the aspiring entrepreneur to high-growth startups, nonprofits, and large bureaucratic institutions and connect them with experts who can support them on their Lean Startup journey.

If you’ve ever wanted to be a part of a team that creates impact with legacy organizations, the Sales Associate role might be the role for you!

Who are we seeking?

The Sales Associate will work on a range of sales projects and activities supporting the day-to-day sales operations and initiatives of the Lean Startup Company (part-time role, 10-20 hours/week).

The ideal candidate for this role is extremely detail oriented, is an excellent communicator and thrives in a fast-paced environment. This candidate is proactive, has an ownership and “get-things-done” mentality and is extremely solution-oriented while being open to coaching and guidance along the way. The ideal candidate is someone who has a high level of personal accountability and a willingness to take calculated risks.

As a small and growing team, the Sales Associate role is critical to our success. This role offers significant growth opportunities and career advancement within the sales and client management teams.

What you’ll be doing:

As the Sales Associate, you will be the glue supporting both the sales and client management team on projects such as:

  • Sales Enablement Projects and Initiatives
    • Update and maintain sales resource library and Google Drive System.
    • Update Salesforce with missing required fields for leads, contacts, and opportunities.
    • Update and maintain sales templates.
    • Work with the sales and client management team to manage processes related to customer relationship management.
  • Sales Team Preparation
    • Research prospects and prepare notes for business development calls.
    • Prepare presentation decks for sales team pitches.
  • Qualify New Prospects- Top Funnel
    • Reaching out to past leads to re-engage, e.g., email and phone campaigns.
    • Social media campaigns e.g., post of Twitter and engagement with prospects on LinkedIn.
  • Other Sales and Client-Related Task
    • Work with the client management team to ensure our client engagements are well-prepared and successful.

What you’ll need:

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.
  • Simple, direct and clear communication style.
  • Minimum 2 years professional experience as a sales assistant.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills; organizational and time management skills.
  • Reliable, responsive, and consistently meets deadlines.
  • Strong personal sense of professionalism, responsibility, and accountability.
  • Strong relationship management skills and emotional intelligence.
  • A willingness to embrace change and to adapt new strategies on the fly.
  • Experience with and enjoys working remotely and collaboratively (Slack, Zoom, Trello, Google apps).
  • Ability to juggle and prioritize many different tasks simultaneously, and enjoys collaborating with a wide range of team members.

It would be nice for you to have:

  • Experience with Salesforce.
  • Experience creating content for sales collateral (whitepapers, emails, etc.).
  • Previous knowledge and/or experience with the Lean Startup methodology is a plus!

You’ll be the right fit for our team if:

  • You’re curious and resourceful. You love solving problems and aren’t afraid to tackle new challenges.
  • You have a strong sense of ownership and urgency as it relates to the health of the company.
  • You possess high levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.
  • You are open to feedback, take ownership of your mistakes, and love applying your lessons learned to grow.
  • You have a keen ability to manage competing and changing priorities.
  • You work well with cross-functional teams and hold yourself accountable for your actions.

Why work for Lean Startup Company?

We’re a relentless group of self-starters who are committed to doing what’s right, which extends first and foremost to the organizations we provide services to. Our employees have the opportunity to tackle new challenges daily and we encourage and support one another in our everyday work. At the Lean Startup Company, each team member plays a critical role in moving the needle. If you think you’re ready to work hard and join a dedicated and passionate team, then we encourage you to apply to the Sales Associate role today!

The Lean Startup Company is headquartered in San Francisco, CA. This position and our team are 100% remote. Our only request is that you’re located in the U.S. and are available to communicate during Pacific Time business hours.

Apply for job

items.title: Flosum: Territory Manager
items.content:
Territory Manager

Company: Flosum
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
Visit company website

“Software is Eating the World” and we’re Happy About It.

Marc Andreessen was right when he said that almost a decade ago, in fact it’s truer today than it was then. Companies need to prove their worth. They need to build strong cultures, delight their customers, and establish their own competitive advantages.

One of the ways they are doing that is turning to Salesforce as a development platform. As awesome as Salesforce is (we are entirely built on the native platform) there are many gaps in the tools utilized for Salesforce development. Teams struggle with outdated, cobbled-together solutions.

Most dev-ops vendors were leveraging the tools built for traditional development platforms and did not handle the unique needs of the Salesforce platform, causing great inefficiencies and frustrations.

So we built Flosum.

About Us:

Flosum helps hundreds of companies of all shapes and sizes efficiently and effectively manage their Salesforce development needs.

The Flosum team now spans seven time zones and supports clients at some of the top companies in the world. Our solution has garnered praise and top awards from users and organizations alike.

We help developers that have focused on the most important CRM platform deliver their apps securely and consistently.

About You:

You want to be among the first members of a fast growing global software company.

You want to be a part of a true team, where the best idea wins, no matter where it comes from? Where your opinion counts, and actually be used?

This is a career and company that values Lifelong Learning at an accelerated rate. The investment we will provide for your education can be the building blocks for all your success in the years to come.

Is it tough?

Sure, sometimes.

But it is also rewarding and challenging and will test you and mold you into a future master of your own destiny.

Your Skills:

  • A Love of learning and experimentation
  • A Passion for problem solving
  • Ambition & Motivation to Win
  • Outstanding Written & Verbal Communication
  • A willingness to contribute ideas
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Ability to connect and influence developers
  • High level of energy, motivation, initiative, commitment and professionalism
  • Experience managing and closing complex sales-cycles
  • Enterprise Software Sales Experience
  • Extensive CRM experience
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, team environment
  • Should have sold to IT departments

Your Focus:

We are currently looking for a resourceful, driven, team player with a competitive spirit, and strong business acumen to help our customers reach new levels of customer success.

If you have a curiosity for technology, a passion for making your customers successful, and the ability to articulate the ROI of an enterprise solution across multiple stakeholders, then this could be the role for you.

Successful Account Executives have experience doing deep levels of discovery and objection handling at every level. They are engaged with their customers at every level of the sales cycle, from account planning, through the development of the deal, to the close of business, and beyond. They are trusted advisors to the C-Suite and the end users.

Our goal is to build an organization of smart, ambitious sales professionals, committed to our mission and focused on winning, but able to balance this with a respectful, healthy environment and lifestyle.

You will be responsible for growing existing business as well as proactively identifying, engaging, and winning new business.

Are you suited for this?

Competitive - not just against your business rivals but also against yourself. You are in control of your success.

Collaborative - sure there’s a time to be an individual and focus on your own work, but we are a team and the more you give the more you get

Consistent - you'll hear “No” more than “Yes”, can you handle that and put in the effort even on the hard days?

Coachable - you’re smart (we like that) but there is always room for improvement. Can you take feedback and put it to use? Can you offer constructive feedback to your team so we all grow?


What's in it for you:

Well there's the good stuff:

  • Significant salary with unlimited commission upside
  • Insurance active after first full quarter of salaried employment
  • 3 weeks of paid vacation plus paid holidays
  • Leadership / Career Development Programs

Then there's the great stuff:

  • Fully remote so you can work from wherever you choose in North America.
  • All expense paid training program in CDMX, Mexico
  • Company sponsored events, travel, & shenanigans.
  • You are measured by your results, not your experience or how long you've been working in the same place.
  • Your ideas matter. We don’t care where the best idea came from as long as we put the best solution in place.
  • Open leadership style - talk to our founder directly at any time and let them know what you think
  • Fast career progression - there is no greater meritocracy than sales.
  • Exposure to decision makers and industry leaders that you just don't get in other roles to grow faster.
  • You’ll be working in the greatest market in the world these days... Software.

We have BIG plans for our industry and North America and are looking for some help to shake things up. This full-time position is remote but there is an initial training program held in the awesome metropolis that is Mexico City (passport required).

If this sounds like you, apply now.

Don't forget your video explaining why you were born to do this role. Take your time and complete the application completely. This is your first test and chance to show your attention to detail.
