items.title: Client Services Account Manager
items.content:
Client Services Account Manager at EmoryDay

Remote

PLEASE DO NOT APPLY UNLESS YOU HAVE AT LEAST 2 YEARS OF ONLINE MARKETING & CLIENT RELATIONS EXPERIENCE AT AN ESTABLISHED MARKETING COMPANY.

EmoryDay is looking for experienced marketing professionals to join our client services team. As an Account Manager, you will be responsible for managing the Internet Marketing needs for individual clients. In this position, you will be the primary lead on the account and be responsible for weekly client calls (presentations), managing all marketing initiatives, providing campaign analysis/results, and being the main point of contact for assigned clients.

As a full service Internet marketing company, we provide business marketing services to companies in need of a full service outsourced solution. Our teams meet with our clients regularly to progressively improve and manage all aspects of their Internet marketing, including:

  • Website Design
  • Content Development
  • Lead Generation
  • Email Development/Marketing
  • Search Engine Marketing
  • Newsletters
  • Social Media & Publicity

As a Client Services Account Manager, you will coordinate and work with a small team of professionals to deliver these services to clients, but you will be solely responsible for the overall success of the account.

Experience:

  • Ideal candidates will have a minimum of two years’ experience in online media or corporate agency marketing.

Skills:

  • Critical thinking skills are vital to the success of online marketing managers, in addition to analytical problem-solving skills.
  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Possess strong interpersonal and project management skills, as interaction with clients and presentations will be required.
  • Must be comfortable with all Microsoft Office programs and Internet applications like Google Docs.
  • Possess an understanding of website development techniques, content management systems and creative design is a plus.
  • Ability to trouble shoot and maintain your personal computer system.
  • Must be self-motivated.

Responsibilities:

  • Create and maintain agendas and follow up reports for client meetings
  • Provide project management of marketing initiatives for the client
  • Create and maintain timelines and schedules of projects.
  • Manage client communications over the phone and email.
  • Develop comprehensive online marketing strategies for clients.
  • Review, write and optimize website content to ensure both search engine visibility and favorable user experience.
  • Coordinate and develop regular e-newsletter creation and distribution for clients.
  • Implement a variety of forms of social media to promote brand recognition and promotions and to drive traffic to company websites
  • Track and monitor site traffic and optimize campaigns based on the best-performing strategies.

Work Environment:

All of our consultants and employees work virtually. The opportunity provides a certain amount of flexibility timing and the number of hours worked. Most of our consultants work from home offices and each provide their own computers to work from.

Apply for job

items.title: SQA Test Manager
items.content:
SQA Test Manager at GovernmentCIO

Remote
  • Job Locations: US-Remote
  • Job ID: 2019-1897
  • # of Openings: 2
  • Category: Information Technology

Overview

The SQA Test Manager, will execute the test planning, assessment, development, and execution tasks associated with increment, sustainment, and break fix code releases for assigned areas. Identify and mitigate risks and advise IAM Test Manager about risks. Coordinate and communicate test script development activities with Requirements, Technical Lead, Project Management, IAM Integration Testing, Access Services Development, Consuming Application staff. Recommend solutions to be used for planning, scheduling, and tracking testing activities by utilizing multiple project management and test tools which include Rational Jazz, Rational Quality Manager, VA ProPath templates, MS Project, Primavera, Visio, and Sharepoint. Adhere to quality management standards and procedures. Adhere to VIP processes and procedures. Possess good oral and written communication skills.

Responsibilities

  • Ensure requirements traceability to legally binding requirements
  • Use Rational Jazz for Change, Configuration, Requirements and Test Case and Results management
  • Develop test procedures, test cases (frontend, backend and integration), test plans, requirements traceability, schedules, and test reports
  • Ensure compliance with test processes and procedures
  • Maintain the SQA Test Library for Access Services
  • Coordinate, execute, document, and report on test activities required to support the release of Access Services functionality
  • Serve as primary point of contact with Business Stakeholders for SQA and User Acceptance testing
  • Coordinate, execute, document, and report on test activities required to support the integration of Access Services functionality with consuming applications
  • Coordinate test preparation activities to include setting up the SQA test environment and data
  • Review and approve contractor test plans and scripts
  • Work with development teams and Project Managers to resolve test defects
  • Verify readiness of release through release review process;
  • Estimate level of effort based upon tasks and responsibilities specific to tester functions

Qualifications

  • Years Experience: 15 years total IT experience. The SQA Tester must have at least 8 years experience planning, implementing, and executing software testing processes; have experience with Rational Quality Manager, Rational Functional Tester, and Rational Performance Tester software and building test scripts. Have a clear understanding between functional and regression testing.
  • Desired Skills: The candidate should be proficient in MS Office Word, Excel, and Powerpoint as well as Information Technology Testing tools. Proficiency in MS Visio and IBM Rational tool is desired. The candidate must also possess good communication, analytical, and writing skills. A proven ability to work in a team-oriented environment is also desired. Experience with running test cases using tools such as SOAP UI.
  • Education and Certification: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Management Information System, Systems Engineering.
Apply for job

items.title: Sales Representative
items.content:
Sales Representative at 1105 Media

Remote

Company Overview
The Infrastructure Solutions Group, a division of 1105 Media, includes the media brands HME Business, Mobility Management, School Planning & Management, College Planning & Management, Security Today, Occupational Health & Safety, and Environmental Protection.

Job Summary
The Infrastructure Solutions Group, is seeking an experienced media consultant sales professional for its related print, online and custom products. Candidates will enjoy a fast-paced leading edge environment and a variety of assignments with an innovative media company. The Integrated Media Consultant will support a myriad of online and print products providing a genuine relational and consultative approach with customers to foster repeat business. The portfolio includes print publications, websites, e-newsletters, podcasts, webinars, custom media and other online & print products. This position involves business development and account prospecting, face to face and phone/email selling, networking and industry events, putting together and making presentations, preparing proposals, closing sales, managing online and print programs and customer service.

Sales territory is national (US).
This position can be home-based or from one of 1105’s offices in California or Dallas, TX.

Essential Job Functions:

  • Drive advertising revenue with aggressive sales efforts that penetrate new markets and increase existing market presence
  • Consult with customers to be able to properly articulate the value proposition of a product package that exceeds customer goals and aligns with the business direction
  • Build customer relationships on an ongoing basis
  • Accelerate growing online business through vast knowledge of digital products, deliverables and metrics
  • Weekly forecasting and reporting
  • Work with staff to develop creative advertising packages – both print and online

Minimum Requirements:

  • College degree preferred
  • 3-5 years experience in print and/or online advertising sales and be able to show consistent sales results in previous positions
  • Track record of creativity in sales approaches and solutions
  • Track record of successfully meeting and exceeding sales goals in media sales relevant to 1105 Media’s line of business
  • Excellent client presentation and communication skills as well as strong customer service and organizational skills
  • The ideal candidate is energetic, self-motivated, team-oriented, and customer-centric
  • Required proficiency in MS Office applications and experience with CRM software
  • Understanding of how to research potential customers and use online analytics from a sales perspective
  • Non local travel a few times a year is required

This position offers a salary (plus commission) of up to $100k and you will have the opportunity to earn additional compensation if you exceed your performance/target goals.

We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, disability insurance, 401(k) plan and a generous paid time off (PTO) / holiday plan.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

1105 Media, Inc., is a leading provider of business-to-business media services in the ABM, big data, education, technology, enterprise computing, government technology, and infrastructure markets. 1105’s offerings include print and online magazines, journals, and newsletters, seminars, conferences and trade-shows, training courseware, marketing services, and Web-based services. 1105 Media is based in Woodland Hills,CA with offices throughout the United States.

Apply for job

items.title: Account Executive – Mid-Market
items.content:
Account Executive – Mid-Market at Mixmax

Remote

Location: Remote

We’re looking for an experienced Account Executive to help enable Mixmax’s rapid growth in 2019! Along with outstanding sales experience, the ideal Account Executive will have a passion for technology, new systems and innovative business solutions.

You’ll be helping shape the foundation of our sales team and will be actively involved in strategic decisions and processes. A successful Account Executive will work closely with our inbound SDR partners, but will also have the ability and drive to cultivate their own leads via cold outbound efforts.

You’ll use the platform every day to do your job, so you’ll be expected to quickly become a product expert. You’ll learn new ways to use Mixmax as your customers tightly integrate their organization’s workflows with the platform. And you’ll provide feedback and guidance to the team as the product rapidly evolves. It’s a unique opportunity: you’ll use, sell, and help shape the product.

What will I be doing?

  • Educate prospects about our business solutions
  • Cold-call and email to generate new business opportunities
  • Consult Sales, Customer Success, and Recruiting customers on workflows
  • Prioritize and prospect into accounts in your book of business
  • Manage the AE/SDR partnership and facilitate collaboration in the workplace
  • Prioritize and prospect into accounts in your book of business
  • Be your own project manager: you’ll have the opportunity to manage and renew pilots
  • Achieve and surpass quarterly bookings targets
  • Contribute to the product roadmap as a voice for customer needs
  • Advocate Mixmax to your network, and become a trusted thought leader

What skills do I need?

  • 4+ years of direct SaaS sales experience
  • Entrepreneurial mindset – take intelligent risks, implement new strategies and continuously improve process
  • Hustle – take initiative and independently problem solve
  • Must have negotiation and closing experience
  • Demonstrated track record of high performance and contribution to company growth
  • Proficient in Salesforce
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

What’s nice to have?

  • Experience selling to Sales, Sales Operations, Customer Success and Recruiting teams
Apply for job

items.title: Sales Coordinator
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Sales Coordinator at Kettle & Fire

Remote

Location: Austin TX US

Join one of the fastest growing health food companies out there and revolutionize CPG.

Kettle & Fire is looking for a Rockstar Sales Coordinator to help our sales team skyrocket!

We’ve grown like crazy in the 4 years since we started in 2015. Since then, we’ve raised from the best investors in the CPG space (CAVU Venture Partners), grown 200%+ per year and built one of the strongest teams in all of CPG.

To support our fast growth, we need to add a Sales Coordinator to join our fun, hungry team. Learn more about the team here – https://www.kettleandfire.com/pages/careers

Lastly, you’ll join a fun (we promise), smart and talented group of people. We can promise working at K&F will be one of the best experiences of your career.

Our company has 4 core values each employee must embody:

  • Growth Mindset
    • As a member of K&F, having a growth mindset means your’e willing to take on projects and initiatives that may make you uncomfortable. They may be things that you dont know how to do, or that stretch you a little bit. Thats okay.
  • Radical Candor
    • At a high level, holding radical candor as a value means that we value being extremely candid with someone to help them improve more than we value their feelings.
  • 100% thinking about the customer
    • This one is pretty self-explanatory, but it means that we put our customers first in everything. Can’t decide what the right thing is to do? Think about what the customer would want.
  • Transparency
    • Transparency also builds trust amongst team members, trust between our company and customers, and trust between each and every individual that comes within the Kettle & Fire circle of influence.

Position Summary:

As a member of the Kettle and Fire sales team, you will be providing administrative support, data analysis support, and graphic design support. The ideal candidate for this position has a passion for food, a “can-do” attitude, the ability to successfully multi-task and an insatiable desire to learn. This role is the go-to person managing a variety of detail-oriented tasks for new and exciting initiatives to keep business running smoothly. This is a great role for a detail-oriented self-starter with a positive attitude who loves working with a team of 4 sales professionals to get things done. This dynamic role includes everything from nailing the details of item set-up, creating marketing presentations, and managing sample distribution. Our business is entering a very high growth phase and the day-to-day responsibilities will vary and require adaptability and flexibility. Must be willing and eager to take on new roles and responsibilities, often times with little direction.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

The essential functions include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Support the Sales team with admin tasks to help them perform their daily functions effectively. Process orders, distributor set up forms, category review submissions, promotional forms, and manage vendor portals
  • Coordinate in-person sales demonstrations across the US.
  • Collect and analyze monthly distributor movement reports and business data. Prepare reports for management from data collected each month
  • Systematic and continuous organization of sales documents on the G-Drive.
  • Various data reports updated on a weekly/monthly basis
  • Compile all sales deck, sell sheet and various 1 pager design updates on a weekly/monthly basis
  • Completion of new item forms and paperwork for various retailers/distributors/customers
  • Liaison between other departments, brokers and clients by providing the best service
  • Constantly work with the Sales team to assess the progress of the department and assist with the development of the Sales strategy

Requirements

  • Previous CPG experience preferred
  • Entrepreneurial, can-do attitude
  • Must be organized and possess a high level of administrative ability to effectively manage paperwork
  • Outstanding organizational and follow-up skills
  • Experience in prioritizing work, multi-tasking, and a strong sense of urgency
  • Ability to work remotely and as a part of a team
  • Confident decision maker with an emphasis on detail and data
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Google Drive
  • Ability to work update/modify pre-designed graphic design templates
  • Must be able to work 9am to 5pm EST – no matter your location

Benefits

We can’t take care of others (our customers) without taking care of ourselves (our people) first. That’s why we pay extremely competitive salaries and offer a variety of perks to help you optimize your health.

  • Office Hours: You design your own workday. Work whenever you want, from wherever you want.
  • Vacation & Holidays: We offer three weeks of paid vacation each calendar year. We have a strict policy that you take minimum of two weeks of vacation per year. Along with vacation, we offer 12 paid holidays each year.
  • Health insurance: You have the choice to opt-in to the best health, dental and vision insurance we can get.
  • Nutrition: You get a monthly budget to invest in getting fresh food locally.
  • Fitness: You get a monthly budget to invest in a gym membership, personal trainer, yoga classes, and anything else that helps you increase your physical fitness.
  • Books: We’ll support your reading habits by covering a book a month.
  • Meditation: We cover any app or class you use to improve your meditation consistency.
  • Continued Learning: We cover anything that increases your work skills and provide a monthly budget for developing any personal skills you desire. You want to learn Spanish? Pottery? We have you covered.
  • Free product: You need to be able to brag about how awesome Kettle & Fire products are, so team members get free product for their personal use.
Apply for job

items.title: Salesability: Training & Business Process Writer
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Training & Business Process Writer

Company: Salesability
Headquarters: Austin, TX
Visit company website

This is a remote position available to anyone in North America.

Who you are

You love turning chaos into clarity. You are process or systems oriented and love to solve a good puzzle and turn complex ideas into easy conversations. You love the power of the written word and are not afraid of challenging the status quo.

You like direction, but want to blaze the trail yourself.

What you'll do

You will be responsible for producing process and training system documentation for multiple products. You will help define a strategy to deliver information to users, and then will work to execute that strategy.

You will assess existing practices and needs, and develop a strategy to deliver information to users in the optimal form. You will be writing client-facing and internal documentation.

Responsibilities

  • Document processes for client delivery
  • Take ideas from the founder and create training/support documentation
  • Create/Refine product delivery
  • Help to remove friction of client work
  • Will be working primarily with the founder but will also support the marketing team occasionally.

Skills

  • Great business writing skills
  • Ability to research markets & supporting documentation
  • Should demonstrate superior communication skills, written and verbal
  • understanding of process delivery, experience with project management/delivery
  • Ability to define and maintain documentation standards (consistency, style, etc.)
  • Proven skills as a detail-oriented problem solver with outstanding organizational and analytical skills

Training

There will be in-person training for the first few weeks of the job so you need to be in a position to travel to Mexico. All expenses paid of course.

Perks

  • 100% remote position (live anywhere in North America)
  • Health benefits
  • Travel retreats
  • Training and reading budget
  • There is more opportunity for travel & potential on-site engagement

items.title: Brilliant: Director of Sales
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Director of Sales

Company: Brilliant
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
Visit company website

We are looking for our first sales hire, a Director of Sales, to join our small team of 14 -- you’d be #15. Our team is remote and works from home offices around the US (and one in Mexico!).

This is a unique opportunity to build a sales process and team from the ground up. We are looking for an experienced sales professional who doesn’t mind getting his/her hands dirty and is excited about designing a sales program and building a team from scratch.

We are a self-funded and profitable company -- we’ve built a multi-million dollar business and landed an impressive roster of clients without any focused sales efforts. It is now time to get serious about building a repeatable, scalable sales process and going big!  

This role will entail:

  • Working closely with our CEO and our client-facing team (Creative Partners) to learn about our target client and what has worked and not worked for us in the past
  • Owning our pipeline: defining our sales pipeline, setting goals for our pipeline, managing our pipeline and (at least at first) personally moving through each stage of that pipeline
  • Sourcing leads, outbound outreach, scheduling and leading calls/demos, qualifying clients, and making warm handoffs to our client-facing team
  • Lead training on sales best practices for our client-facing team
  • Within 6-12 months, designing a hiring roadmap and leading hiring for our sales team  

You are:
  • Data driven - you are excited to design thoughtful experiments to measure and maximize the success of our sales pipeline  
  • People person - you enjoy helping clients get to the best answer, and you sell by building real connections between client needs and solutions we can offer
  • A “Brilliant” kind of leader - you are excited to build and manage your own sales team, and partner with our existing team of project managers and engineers but you aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty either
  • Great communicator - you are thoughtful, empathetic and honest, and you excel in building true relationships on the phone, in person and over email
  • Excellent listener - you ask a lot of questions and really listen to the answer. You use those answers to give honest, consultative feedback to clients and our internal team
  • Always learning - you enjoy keeping up with best practices and new techniques, and you want to be an expert in sales and business development
  • Always closing - just kidding, kind of
  • Not above any task - you believe the best way to learn about a process and to learn how to manage a role is to know how to do that role yourself

Experience:
  • Proven record of success in a senior sales role
  • Ideally, you have some experience selling to sales & marketing professionals, in an agency environment or similar, and/or in SaaS sales

Functional skills:
  • Strong writer - you enjoy writing -- you write succinct, thoughtful, accurate and relevant emails, and you’re not afraid to take on other relevant writing tasks like whitepapers
  • Salesforce - you are very comfortable with Salesforce (an expert, someone less humble might say!), and you’re excited to whip our SDC into shape and organize the crap out of our pipeline data
  • Excel - You excel in Excel. You can successfully Pivottable, Vlookup and generally make data do your bidding
  • Tech-savvy - You're tech-savvy and comfortable with Slack, Google Docs and G Suite

And finally:
  • You love branding, design and retail -- you will ultimately be selling prospective clients on Brilliant and our mission to bring their brands to life through impactful branded merchandise, creative packaging and thoughtful collateral
  • #remotelife: You love the freedom remote work brings, and you know that with great freedom comes great responsibility. You’re ready for both

Compensation:
  • $75k base
  • $50k commission year 1 / $75k year 2 (estimated)
  • Open vacation / PTO policy
  • $3k a year in healthcare reimbursement through our QSEHRA program
  • 401k plan and profit sharing
